j1LTfTnRQmpgLsIuLcC5Gw.text: Decent food. BIG portion sizes. Ok service, forgot to bring things that we asked for such as water.

h_J76z4LiTdyTW0lHul-Vw.text: My first trip back in 6 years and it was pretty much the same! The food was still great along with the drinks! We sat out on the patio under an umbrella and it was perfect!! I don't however remember all the ducks from last visit but they add to the atmosphere!

yi__pt7IXqW10j9yHcOFPA.text: Its amazing how much they are charging for their flavorless greasy food. I was so underwhelmed I felt obligated to write this here review, which is also appropriately underwhelming. The best thing about the meal was the iced tea. Oh, I guess the service was decent.

-nf-EhvJLcme0oq8_-eMwA.text: Had the opportunity to eat here during the weekend celebration of one of my best friend's birthday.  We were staying in Tempe as we were also attending the Arizona Jazz Festival.  In a word the customer experience was substandard.  "Joseph" the waiter was not particularly friendly or responsive...Whatever caused his bad day should not have impacted the service provided.  The food was not good at all....two of us had chicken enchiladas...dry, tasteless, with a smear of sauce...black beans and rice had no seasoning at all...so bland.  I asked for more sauce for my enchilada and the server never brought it...apologize for forgetting...although I did see him quickly fulfill the request of a neighboring table for guacamole.  Two things were okay with this experience...the little bridge walkway from the parking lot was great for pictures and when I went to the bar to get surprise Patron shots for us...the bartender was a bit more friendly....Although "Joseph" did condescendingly let me know..."you do know that I can get your drink orders'...in which I wanted to say "Yes...I've been to many restaurants and remember how it works and you would be required to have checked back often enough for me to to have place my order with you".   I will not go back or recommend that anyone go there either.

-Nr_MwOFYmvFHFE_vbZBKw.text: As far as Mexican food goes, this wasn't the best that I have ever had.  However if you work in the area, it is a good destination for clients or family that are in town shopping at Mill, this should be a viable option.  The food is what I would classify as MexiCali.  Definitely not the home raised Mexican food from Tucson.  Give it a shot, Yelp me back and tell me how it was.

Y6oxZgT3K4IhPI0rzJExAw.text: It has been awhile since I have been to Aunt Chiladas....and what a disappointment!  Went with a large group, we had horible service.  We were not brought refills, the food came very slowly.  We had to go track down our server and a manager to request service.   Seems like since they were getting an automatic 20% tip because we were a large group she must have gone on break or something.    Food was very greasy, had oil ladden calabasita and a shredded beaf greasy taco.     The group I was with was a lot of fun....but the food was not good, and teh service horrible.  Next time the group meets it will not be at this place.

s-1xj1xb5mMA56xY_PnWJw.text: The service was pretty good. I had a slight issue with my order that got taken care of quickly. Our waiter was very nice. The atmosphere is very loud if there is anybody else in the restaurant, no sound buffer. Food was not great. I ordered the carne Asada burro. I was looking forward to it, but when it arrived i was disappointed to see it was cut up pot roast. My mother ordered chicken salad, she didn't like the chicken at all. The salsa was nothing special and the guacamole was super spicy. I don't think I will ever come back, but it could be worth it for you.

qwRmRHGVZxqOGt6lUWEiSQ.text: I went there last night for dinner with friends. It's a HUUUGE place...doesn't look that big from the outside, but it's a sprawling establishment. Around 6:30 on a Thursday, they were running full. I would have loved to sit outside on the patio because the weather was so perfect, but we just opted for the first available seats, which were inside. My friend was hungry, so she ordered the Aunt Chilada dip (refried beans, sour cream, guac, and ground beef), and some drinks from the bar. Nothing stellar so far. The waitress came to take our orders as soon as we sat down. I got the Tacos de Pescado, my friends got flautas and tamales. We got salsa and chips to start with. The order came really fast, while we were still finishing our starters. I liked my tacos, though I wish the fish was a little more flavorful and spicy. I added lemon juice liberally and salsa, which made up for the blandness somewhat. My friends said their food was good, though far from authentic. I give three stars to this place mostly because of its ambience. I wish the waitresses would give diners more time at the table though..i felt a tad rushed. But maybe that was because of the crowd. Yeah, I can sure go back here again.

akn0jkQtiRf2ckJLIHaR2w.text: I had the 5 shrimp on the skewers and it was delicious.  I like animals and wildlife so I thought it was cute that ducks were swimming in the outside fountain and also walk around the patio in case someone wants to throw them a chip but you may want to sit inside which we did since it was a work dinner. My co-worker had the chicken fundido which she really liked too. The hostess is friendly.

rIRoV-3A7UwzkbhSmjrWNQ.text: The patio here is so cute and fun! It was to cold to sit outside but the inside was cozy. We had to wait awhile to be seated and after waiting, the bartender finally came over to seat us. The lunch specials are a great value at $7.95. I had the taco and enchilada combo, it comes with refried beans and fideo. I got the spinach con queso inside my enchilada and it was really tasty but everything else was  average mexican food. I think the chips and salsa were the best part. They are great because you get both corn and flour tortilla chips with pico de gallo and hotter sauce. Our waitress didn't come by very often and the service was pretty slow. If I were to go here again I would definitely sit out on the patio and do chips/salsa with a frosty drink.

yN-asSTy0O4G0wKLpYB1ZQ.text: Aunt Chiladas: bad name, even worse food. I'm sorry, but I can't recommend eating here.  I think this restaurant's proximity to the Arizona Grand hotel is the only reason it's still around. We were staying at the Arizona Grand, and decided to order take-out for our group of five people.  I ordered a chicken burrito with rice and beans as a side. What I received was a soggy burrito, with half chicken and half shredded beef (I don't eat red meat). That was unfortunate, but they didn't include the beans either- there was only rice as a side.  I thought the salsa was decent, but the chips were extremely greasy and not really worth eating.  Bottom-line: I'd pass on this place if I were you- there's lots of good Mexican restaurants around here more deserving of your business.

9PCi1XV6Sh5vuIfINBZ53g.text: We went there a year and a half ago and the food and service were great.  Tonight was a different story.  Chips were half full of broken ones on the bottom. Service was indifferent and half-hearted. Food was just OK, if you think that a soggy Chimichanga should have the texture of a burrito and you really, really like salt. Ran out of water. Never refilled. Ran out of chips. Never refilled. Table not bused until the waiter needed a place to put the check.  I noticed that they add a 20 percent gratuity for parties of 6 or more. Thankfully, we were only three. Normally I tip well even for bad service, but not for bad food AND bad service.

AmS25s_hYeeJyAqCJkUCpg.text: I dont want to give Auntie even a one star.. On a beautiful Saturday, my friends  wanted to go sit and have something to drink & have an app , or two. This is tops for happy hour places, that's why we chose it. We opted to sit at the bar outside.. All the tables were reserved for a shower. Every time we were spoken to.. bc no one manned the bar.. it was rudely. We got a cerveza and a marg.. at least those you cant really fail on. The salsa was horrid...& I usually love the Aunts salsa.. we ordered sopapillas.. asked to have them first.. Umm guess not.. THEY never arrived.. Our water ran empty.. our chips and not-so-much salsa ran out... THE end was when our nachos.. had a hair on top.. we told the curt waitress.. & she rolled her eyes and said sorry.. We never saw her again.. THE thing is.. I usually LOVE this place for it's patio and good food , but tonight .. .. I DONT think SO! I left with my appetite ruined.

bwvMh40MmJURzRojdRpakQ.text: My wife, youngest child and myself were visiting my oldest boy in Phoenix on 4/19/15. Since my son goes to school near this restaurant we decided to try it out. That was our first big mistake....We were seated immediately and were given the usual chips and salsa which weren't fresh and more than likely came out of a bag. We ordered the Pollo Fundido ( second mistake ) the Taco salad ( third mistake ) a bowl of the corn and chorizo soup and a tamale plate for my youngest. The first flag went up when the food arrived unusually fast and upon taken my first bite found out why.... My plate, the Pollo Fundido was in various stages of temperature. The plate was scalding hot, the chicken was somewhat warm, the beans were the same, the Mexican spaghetti had obviously been sitting out on the counter for several hours as it had already hardened into a cold lump and last but not least the sauce for the chicken was stone cold !!! I'm not even sure how their kitchen could possibly accomplish all this on one plate but they did...As I waited for the waitress to return, my wife then proceeded to show me the entire avocado pit she had just pulled out of her salad. When the waitress was a no show to the table I flagged down the bus boy and asked him to get our waitress. Not sure if there was a language barrier ( I did ask him twice...) but he promptly just walked over to another table and started cleaning it, completely ignoring my request. The waitress finally showed up and after explaining the short comings of the meal asked to see the manager. This took approximately 10 minutes for the manager to come by the table at which time my family was finishing their respective meals. She told me that she would replace my meal immediately to which I replied "NO" because I did not trust the quality of the food nor their kitchen staff. Long story short, I never ate dinner that night as we had to get on the road back to Tucson, my oldest boy said his soup was "ok" but only ate 1/2, my youngest didn't finish his because he said it had " no taste, my wife got most of the way through hers ( very difficult to screw up a salad...) And, well, you know my end of it. Even with the 2 meals taken off we still wound up paying $34 for a crappy meal !!!!!. Take our word for it, if you want a Mexican meal on a par with this place, go to Taco Bell, at least it will be hot......

3nYIC0jizjz0Ra8z_ncE7Q.text: our server was Jonathan asked for the enchiladas de harina and much to my surprise i recieved a big burrito on the table-i told him i ordered the enchiladas and he said " this is what u ordered its in a tortilla-i didnt eat much of it at the time because i got full on chips and salsa-when i got home the next day i was surprised that the whole "enchilada " was a bunch of shredded beef not the 3 combo enchiladas that was supposed to be one cheese one chicken and ONE beef i ordered so in other words i recieved the wrong item-very disapointed in john

_jb9mMJp2o4YK85EHYPu-Q.text: Went with friends for lunch last week. I've never been- the atmosphere is fun, the place is huge and has an large outdoor seating area. Its like a Macayos on steroids. Anyway, the food was good, and the service would good also. Except for when my friend wanted a simple substitution. Before we know it, 10 minutes have gone by, I've had an entire conversation about something else with the 3rd person in our party and another staff person was brought over. One of my friends called ordering lunch "negotiating". The poor guy gave up and ordered something else entirely. It was good, it was just a weird experience.

iOu_e2tE6wWMTsGJDNUMdQ.text: I really like this place. One of the better Mexican restaurants in the valley. They have great food and their prices weren't outrageous. I sat outside right by a heater... it was heaven. The service was good. Our food was brought out to us right away, but the waiter neglected to notice our empty drink cups. I understand it was busy, and he looked like he was the only one outside at the time, but we were thirsty! All in all, I was satisfied. After we eat there, we usually go and sit up on South Mountain and watch the city lights and walk off the food, lol.

v4ZaMFszeGrnlG_oMf1bOw.text: Pretty average Mexican food with friendly service. Outdoor seating can be really dark and sort of uncomfortable because of their low chairs. Prepare for a large retiree/vacation crowd from the nearby Arizona Grand Resort.

ncoJjqxmoPlR8NITy78KGA.text: Saw this place on Yelp so thought I would give it a try, sorry I did. The salsa is one of the worst I have ever tried. People in the rest of my party were also very displeased with their entrees to say the least. Ordered a cocktail, which the waitress just raved about, why I don't know. Was basically a kool-aide drink in a cocktail glass. But here lies my biggest problem. Started with the guacamole, chips and salsa. Not the best but eatable. Here comes my entree, OMG. I thought I was going to die! Literally! Two bites or so and I start feeling queasy. And I mean this crap won't stop. So I take a trip to the rest room and figure I will let it pass. But my stomach says different. I started throwing up there proceeded to come home and couldn't stop until every little thing I had eaten at that God forsaken place was out of my system. Will I try it again? I say not. When I told the waitress about the incident she was very nice and quite apologetic. The other women that was called over never introduced herself and was quite rude. Offered to take it off my bill and that was that. By the way I ordered plate # 2 with a green tamale al a cart. I still feel queasy just thinking about it. Good thing there were no great smells or aromas or I probably would not be able to eat this combo any where else either. And to think I went there with such great expectations. I wish that woman, whom ever she may be, would have been courteous. Then maybe I might think of giving them another, try not. Lol.

8DDhOcTo2BDOIiknJrNtEA.text: Simply, too expensive for the bland tasting food. Not authentic, service is slow, and the fideo is gross.

t7Yyod7HW2A_Cwl3FNlucg.text: Love this place ! Lunch time they have great specials ! Their chimichangas are something else! And the salsa ... yum! totally will come back!

60k0gp3ZiuWoMJUJ2dC2Jw.text: Great Mexican Cuisine, chips and salsa are awesome, great portions at a fair price. Make sure to order some queso dip for your chips, and choose the Fideo as your side with entree. A must try when you are craving Mexican in Tempe.

LV31uXCRcH99NDJ_CNalTA.text: The Sizzling Molcajete was delicious and huge! If I was a local I would definitely be a repeat customer. Yum!

N3801P60C5QDI-WWoQueUA.text: My friend's rehearsal dinner was held here in one of their private rooms (with our own restroom which was a happy bonus!). We had a party of slightly over 20 people with 1 waitress; however, I must say that she did a great job and handled the big party well! She kept the drinks coming all night and was on top of all our requests.  When we arrived, they had chips and salsa already set throughout the tables. The salsa was decent, not spicy at all (I do have to say that as a Mexican, what I find "not spicy" my fiance will think is hot). One thing I will suggest that I had never realized was a "thing" was to request flour tortilla chips instead of the traditional corn that they bring you. A friend requested them and let me sample, and they were much better than the corn chips! (I must've been living under a rock) For my entree I ordered a beef chimichanga. The chimi was not fried at all, it was more like a burrito smothered in the sauce (which didn't have a good flavor) so I didn't eat very much of it. The rice and beans were not great either but after trying the chimi, I hadn't expected them to be. Overall, we had great service but the food wasn't very good.

kC_3_-kIA6ncMQMRZDPpxw.text: Decent food, pleasant wait staff, awful management and 2.5 hour dinner... I'm so disappointed in a dinner we were so looking forward to. We visit Aunt Chilada's several times a year, it's always been a favorite for out of town guests. From the wrong meal being served (and then attempted to be passed over for what she actually ordered... and this wasn't a substitution or special request, but simply an off the menu item...), to nearly twice the original 30 minute wait time to the poor wait staff being so busy there wasn't even to refill our water glasses, this visit was the last for me. I get that every establishment has the occasional bad night, but the last straw came with the manager's beyond lackadaisical and couldn't care less attitude. When management doesn't care how can it be expected that anyone else will? So long, Aunt Chilada's, it been fun.

XmgYwhmJPv1QjIFzGtK7AQ.text: Aunt Chilada's is a pretty standard American Mexican place. The food was pretty basic and no frills. I would not get the quest dip because it looked and tasted like cheese whiz. My enchiladas were warm but lacked flavor as did the beans and rice it was served with. The only part I would consider getting again was the fried ice cream.

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chilada's - Tempe, AZ, United States. Fried ice cream-- HUGE!
Photo of Aunt Chilada's - Tempe, AZ, United States. Enchiladas de harina with fiedo and black beans

BnfBFuNaJNYPjpbWXpACUg.text: Worst margaritas and rudest bartender I've ever experienced. 2 stars are for good salsa and average Mexican food...

Suq8jeNTuRZnfXGr4r0Mog.text: Great location because onsite at the resort.  Service so so.  Chips not good. Salsa fresh.  Street tacos - chicken not good. Steak good.   Queso dip ...not a hit.

HnhuDBPA-8TYFvwiu3JStw.text: Met my Mom in Tempe and had a wonderful early dinner. Ashley our server was so accomidating and brought some water for my service dog! Tia was our bartender and mixed up some tasty margaritas. We will for sure be visiting again!

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chilada's - Tempe, AZ, United States. Delicious!

gZ37ADSXvoEZzz1z9PdHOg.text: I normally have great things to say about this place. Always ask for flour tortillas chips. Might want to pass on the fideo. It generally has the consistency of spaghetti. Aside from that, the food is usually great. Lots of lower calorie options available.  Today, is not one of the days I have rave reviews. We sat there waiting for 30 minutes after being told it would be a 10 minute wait. They said no tables available. Do they not understand that we can see the patio and half the dining area from the waiting area? We could see 8 open tables in the patio. 5 open tables in the 1st dining area. We passed13 open tables when we were finally called inside.   We waited another 15 minutes at our table before we were even acknowledged by our waitress. She took mine and my husband's drink orders, and ran off to go fill them. That would have been super awesome, except there were 5 of us at the table!!!  We ordered drinks for the rest of our party when she brought our drinks. She brought our food, and then hurried away again. I had to stop her at another table to remind her about drinks for the rest of my table. The drinks were for my children!!   This was honestly the worst restaurant experience I've had in a long time. This used to be one of my favorite places. Now I'm not sure if I would ever recommend this to my out of town guests again. For a restaurant that gets so much resort business, you'd think they'd treat their customers better.

SeUwjC0brkfZ3hNbsBSNFg.text: We had our first dinner here, it was great. We kept asking ourselves why we had never tried it before. I had the tacos (chicken and shredded beef) they were great! He had the burrito, it was also great. We asked for a hotter salsa and they brought it out. Our server Marcia was great as well! Two thumbs up!

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chilada's - Tempe, AZ, United States. Water feature at Aunt Chilada&#39;s
Photo of Aunt Chilada's - Tempe, AZ, United States. Patio at Aunt Chilada&#39;s

quFwljmCYpM6xJlKAKU_cw.text: My husband and I are Tucson natives. We moved here  2 years ago and have been on a search for the best margarita in the valley. This place is it!!! The bartender Tia was wonderful. She was very attentive and friendly! The food is pretty good and the guacamole is to die for! I'm Hispanic so it takes a lot for me to complement good Mexican food. We will definitely be returning!

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chilada's - Tempe, AZ, United States. Best guac in the valley

s0xb1GrzkX_g4435H1V-9g.text: Very authentic tasting food. Very generous portions. Service was friendly and environment was authentic. Nachos appetizer was a meal in itself. Very good. I'd recommend this place when you're in the area. Has a gluten free menu too!

aHdTHYhQV9C27W887BmGkw.text: Great Mexican food and very nice servers and bartenders.  Margaritas are also very good.  Little on the expensive side and no lunch menu only a happy hour menu from 3-6 but this place is also a part of a top notch resort so I expected it to be a little pricey.

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chilada's - Tempe, AZ, United States. Enchiladas with rice, received beans, and Guac

vBqBlTv-rdA9Gtn17rZvWg.text: Outdated decor and average, slightly overpriced food. OK, I could end the review right there, but I shall elaborate a bit further.  Seems like Aunt Chiladas has seen some better days. It looks like a water park for midgets outside, when you approach the entrance. Very cool... For 1974.  It's a very colorful place, but seems as though it hasn't changed since the aforementioned year. Just guessing there. Menu items are all priced about 3 dollars to high. Glad I went once, probably won't re-visit.

pPzaFBfKcCWonUih-gVhDg.text: This was our first meal when we arrived in the Phoenix area. The food was decent and the margaritas were pretty awesome. We sat on the patio on a beautiful day so we will be back for that alone. The service was good, but a little slow so I wouldn't want to dine here is I was in a hurry. My chili rellano was awesome, but my daughter was not crazy about the shredded beef enchiladas. We also ordered the bean dip, which was a little cold but decent. All in all an ok meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chilada's - Tempe, AZ, United States. Chili Rellano

-2z1KYzaUIKFrDC9Fa5Htw.text: This place doesn't deserve the right to call their food Mexican. There's absolutely nothing authentic about this restaurant. It was depressing

FaxbSYtruVJudCJiEqnDaA.text: Do you want delicious Mexican food with great service at an affordable price? Then this shit hole is not for you! We waited an hour and a half for food without any apology from our clueless classless waitress. When we asked what was going on, she said the kitchen had "a big ticket ahead of us still" and walked away. It even took 30+ minutes for us to get a drink. Total joke. But what does our idiot waitress care? They built in a 20% tip to our already expensive bill! Pass on this dump at ALL costs...you'll be happy you did!

rcdV9VnDQPooD6qmz3sTvw.text: My fiancee and I went here on a date night and it was great! Great atmosphere, great food, delicious chips and salsa before the meal(I was a tad full for my food), and superb service! Will definitely visit again!

bIICLpsHwbnjHTQpiYDMNg.text: Sat in the patio (soaking up the nice AZ weather)....  We had a retirement lunch here.  It was roomy and we can be noisy!  :)  The chips were good and crispy.  I got the chicken chimy, it was ok.  Almost flavorless.  I so wanted to LOVE this place but the food was just not that good.  The staff was nice!

GfPZ-kC0RB7B8p_KgRJqzA.text: We ordered the nachos grande and they came out with burned chips all the way around the plate. They were piled high so we ate around the burned sections. Orders the numero siete with shredded beef and chicken enchiladas, Mexican rice, and fiedo. The beef one wasn't bad, the chicken one was a solid piece of chicken so kinda hard to eat compared to the usual shredded chicken most places have. The staff was kinda rude and barely came around to check on drinks or how things were.

ko3Q1fuRnaY_QGQs_Xc3PA.text: Great service and great food! Clean and great Mexican food! By far my favorite Mexican restaurant

gr9abkOwOR8Ui--YX36KmQ.text: Hate doing this but for a 13$ margarita after tip I had to. I came in for a Cadillac margarita with hornitos and grand marnier like I did last week. I got a different glass and a different liquor. I asked if it had grand manier, since I seen what looked like a citrus patron bottle on the counter. She said they were out of grand marnier! How Do you run out of grand marnier at a Mexican restaurant?  I seen three bottles of grand marnier sitting on the shelf a foot away from me.

YpUmHMG6yWHjuBb2Nq5H7w.text: I've been a long time fan. My first visit to this place was wayy back when, literally. I had my first Aunt Chilada's experience when I was 8 and my family and I have been visiting ever since then. Not sure why it took me so long to leave a review.  They have one of the biggest tequila selections in Arizona, by far! And if you're a Tequila connoisseur like myself you will appreciate it.  I'm a big fan of their Sunday brunch. They have a great selection at great prices and can really modify a the plates to your liking if you want. If it's a nice day out, I suggest sitting out on the patio. They have umbrellas to shade your area, but it's cute to see the ducks from the pond hanging out and walking around.

_eA2cTZtKqGjJMKScgJnSQ.text: It's been awhile since we've dined here. The only gripe I have is the price has gone up significantly on their entrees. None the less I always enjoy their shredded beef with chimichanga, burritos, etc. they have been consistent on the taste. The shredded beef is like dried meat & usually other Mexican food shredded beef are greasy or too much Ah Jus & they kill it with salt properties.

yRUMvltWEpovf1TrmEbyxQ.text: I'm not one to usually complain and you can see that on my review history but this place offers terrible terrible service, slow service (they weren't busy) and overpriced food and drinks. Wasn't impressed w/ the food and for sure will never return.

aiFlilBlGEsRqUGhkzVVwQ.text: If this is the best Mexican in Phoenix (per the Arizona Grand resort), then I think Phoenix has a serious problem. Holy crap was that some greasy, bland mexican food.  Taco bell kicks the hell out of this place. Ceviche was inedible - pretty sure it was days old. Meat in fajitas must have been dredged in flour and totally overcooked. Everything was bland, and just BAD.

l9RQYDKMPGRfPFnTHlAtNg.text: My Husband went in for a quick lunch and while he had been here before I had not.  The food was good but our waitress Beverly was a very delightful woman.  She kept our drinks full the entire time, always had a smile on her face and just an all around pleasant woman to talk too.  I think she said that she had been there for 18 years don't quote me on that though.  She made our visit a great experience and we may just go back in the future.

xD4nljGjq3-CRKHnSXMEDw.text: Tried out the happy hour at about 4pm on a weekday and place was empty. The bar is small inside and there is no bar outside. They have decent drink prices as I scored a domestic draft for 2 bucks. They have a bunch of food choices as well for between $3 and $5 depending on the time. It was a bit of surprise that they do not offer white meat chicken for the tacos, only mixed. That tells me that this place is saving money and I'm not buying the bartenders "it keeps it moist excuse" Menu prices are right out of Scottsdale, but the free chips and salsa were good. Chips were kinda warm and salsa was chunky variety with some onions floating in the bowl. Too small of a bar area for a good happy hour crowd, so this place won't need to be revisited.

-fgp0vgeZxGR2oP0Ix-law.text: I fail to understand how other people's experiences could be any different from mine at this horrid place. I am a very easy customer - just need no flies in my food, and the waitress to get my order right after the 3rd time! BUT, this place brought out the unhappy in me ( thrice!!). Never going back, ever!!!

4bvAFNTBSQhtGpdq14rxrw.text: The start is for atmosphere, food is awful. No flavor whatsoever. Drinks are over priced . I was expecting a good Margarita for 13 dollars but it was just like the food. No flavor. I will not come back nor recommend anyone .

ftnkNlhK_GvzXSl9NZcwjw.text: Service was incredible, our server Marcia was all over drink refills and extra chips and salsa. She recommended the fajitas and they were superb, not cheap on the chicken and steak, the tortillas were warm and fresh, atmosphere is very laid back. Best Fajita's in town!!

5Zmh0r6BHQP5Ujlw-DP6qA.text: Service was prompt and attentive. Food was served quickly and was great. Recommend the creamy jalepeno sauce on the chimichanga!

YEkZqgdjgu-KDUup1ib5VA.text: Average Mexican. You might expect better for a Mexican restaurant in Arizona, but if you are at the Arizona Grande it's convenient.

r2D6_sYPlS-Cvm5A0DbrDA.text: This place has really gone down hill.  I had eaten here a few times and thought it was pretty good. Then we went for lunch and it was  incredibly busy one time we went for lunch with a 40 min wait so we decided to leave.   We went back a week or so later for dinner.  We had an incredibly long wait in the bar that seemed  to last forever even though there seemed to be plenty of tables on the patio.  They sat us inside in a very small room sandwiched in-between the kitchen and 3 large groups of very loud annoying people. There was only 2 of us not sure why were were relegated to such a terrible table.  Our food tasted terrible, oily, and the vegetables in my burrito were undercooked.  We didn't finish our dinner, paid and left. I have a pretty strong stomach, but both of us got extremely sick from the food after we left.   If you have to go here make sure you sit outside so you don;t get stuck in one the terrible side room.

_A-CrY-SD4Ohsv1NipU0rg.text: Really good food.  Try the Chili Relleno.  Great patio day or nite.  Parking may be a little tite.

UoBookokqPTddvKfjrjalw.text: My favorite "Mexican" in Phoenix.... If you are planning a lunch trip, be sure to get there early (before 11:30) or you will be in for a wait - but it is well worth it.  I LOVE their salsa & chips, the best anywhere IMO and they also offer a 'hot' version that you can mix in to taste.  I am a fan of 'hot' foods with a bit of pep to them and Aunt Chilada's delivers on specific dishes (ie there is plenty of other offerings if spicy is not your style). The 'Aunt Chilada Special' is my favorite - a cubed, spicy beef filled enchilada covered with both red and green sauces, topped off with cheese and sour cream, served with a choice of sides (I normally go with rice and 'fidao' (sp) - kinda "Mexican spagetti".  I have been eating here for many years as do many people I know, there IS a reason it is always packed - Highly recommended.  There is seating both inside and outside, so depending upon the weather and your personal taste you can do either.

aUqvdK4OaSQMiCaNOaFJGw.text: This was my first time eating here. The food was very bland and uninspired. However, the drinks were very tasty. Our server was not the worst. But, definitely not the best. However, the manager was excellent. She came and asked how everything was. When I replied that it was just OK, she wanted details. The manager was very appreciative of my feedback and even took my fish tacos off of the check (something I did not expect). Also, they accidentally charged my card too much. The manager that I spoke to was very concerned and understanding. He even went to their accounting department to verify that their records only showed the correct charge. Although my first experience with the food was not great, I am considering giving them another shot thanks to the excellent managers.

SpeEDxQLb91YT-CuOnplnA.text: We went here thinking the food would be the same as one at the Squaw Peak Pointe. It's not. Different owners I found out when I was there. The food was horrible. Honesty, I would have enjoyed Taco Bell more. There was nothing authentic about the Mexican food served here. It tasted like it came out of a can. The other Aunt Chilada's is far superior. Go there.

ygdTyqtZpby-ToTrdK1_2w.text: Food & service is great! Our favorite server is Amanda.. She's efficient and friendly!

3ZMbUw_hsgVVtnZiwCwSvA.text: We had an impromptu party of 15 (softball team) and the service, food quality and prices were above expectations. Highly recommend as this place appreciates customers and serves up great tasting food. We're all from Chicago and appreciate and know good restaurants!

9RziGspg-kPOHhzhvzaLyQ.text: Sherry and Daisy were great! The food on the other hand sucks.  The salads are served with wilted vegetables and warm lettuce.  The chicken in fajitas tasted terrible.  The only good thing was the black beans and salsa- that's it.  The food was clearly old and had been sitting out for a while.  I would def not come back here.  I'm only giving this place 2 stars because Sherry and Daisy were so nice.

yffKjGLiDtJWfNbE7Bkjjw.text: Ended up walking out! This was the worst restaurant I have been to in a very long time. Server was rude, brought our chips and salsa then some water and disappeared. Never asked what drinks we wanted. And no they were not busy we were the only table in that area. Tried the salsa and it tasted weird so had my husband try it he started gagging and had to spit it out. It was starting to ferment because it was bad! I told the server there was something "off" about the salsa and it tasted sour. He rolled his eye and said "okay" That was enough for us we got up and walked out. If you serve old rotten salsa I don't even want to know what else you try to push the exp. date on!! Absolutely gross!

0VrrvuJudPMzbF_J3acEGQ.text: Went there for the first time about a week ago and was very impressed. It was slightly expensive but all the food was amazing and i would definitely come back!

tqANxv8zCOHn9i--SrUoSA.text: There were very few full tables so we figured service would be pretty quick and smooth. We sat down and it took 10 minutes for a waitress to come by to ask about drink orders (we were fine with the water we were brought with chips). We finally ordered after looking over the menu and we didnt see the waitress for at least 15-20 minutes where she came back to our glasses empty for at least half of that time. It took 30 minutes after ordering our simple choices to get our food. People who had sat down 10 minutes prior got their food the same time as us. The food was amazing and worth the wait. Although the service could use some major improvement.

RspXL3ieVwgxjnUARYb9gg.text: First time experiencing this place was April 22 for a special event. We were seated on the patio. Beautiful outdoor setting, but our location was in direct sunlight. They did place a few umbrellas around which helped some. Had 3 options to choose from; Chimichanga, Enchiladas or a Creamy Chicken Fundito. I went with that. The Jalapeno Cream sauce was delicious but unfortunately my chicken was extremely dry. At the end of our meal we were served beautiful desserts. A chocolate cake & flan. Both were good. Chocolate Cake wonderfully rich &  The Flan was light & appropriately caramelized. Service was great for such a large party. We had about 3 servers assisting our table. Will come back again and explore more of the menu.

g6NIVuCN4izurs3bOfIMYw.text: The food was so good but the service was horrendous. Our drinks didn't come until after our food and our server only checked on us once, when it was time for the check. Take the extra few minutes and drive to the Aunt Chilada's in Phoenix it's worth the drive to get the better service!

Y7STGGMVxYGsFpbAGgaMOg.text: This was absolutely the WORST food I have ever eaten.  The owner and chef should be embarrassed about the lack of quality food they are serving.   I ate their last night with some co-workers and the queso was thick and over cooked, similar to what the queso looks like at the bottom of a crock pot.  I order enchiladas and a taco.  They brought me a shredded taco instead of a ground beef taco so I sent it back. When the new taco arrived and I went to take a bite the shell was stale.  I immediately spit it out lost my appetite and had to go home hungry.  I would have rather gone across the street to Burger King then eat that food.

T7JrjG_Yj5pvWsJSwxSg5g.text: I have eaten at Aunt Chilada's a few times.  I will finally write a review.  This place is good.  The service was great during this visit last week.  I did not care for the chips they brought out.  I ended up ordering two shredded beef tacos, rice and black beans.  The tacos were really good the meat had a good flavour.  The beans were good and the rice was good too.      There are so many varieties of Mexican food here it is crazy.  I liked this food at Aunt Chilada's, but it might not appeal to others.   Disclaimer I tend to like all styles of Mexican food.  My family made a lot of Spanish dishes and it is really different than Mexican dishes.  You can only eat so much chicken, shrimp, paella varieties and tortilla de patatas.  I loved eating at my friends house for dinner as a kid because the Mexican food was yummy.

osoTNWlsp1HWQScgMClT5A.text: Overall this place was just ok. Went on a Sunday afternoon, I guess it was slow service so they were seating everyone in this small room and the tables were so close together it was very uncomfortable and loud. Our server was nice but the service was not anything special. The pricing is expensive but they give u large portions. For example  The nachos on the appetizer menu is $16.95 but it feeds 4 people. Pina Colada was $9 and not very good. It was all ice and I did not taste one ounce of alcohol. I did not like the chips as salsa...the salsa was a little bland. The patio looks interesting and I could see it being a nice atmosphere in the evening.

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chilada's - Tempe, AZ, United States. Carne Asada- Grande  Nachos from Appetizer menu

DMk2iamZB8PjMU5dPl92bA.text: This place has horrible service. We waited about 20 minutes before they could even take our order. The food isn't the best, but that's the least of its problems. Most of the employees are exceptional with their customer service but a few have decided to have some disgusting attitude when we asked where our orders were and if they would be out soon. Otherwise, the food is okay and thankfully we had a nice table. My sisters Margarita was "watered" down, or that's what the waiter said when my sister asked for something different. That wasn't mentioned when she requested the drink. My in-law asked for a second Pepsi and hadn't gotten one for about 25 minutes. Most of the reviews for this restaurant have been good but my experience was unacceptable. We had been there for about 50 minutes and only 4 meals were asked for. This service was good outrageous and I will never come here again. And even when we did get our food, all of the orders were messed up. Thankfully they were fixed quickly. But, the wait wasn't worth it for our food. Only one of the dishes was remotely good but pretty plain and the rice has no flavor.

C3MRSS9NkXIjjpFF2wJBeA.text: First time coming here and everything from the food, environment and especially the staff was amazing. I was treated like a friend and so welcomed. The sizzling molcajete bowl and cheese dip are top tier. Favorite Mexican restaurant for sure. Definitely coming back.

BMtfjDGBX9BkKx0_cs0D2A.text: We are from Colorado. The ambiance was the first thing that grabbed our attention. The cute path to the restaurant patio was a great start. The weather was perfection. We loved the outdoor tables and chairs were comfortable. We had 2 rounds of house margs and both were outstanding. We got chips and 2 kinds of salsa, one spicier which my hubby liked. We both thoroughly enjoyed our meals. I had a steak dish with cheese enchilada. Hubby had a crazy big bowl filled with chicken, steak, and jumbo shrimp. He LOVED it! We really enjoyed our experience and are so glad we gave this place a try!

eojc5TCbvh74fLnq-9QC1w.text: Grandma used to semi toast the tortillas for our tacos in Guatemala. Never have I found a place that does that.  Thank you aunt enchiladas for giving me a ratatoui moment. Bringing me back to my country. The staff is not only top notch but Marcia made an effort to talk in Spanish with no accent at all. It was beautiful.   I think I will come back several times, specially when I get homesick.

Qd2LkLTziouYPxi9OY27uA.text: Ordered take out from AZ Grand. Arrived 20 minutes later to find that they didn't have order.  When hubby got back 40 minutes after first order, we discovered that the chicken dish (overcooked, chewy) was stone COLD! Really didn't matter as they did NOT pack utensils/napkins. Called and were told basically, too bad. Forget this dump. Wouldn't give this place a star but hubby liked his warm enchilada. How does that happen? Poor management and personnel that don't care.

JyYQuuAPurrNQ_BBI4wJYQ.text: I'm looking at this place as a forty year citizen of San Antonio, Texas the Tex/Mex food capital of the US. Jordan was our server and she did a good job considering.      Their Fajitas were terrible with a stale taste and they seemed rubbery. They showed up in the proper iron heating plate but it was set for Nuc so most of the veggies and chicken were blackened. The chips were nice and thick but their salsa was weird. I ordered corn tortillas but hard and dry flour ones appeared, but the butter never arrived. The pork in the giant enchilada was fatty and poor quality. The Charro beans and the rice were good. I returned the Fajitas and ordered two beef soft tacos on corn tortillas and these were fine.    The frozen Margaritas were potent but tasted unusual. It's a hoot trying to get to this place with Baseline a traffic jungle.

6mmZvEHTGSZ6nHIzte1YQA.text: Took a client here to lunch today.   Service was good. Waitress was friendly and nice. Very responsive.   Food was great. I love their jalapeno cream sauce. Not sure what is with all the negative reviews, I have nothing but good experiences here. Not super authentic, but not too fake. Sits in the middle.   Beautiful property, especially the patio.

9Hp2Bda2HZZmv835ZFQgxA.text: What a terrific find!  The food was excellent and the service friendly!  Will definitely return next time we are in town!

krbuMrEUSt-rcBTIdvjVsA.text: I think the food was OK. Not great, but a cute little place. But the five stars is for our server, Lucero, an absolutely lovely gem of a young lady.   Additionally, we were also pleased with the attentiveness of the other server, Kyle.    The best part of a restaurant experience is the service staff and  I hope that the management of this establishment rewards them appropriately and does their best to retain and reward such talent.

Pw6iiMGXFmqC5MJe_LZXsg.text: Very poor costumer service front desk.  Needs to replace the hostess..............,...

yTsJ0vj3wgu-lN1vnk6NTw.text: Large portions so you might consider sharing a meal. We received a complimentary cheese crisp from our hotel. It was delicious but huge for just 2 of us. I had the fish tacos, black beans and fideo. I make my own fideo at home and this was equally as good. My husband ordered the crane asana street tacos and said the meat was great but could only eat 2/3.  I would definitely return when I'm hungrier.

aC8U4u4sesun32LQKY9j3Q.text: I truly am not trying to be mean but this waitress is bad for business at least by my standards. She is older with an unkept appearance and somewhat spits out everything she says. She may be efficient but Her unkempt appearance made it difficult for us to enjoy our meal. If a waitress does not appear clean, hair combed back neatly, it is not easy to enjoy your meal.

9YZQ0kUcf-vdxHFdnYKZvA.text: So having tried this before I went back for lunch. Beat the rush but it still took 30 mins to get the order. Nice service but over priced for what showed up from the kitchen. Salsas were fair but nothing special. Sadly the relleno was flavorless and the black beans also. Other order was a SW chicken caesar. The waitress asked if having it tossed was okay but when it came it had only had dressing in a big glop in the bottom of the bowl. For $10 it was pretty small and a salad only costs about $1.00 at most w/o chicken... which was well grilled and tasty but the cheese added was pretty bland as well. Sorry but will choose another Mexican restaurant in the future.

uGTwiNgjqw5pWtx_Q9LOpQ.text: I'll keep this one short.   Bad.   Service was painfully slow and pretty negligent. We never even got refills on our water. The food was bland, I've had better from (insert ANY americanized Mexican food restaurant here).   It's a shame because they are in a great location and have an amazing patio. I would never recommend for anyone to come here.

N4tcMPLBgjJcCNvTW9Ey6w.text: Too expensive for nasty Mexican food .  This place sucks.  I cut into my beef burrito and a whole buch of water came out.  My girlfriend had the chicken burrito and water came out too.  Why are sodas $3.00 dollars?  We ate here because we stayed at Arizona grant resort.  They suck too.   Will not eat here again even if its free.

1xDi4lenhz0Im8V_XPchsA.text: Better food, cheaper pricing, at OTHER places. Unfortunately it's not the quality it was 15 yrs ago. Food was drowned in sauce, and bathrooms were truly authentic Mexico (and not in a good way; dirty & rundown). Service was just average. Pricing was very expensive for what u get.

B_in-gv1cWS79KMBy__OLw.text: Staying at the Arizona Grand for a meeting we chose to eat here for lunch one day.  The food was good.  I had the fish tacos which were pretty tasty, not the best I've had but fine.  The service was great.  The outside seating was nice.  I can't complain.  A little pricey but being on a resort that was pretty much expected.

akMJy9wxZytOgUZLbV5hGg.text: Authentic Mexican food? I don't so!  I went in on a Tuesday afternoon with a few friends. We were not greeted when we walked in. However, we were seated with in a couple of minutes. One of my friends noticed that the chips were stale so she proceeded to ask for fresh beans. I ordered 2-enchilada dinner with black beans. The tortillas from the enchiladas were tough, I couldn't cut them using only a fork. Enchilada's are supposed to be tender, it really seemed as the tortillas were left out and used the next day. The Black beans were so bland and came out of a can. I ordered a side of guacamole and had to ask the nice server to take it back. It tasted really bad-not fresh at all. I have given two stars for the service. It's not the waiters fault so I can appreciate them.

LSOP14r7H2mvyz8pZohHNA.text: Aunt Chilada's had some good things going for it and some not so good things going for it. I really enjoyed the ambiance of the restaurant and loved how the dining rooms were in separate little buildings and how the courtyard was beautifully lit, it added an air of intimacy to the restaurant.   We didn't have an appetizers, we noshed on the awesome portion of chips and salsa we were served, very yummy! For my meal I ordered the veggie enchiladas and a raspberry margarita (they were out of pomegranate for shame!). The enchiladas were not great at all and totally fell apart as I was eating them. Definitely worth the loss of a star or two. The margarita on the other hand was supremely delicious and it was not long before I'd drank it up.   If I'm ever in Tempe again I don't think Aunt Chilada's would be my first pick but overall it's an okay joint.

G7PgH3Pdef9eI6Rjr2mMlw.text: This place has great food...but I particularly enjoy the outside patio atmosphere...I give the margaritas 2 thumbs up

rlHmO73j5HsG5mtfq4Qx0w.text: I have gone to this location probably 5 times now and this last time was by far the best service I have had ever! I ordered the Pollo Fundido and it was the bomb! I was stuffed for sure. The free chips and salsa were delicious! To top it off I ordered a sangria margarita and I was blown away but how delicious it was. To end the amazing meal we had fried ice cream that was a trip to heaven! I wish it was not so far away from my house so I could come back again. My only concern was that the food came out so fast that we did not get to eat a ton of chips and salsa or have another round of drinks!

iLGp9gmRBLWaV4x7L_ALpQ.text: My wife and I went here for dinner, after having a great dinner at another Aunt Chilada's a few years ago. The hostess told us it would be 15-20 minutes, but we could be seated inside now. I said sure, and the hostess had the waitress take us to a table in the back in a dark corner, and at the time there were only a few table seated at the time. I asked her " if we could sit at a small table up front", which the waitress took the table. She comes back with the menus, and says, "hi, I am back". We give her our drink order, and our food order. She gave the kitchen the wrong number for my combo dinner, so I had to send it back. The waitress returns with the  correct combo for me, and says" you got direct from the oven, so at least it is hot". We finished our food, and working on our drinks after the waitress had taken our empty plates. She had come through the room 2 more times, and never looked in our direction, or came over to ask us if we were ready for our check. I had to call her as she was leaving the next table over for our check. We got our check, and she had billed us for the extra dinner that she had written down wrong, and given the kitchen. At that time asked for the Manager due to the poor service, and expressed our displeasure with the service. The manager informed us that this location was owned by the resort, and not affiliated with the other Aunt Chilada's. The manager asked us if we got good service from a name, which turned out to be the waitresses name, whom she had never introduced her self. I had to ask the manager who that was. When I told the manager that we didn't get good service, she left our table, telling us that she will take care of our check.

1zg1W6XCgJr9VSeUmk7o2Q.text: I went in with high expectations and wish I hadn't.  The service left a lot to be desired; the prices were outrageous for the quality of the food. It would take a lot of convincing for me to ever return. Not worth the trip in my opinion.

SvLZ3DzQ--5yoRD8G6Twlw.text: Where to start? Tables were unbussed so we had to sit at a dirty one. Wait staff ignored us for 20 minutes until finally a busser decided that he would acknowledge us after the fifth time he walked past. We wanted to leave but had some other folks coming to meet us so we were pretty much locked in and resigned ourselves to waiting. Finally one of the three waitresses in the bar area took pity on us and got our drink order and appetizer. Drinks took another 10 minutes and then we were ignored again for the rest of the hour that it took us to get our check and get out of this sh*thole. Oh but only I could give half a star. :(

wXHqDLb2krAqtmFrVULEfQ.text: Food was actually not bad. But the service was terrible. I thought they were going to ask us to do our dishes and lock up. Don't let them put you in the back room... You'll never leave.

3PoZGYy4qcblffWjFtHcCw.text: Stopped by one night for dinner and was seated immediately.  I was somewhat disappointed with the menu which was heavy on cheese and fried stuff.  I would have loved to have seen a mole dish. on the menu.  I ended up with the Southwestern Caesar Salad (super tasty dressing), which was okay.  I would not come back again if I were in town again.  I'd try the Sonoran hot dog cart on the corner of Baseline and Priest instead.

zEs8dV-8ffQtD-xDJFKtxQ.text: We ate there on a Sunday early dinner.  We sat outside, nice with the Mexican music.  I had three item combo, cheese enchilada, beef taco, bean tostado, the meal was excellent, brought some home.  My husband ordered the chili relino and spinach enchilada with cream sauce, his was also excellent, and he brought some home.  We didn't have a drink but the looked great! Would go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chilada's - Tempe, AZ, United States. Taco, cheese enchilada, bean tostado
Photo of Aunt Chilada's - Tempe, AZ, United States. Spinach enchilada and chili relations with cream sauce

GpvT0mgyDQFdsiCsBfIkXg.text: This place is horrible!!  A full tourist trap.  Went there after golf today to wait for traffic to ease up. Sat at the disgusting, old, dingy bar. (Bathrooms are worse). We order the chicken chimichanga.  HORRIBLE!!!  How you make Mexican food tasteless is a mystery but they did it.  Worst Mexican food I've ever had, hands down. Taco Bell is better.  Service was horrible.  How this place stays open is beyond me .... actually, I'm guessing the only people that go are staying at the resort.  Suckers.  The place needs to be bulldozed.

baXXDW6GCjxCAkrrv86OxA.text: The happy hour in the bar is amazing. The best deals I ever seen. From 3-4, $3.00 wine and appetizers, certain well drinks and beer too at $3.00, from 4-5, prices go to $4.00, etc.  Clare is the best bartender since the TV show Cheers. Oh and the Pinot Grigio there is sublime.  Do NOT NOT miss the bean dip.  Dinner there is amazing. I had the Mexican Ceasar salad with mesquite grilled shrimp on it and a side of Fideo, the only place in town that has Fideo. They could cook it like crap if they wanted to but they don't love love love Aunt Chiladas! pictures on Instram @lidsamy

rB97ZkkyyhJX1eOMssT3EQ.text: Atmosphere was nice but they did not have enough staff to service customers even on a Wednesday night.

tkI0l6giIFxAl1z7bL0zaQ.text: Cold, under done chips. If a Mexican food restaurant can not get this staple right how can I expect them to get much more right.  I arrived for a party that my autocross group was having. Every table had chips and salsa on it. Sombreros were used as the server platters. Senor I don't think this even meets health code.   Dinner was served Buffet Style, one of the dishes was called "fandito." I can't think of a less inspired dish. It was simple pasta with some Mexican flavors thrown it, a dish that your mother would make if she had leftovers from Mexican Italian nights.   I like really like Mexican food, however I left this place hungry as I did not even want to try any of the dishes other than the salad.

7Ph2TmlCulFVl9gcj7FvEw.text: We frequent the squaw peak location - but tried this location when in the area.  Portions are smaller, menu is pretty different, prices higher.  We prefer the other location.

qbMHW67Zd-V8WibMsmwiBw.text: My family & I wanted to give this place another try as we only ate there one time two years ago. Huge mistake! The food was absolutely horrible! The chicken was rubbery, the tortillas tasted like leather and my daughters quesadilla was runny... we've eaten at several Mexican restaurants and know what fresh, authentic Mexican food tastes like. This place is the worst. And to top it all off, it's WAY overpriced. Please save your money & go elsewhere. Too bad it's one of the only choices right next to the AZ Grand resort...

IivODxxm-I3fKBlh0V_dBg.text: The rice is fluffy, the salsa is perfectly mild, the green corn tamale is wonderful. The service is fast and friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chilada's - Tempe, AZ, United States. Green corn tamale with rice and beans.

gjqiK9r_3vaDsuyza_s0ow.text: Decided to meet a friend here for lunch since I've heard good things about the place. Being owned by the resort i expected more on far as looks, but food was great. They should really do something about the flooding. Not only did we have to walk through it to get to the front but the poor workers had to be walking all through that getting their feet all wet. I know I would hate to work through that.

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chilada's - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Aunt Chilada's - Tempe, AZ, United States. Workers having to walk through this
Photo of Aunt Chilada's - Tempe, AZ, United States. Flood

JjtN9PdWewgVtb432PqjxA.text: Food is terrible! Margaritas are terrible! You should be ashamed of yourself calling this a Mexican restaurant!

m3nTzJH6rpqi5QZ9jxVCcw.text: Still like the one off of Dreamy Draw Dr. near Squaw Peak. This is the second time I've been here and the food just isn't as good. We also had the unfortunate luck of showing up right after a couple big groups so our service suffered as well.   Floors and tables were less than clean. Not disgusting but you would assume they must have been short staffed and that's why; benefit of the doubt.   I did my trademark chicken enchilada which was pretty dry and Jen did some dish with chicken stuffed in poblano peppers. She liked it a lot. I also need to give kudos for offering to swap our the standard sides of beans and rice for one of their soups. Very cool.   Overall was less than impressed and I guess I'm stuck making the 30 min drive to the good Aunt Chelada's versus the five minute one to this location.

zfpMQtiElj6OP5uqxJZojA.text: My husband and I went once and both didn't like our food. About a year later we went back thinking we would give them another chance, and same situation. Food was gross. Too bad because it's a great location.

HyM5TEfub7nXCOHsrnW7bg.text: I don't have a lot of positive comments but no hate either.  I just think it's a tourist trap that has been here for years and gone down hill. It is over priced, and the food is not that great.  The salsa was ok.  I am not super fussy when it comes to Mexican food but I do know good Mexican food.  It sure can be hard to find great Mexican food in Phoenix (of all places).  Explain that to me. The service we had was great, nice young man.  I do not know if because the property surrounding the restaurant has changed hands so frequently, that has had something to do with the quality of food at this place but I remember 20 yrs ago the food was much better.  I would not recommend this place to any friends or out of town guests.  We will not be returning.  The food is boring.

tMz813gH1ucuOU9NyVma7Q.text: Best service by EVERYONE (hostesses, bartender, and server)! This is refreshing. The people eating here are even awesome! Best energy and vibe I have had in a long time. Gloria is an amazing server! Lover her! Food a little dry but honestly don't care - that's how welcoming and great these people are....I can deal with a Lil dryness in the food....just not In The people :)  Will be back.

J3k7ZBHtcMpG7thbDmlRSA.text: Went here as part of a conference event. The staff was really friendly and attentive. The food was decent. We were in the back in a separate venue area, which was a little crammed for how many of us were there but otherwise was fine.

ouhXwvwR1tnromsGObKASA.text: It's funny to me that the reviews are all over the place for Aunt Chilada's.  Maybe I'm just lucky, but I always have  a good experience.    I love the chips and salsa.  I usually order their hot sauce and I mix it for better flavor.  By itself, I think it tastes good, but it's very mild.  Maybe another reason I might be lucky is that I always order the same thing. I get the beef flauta platter with beans and fideo. (Fideo is like a mexican spaghetti)   Service is always great for me, and fast.  It's almost like one of those cartoons, where they take the order, go through the door, and come right back out with your order.  I went last night and had the same experience as usual.  My server Whitney was very friendly and super fast. I had a margarita this time and it was really good.  I sat on the patio, the weather was beautiful.  They have new chairs on the patio!  The old ones sat so low, the table was up to your chest. Awkward. Great improvement.  My understanding is that it is part of the Arizona Grande resort and is probably why the pricing is kind of high for entrees.  They're so far away from the actually hotel though, it looks like it stands alone. Also, you would think they would be open until 10p weeknights, but they're not, only 9p.  I recommend you at least try it once. If you ask for Whitney, you'll get great service, so then you'll have to base your review on the food and the ambience. ;-)

VxYppTDhkyNoJvUkMYpBIg.text: It was alright.   The salsa was actually pretty amazing but that is where the amazing stops. I ordered a combo plate with a tostado, taco, and enchilada. It arrived super soggy and not appetizing at all. The beans and rice were ok.   The kids meals were just that. Kids meals.   The winner of the night surprisingly was my sons plain nachos. Yep, they managed to get chips with melted cheese right.  The sopapillas were not good at all.   Probably best to skip this joint really.

dVziK4rPyTBvj6Bs3msHVA.text: I ordered the happy hour special 1 shredded beef taco and cheese enchilada.  The food tasted really commercial and the HOT salsa wasn't that hot. But the service was fantastic! Based on the food quality it's nothing special, I wouldn't come back.

BeqnKdA_cS8YGd4DGe4CsA.text: We went here for the first time about a week ago and it was awesome! It was kind of slow for a weeknight but service and food were great, we'll definitely be back!

S3N2JjwCvYhhP_yfN4r1CQ.text: We stayed at the Arizona Grand and had lunch here. The food was so bland-I have no idea how you can screw up a $14 chicken burrito. Plenty of beans of rice to fill your plate!

KaquT2L-8hUZEhBYo-HtIQ.text: I first went to this restaurant over 20 years ago, might have been soon after it opened.  We had wonderful food that first time.  I still remember having the carnitas (pork) burro.  We went a second time a month or so later and the deterioration had already set in.  I ordered the same burro and it was very dry.  About a year later I took relatives there and again tried the carnitas burro and it was again dry and uninspired.  No one else raved about their food but things overall were still average.   Now to the recent experience... Over the past 3 months group of people and myself wanted to meet and talk at a restaurant so THEY choose ACs on two occasions.  I was hoping for a good experience but it was even worse than my last one  years ago.  On both occasions the service was quite slow.  On the second visit the server literally said, you should order now cuz you probably won't see me again soon and see was in a hurry to get the orders and get out.  I suspect the owners purposely understaff.  I would have again ordered carnitas but they no longer offer it except with a very high priced combo meal. So I ordered my other go to choice, a Green Burro, for both these visits.  Both times it was no better than average and overpriced.    The chips and salsa are also just average.  As another reviewer mentioned, the salsa tastes like they cut it with canned tomato sauce, it's soupy and has no bit whatsoever.   I don't know how this place stays in business.

LJNBTrd1NXTQ5dcQuqvfUg.text: Food and service good but VERY pricey especially for lunch. A simple cheese quesadilla was 7.50 and to top it a small scoop of sour cream in a little taco shell was an additional 2.50!  Probably wont go there again too expensive when you can go to others for much larger portions and free side of sour cream.

oTU1AjDlYzwdrqcvJpdXUg.text: Food was wonderful and the staff was very accommodating. Meals have big portions, best Spanish rice I've ever had, and the enchilada sauce was very good! Margaritas are nice and strong as well.  You can tell that this restaurant is well-managed, they go out of their way to make things right for the customer.

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chilada's - Tempe, AZ, United States

wMx8GAXcrk1zZiXSCxkeAQ.text: Food was good.  I miss my fajitas coming out sizzling. Environment was rather loud from the other patrons (we were seated inside the main building). All in all I would recommend and go again. Oh if you are going for a large bar, you will be sorely disappointed. Plan on just ordering ypur drinks at the table, as it (the bar area) is rather small.

IZdUN_c60XZfQlbWysM6og.text: I can't explain the quantity and quality of the food and even at happy hour!!  $4 tapas and margaritas! We got almost one of each and shared!   I don't know that we've had a better dinner so far out here-- want to come back already! Must go!

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chilada's - Tempe, AZ, United States

bU87yjeAAppbuvpi_CdLbA.text: Amazing drinks and food! Great atmosphere and really enjoyed the patio area for dining. It is also within walking distance to the resort.

m1jDqHYJo_OtVEPilZCbJQ.text: The food was great here went on a lunch break. The dishes were not a 100% clean or I would give a 5star. Great atmosphere just wish they had lunch specials I would probably go more often. This was my first time  at this location will try again to see if any difference in service and dining.

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chilada's - Tempe, AZ, United States. Delicious lunch on our lunch break! Food was great, atmosphere was great, would come back.

VBinSEsT7-8Pct46ZbP5qg.text: Been a while since I had eaten here so I decided to try it for lunch yesterday. Ordered my favorite dish (Pollo Fundido) and was really disappointed. I've never had PF without it being wrapped in a tortilla. It was basically chopped up chicken with a white cream sauce poured on it. The wait staff was friendly but took forever to bring the bill at the end. I'll give it another try one day but won't order Pollo Fundido.

_0HuE9Lr2RrRVYQpxuAJhA.text: Great service. A nice place to visit if you're new in town. This was my first time trying fideo, interesting. I've had better mexican, but this is a nice family friendly restaurant.

lWmG4HNTw6tIMumCv5z_qg.text: I Gave this restraunt 2 stars because we waited 15 minutes to even get our drinks, even the table next to us complained about the wait for their service, we were about to leave but the waitress came by and we decided to just stay. I ordered fideo, a chicken taco, rice and beans. Extremely disappointed with the fideo because the "rice" was chopped up spaghetti noodles and unsatisfying. The rice was basically not even rice anymore just mushy. Overall my experience was not one to remember

dl9Y3JGfr-8iNwN6N7m3Ow.text: Currently at the restaurant. Couldn't even wait for my check to arrive to write this post. Pretty disappointed in the service and maintenance of it all. If I would've known I was going to be sitting around everyone used dishes and left over food ppl left behind because my waiter was never around to pick it up we would've never bothered. We saw him (Ryan) every 10-15 minutes. Never refilled our drinks. We even had to discard all our used plates in a near by tray. We were there for 30 minutes before we were able to even order. After food arrived most things were burnt! We ordered the Nachos and Fajitas. Had 5 pieces of chicken in the Fajita and was told if we wanted cheese the up charge would be $3. In the end of it all this was the first and last time we will be visiting. Paid way too much for bad food. Would've spoken with the manager but we are sure he even would have took to long to come around.

u7bVsrE_iFe73WLVWOwanA.text: I'm AMAZED this restaurant does NOT have at least 4 stars! I did not take time to read the feedback but I can tell you the food is very good and the service is as well. I had a spinach enchilada and my friend had the shredded beef enchilada.   The selections on the menu were plentiful. The atmosphere was pleasant- enough said

HrfGRO4f_O-JSmFl7CeI9A.text: Decent spot. Table side guac is outstanding. Outdoor setting is VERY nice. Unfortunately, the food is just not where it should be for a Mexican restaurant in Phoenix.

RcEt9wrGNdZU7FglNQdF6A.text: It was OK just expecting dynamite food being AZ and all. We had a 40 minute wait which was frustrating since the place was over half empty. The enchiladas not very tasty the best thing was the chips and salsa.

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chilada's - Tempe, AZ, United States

iuNBLEFCsbiBg_gIOf_5Ow.text: I was staying at The Arizona Grand for 4th of July and had dinner since its located really close by. The food was really good with big portions. There was 3 of us so we opted for the pitcher of sangria which I highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chilada's - Tempe, AZ, United States

DCEJQ3g3jBO1jxGJlOk6SA.text: My experience here was different. The food wasn't terrible it was actually decent. There was a lot of nachos I would recommend getting those because it was able to feed 4 people for a low price. I was told it was a New Mexican restaurant, but as someone with New Mexican culture there is some work that needs to be improved. But overall it was a good place to grab dinner with friends.

sEfv-6G87OWRTIYOEdQIBw.text: I wish I could say the Mexican food was ok, I really do. But all I can say is that it has amazing atmosphere and in the evening the ambience is awesome! Drinks are good (3-4 star), but the letdown comes with the food..., it feels like I am eating at a Mexican food court place. The food is just like that. Make sure you ask for the happy hour specials between 3:30-6pm, waiters don't tell you unless you ask.... Make sure you have plenty of time up your sleeve as the wait times can be horrendous, as families from the nearby Arizona grand resort start to come in droves around 5-6pm.

NNT6Ud1s8JkbLiDkQBE57Q.text: Very basic Americanized Mexican food for the family. Chips were stale, salsa was bland. Food was fine. Nothing wrong with it technically but it's like a Mexican chain restaurant.

8uSupZtsDcoq_qs6fyUWTA.text: The BEST Mexican restaurant!  food is always fresh, well prepared and never overdone. Whenever I come to town this is my "must stops".

Q3GYTw2lR7ZhtXorN7E5Bw.text: OUTSTANDING menu, atmosphere and service! It felt like dining in Old Town San Diego.  And this is the first time I found healthy menu items on a Mexican restaurant menu, if fact there were many! Will return again and again! Located right off I-10 & Baseline.

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chilada's - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Aunt Chilada's - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Aunt Chilada's - Tempe, AZ, United States

TgBYB5_5ewITGUOL2yWikQ.text: The salsa is good and the service is genuine. The food, however, isn't the best. My enchilada and chile relleno were quite tasty but the rice and fideo were not good. They were burnt and crispy...not a good kind of crispy! The tinga tacos were tasty but that's about it, taco-wise, because the other taco types didn't have much flavor at all...to the point that my husband couldn't even finish them. The margaritas are on point, though! This might me more the type of place where you have a few drinks and that's about it.
