Photo of Aunt Chilada's - Tempe, AZ, United States. Burnt!

au5ffZG8v8gkwWeyJtrrvA.text: My new favorite Mexican restaurant in Arizona!! They have the best queso, guacamole, and carne asada tacos!!! The service is always super fast and the food is always amazing.

IAP5hdRB4-YMPfGwvtzE2w.text: Used to be independently owned and was one of the best Mexican restaurants in Phoenix. Arizona Grand Resort now owns and is going downhill..

r9ruOEfI_7R9eNYoUjESnA.text: Not great. Food doesn't taste like Mexican food. Got mixed fajitas and beef tested like boiled. Guacamole got also funny taste. I eat Mexican in Texas all the time, so I can tell you this is not even close.

W8_KFWgJOcS8vV_1SXYjsg.text: Loved the atmosphere outside. Prompt, courteous service and fantastic food and drinks.I'll definitely return!

ltNOopzJOnCzfSwczhX7DQ.text: Couldn't decide where to eat.   Must eat.  Driving in circles.  Must eat.  Want to run over the first a-hole that comes between me and food.  Found this place by mistake.  Family was too hungry to be picky and could not take the 2 seconds to look it up on Yelp.  So we went off the grid.  The service was friendly and attentive.  At one point, they made a mistake and brought our table a second beer.  Which they gave to us, for making the mistake.  Don't get me wrong, I was going to give them a good review anyway, the free beer was just icing on the cake.  The food was very fresh.  Right down to the chips and salsa.  I certainly think that it could  have used more heat, but I feel the same way about water.  I was craving some Chile Verde, so went with the pork.  Not what I had expected.  I was thinking pork marinaded in green sauce.  It was grilled pork fillets that were seasoned to perfection.  It was outstanding.  The Fajita plate had a little more heat, not nearly enough for me, but plenty for my wife.    Kids had quasadilla and were treated like kings.  I highly recommend this place.  Great atmosphere, great food and most importantly a moat around the front.

eslqct9YFap4h8c27KSC4Q.text: First time here. Rebecca was our server, she was amazing. Very friendly staff  and very attentive to our order. The food was delicious and the giant nachos is a must. We will be back.

Ty31Lv9FqmdXwU11K7wyZw.text: Good was great. Ate here twice this week. Staff was wonderful and the aunt chilada special was so good. We need one of these in MN.

J810RbLQI3UIYYRw7EXdHg.text: Amazing. I loved every bite. Our waitress was extremely friendly.my wife wants to travel back to the resort just for aunt cheladas.

yUgK_bDn5syMw1lC2jRTSA.text: The atmosphere was good. Great place to hang out with friends, chow down on chips and salsa, and drink a few drinks. Overall, the food and service was average.

4adMnuouCbSyHIYKAs0moA.text: Hit this place up for a quick happy hour meal. Had to have the enchiladas, they were a little dry. Parking may be an issue if this place was busier.

HoNAECNjsro7WJ8YP7j0Jw.text: We were thinking of going to Garcia's at Arizona Mills Mall and decided to go here instead. It wasn't a big mistake but would have been more satisfied at Garcia's.  The table we were sat at was too close to other tables for that "intimate" feel. Our server was great, however. The food wasn't all that good. They bring you chips and salsa. The salsa, in my opinion wasn't that great.  Most likely won't be coming back as there are better options out there.

9GmIT7FcGEO2h9MsO5QpMQ.text: Expensive bland very Americanized Mexican food. Probably good for tourist who like mile Pace salsa FRM the grocery store. Probably what bothered me the most was all the rescued on expenses fur adding things like green chiles $1 onions $1 cheese $1.75. Our iced tea was $3. Not to of this works prices but kinda high. Service was ok, they got us what we asked for but without a smile or any enthusiasm. Beautiful location though!

BYMqJuHEAbZSCNXhoEXdUw.text: Don't waste your money on this place.  It is grossly overpriced mediocre food.  This is not authentic Mexican food more like Americanized Mexican food gone wrong. The chicken enchilada were made of some shredded chicken mixed an odd tomato sauce/seasoning. It was NOT good and the portions were too small for  the price. The fideo that came with the enchiladas was a disaster.    I will say that the kids menu portions were huge.  A really large taco and a really big bean burro were the best deal there.  The kids price was definitely cheap considering the size.  We didn't have any alcohol so I can't comment on that but either way stay away from  this place it's not worth your money.  We ordered a fajita plate, two enchilada plates, two kids meals, and 5 sodas and our check was almost $ 90. Considering food was NOT good this was a waste of money. Our server was very nice though.

iba2BlLlrHXX5KVlAhjqgQ.text: Long long wait for seating and food. We waited for 30 minuets to be seated and then another 45 for food after we ordered. Also needs to be kept in mind we went right in the middle of the JA conference allotted dinner time. The corn chips were not very good, they were chewy and crunchy but not the good crunchy. My food was good but the rest of my family said it was just okay.  Did not try the salsa, neither my family nor I like salsa. For you want to eat here make sure you have time to spare

14ohkSs1IbC4_chzyjxfXQ.text: I've been here numerous times and never had a bad experience.  It is what it is and I like it for that. It's not gourmet, it's not fancy or original probably not even authentic, but it's dependable.  I've always been served HOT decent tasting food. Their salsa isn't  half bad even though its made from canned tomatoes with added fresh cilantro, the chips are great, always hot and fresh.  Their Carnitas are some of my favorite, my husband is  fan of the cheese enchiladas and I also order the fish tacos too(see pic). All these items have been consistently good.  It can get busy with the annoying resort crowd, but if your looking for just plain old generic Mexican food that will fill you up and not rip you off, this is it. Yes I've had better and yes there is better, but like I said before:  It is what it is and I like it for that. It's not gourmet, it's not fancy or original probably not even authentic, but it's dependable. And I've definitely had worse!

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chilada's - Tempe, AZ, United States. Tacos de Pescado

LtyFFzPd7c91q2CwQL1qrw.text: The salsa is chunky and delicious! I got fajitas, they were decent and my wife got enchiladas, she got one with green salsa and one with red salsa, she liked the red salsa the best. I didn't have any problems with my refills, the waitress was nice and efficient. We finished our meal with fried ice cream and we all enjoyed it. I would recommend this place.

DvYbR-bX9hZrz5VAPWrx0g.text: I loved the molcajete! The margarita was really good as well, and it sneaks up on you.. i could barely make it to the car!

EYr0ovYEdd8qtx71NVtpdg.text: I did not enjoy this place it was a huge disappointment!!  I rode give zero stars but they force you in order to post a review.  I do not  recommend unless you like giving your money away

pP1WCnEsivkppO9dCDQ5VQ.text: This place is walking distance from my office. I eat here maybe once a month. The food is good and consistent. It's not great Mexican food but it's better than some. My only reason for less stars is due to the higher prices they now charge. The food just isn't worth the higher costs to get more stars.

SAoT-IXYzv-BLCeHUAyeEQ.text: Went there for the first time in decades.  The chili relleno was delicious. My server, Julie, was friendly and very helpful in answering my questions about ingredients and suggesting items that would suit my needs.

E9TgL6yKNFalbU9aBviAZQ.text: It was July 4th and with many restaurants closed today, Aunt Chilada's was open for business.    We were visiting with a friend and we greeted with Salsa and Chips which was both fresh and flavorful.  We then ordered the Pollo Fundido which is generally one of our favorite dishes.  Given that they used Chicken Tenders it was rather dry and so trying to flavor it becomes tough. The white sauce was good and over all the food was average.  While the food was average the service was excellent.  Beverly was fantastic and wish there was a Beverly at every restaurant that we went to.  She made our every experience a fantastic one.  Even though the food was A-OK, the service made it a very very pleasant experience.  Thanks Beverly for your undivided attention when we were there.

Vf5RUg3vkCBqUbliQl5FbQ.text: Nice walk from our hotel room at the Arizona Grand Resort. Spacious seating, indoor and out.    The chairs at the outside tables were way too short, and at 5' 10" that doesn't happen very often.  The employees were attentive and nice. The chips were stale and the salsa was bland.  The $8 guacamole dip was also bland. My dinner was typical Mexican food: chicken taco and enchilada combo... Bland chicken and greasy taco shell. My husbands fajita's arrived on a cold platter with cilantro piled on top, even though he ordered it without because he is allergic! The waitress did notice the cilantro and offered to replace it, but my husband opted to remove it himself. His response to his meal was like mine, unimpressive and bland.  The margarita he got from the "machine" was not good, he didn't even finish it.  We aren't positive if this is related or not, but my husband became mildly ill a few hour after dinner and had stomach issues for the next 15 hours or so. No vomiting, but very close. Not a fun way to spend the last night of our weekend getaway.  We wouldn't go back and we wouldn't recommend this place to anyone.

ak1vlZxmKWNz8h07SqO8zA.text: I've eaten at this restaurant several years ago and thoroughly enjoyed it, so I was quite disappointed in the drink (don't think it had a drop of the patron in it) and the food as it was fairly bland.  The waitress was rushing us out so much as to picking up our chips and salsa and almost our unfinished drink glasses while we are still sitting at the table.  I can honestly say it will be a long time before I consider this restaurant any time soon.

W2nr3m270SBhusOPCEx1eQ.text: One word: Exquisite.  We were quickly seated outside and ordered drinks, all of which were amazing. Our appitizers were incredible (we got queso), but our entrees really knocked it out of the park. Everything was sizzling and seasoned to perfection. Would definateley go again

mJe1YaWPoLRQZ3iAgOnZ9w.text: Mexican food is always a good idea. Considering this is suppose to be a part of the resort the prices were average not high. The food was good. I didnt find the guacamole to be that good like I saw in the reviews. Chips were bland ( i like salted chips) and salsa was ok. But they were free so...

aAeG-4YRc3ZJm0zoGB3wFw.text: Upon arrival you give them your text number and you receive a text when your table is ready. Friday at noon, we only waited 10 minutes. First time here. Great waitress, very helpful. Food was great. I didn't think it was very pricey. I would go again. We ordered guacamole with the chips/salsa they brought. Daily special was good. Parking is plentiful. Right off I-10.

w7_egzkOwpp2L0fq_hC-qg.text: Best advice I can give, ask for the flour chips instead of corn, it'll change your life! Cute restaurant with a lot of personality located right off the resort on Baseline near Arizona Mills mall and the I-10. They have plenty of indoor and outdoor seating for any preference and party size. The food is typical American-Mexican with lots of cheese (not a bad thing) but, a bit overpriced in my opinion- I think that stems from being so close to a hotel. The service is just ok, not spectacular, so be prepared to wait a bit for a refill. I'd recommend the steak fajitas ($17) and the table side guacamole ($12).

hjaQtdQ8bBC5UIWyspsH6w.text: This review is for the incredible service of our waitress, Katie! Katie was absolutely phenomenal, and made our dinner such a wonderful experience. Katie was so friendly with a smile and cheerful attitude, and truly showed she loves her job! She was attentive, kind, and defines the kind of customer service people dream about. Management: Please give Katie a pat on the back because she truly is an asset to your business!

OqikHFGZ_YESfgEMlX59mA.text: We ordered food to go and it was horrible! Pollo fundido was cold and just tasted like chicken with sour cream.. green chili burrito was very soggy. We were very disappointed and won't be back again.

UkPGMzPZg7GkdQm3Vx_jZA.text: I don't understand how anyone who knows and understands authentic Mexican food can enjoy this food. We order the Chicken tortilla and chicken burro. Everything tasted like it came out of a can. The waitress was super nice and noticed I did not like the soup and she was sweet to take it off our bill. Burro had more juice than it needed to be. It was really salty but at the same time bland. I usually check Yelp first before I try something, but this was just spur of the moment. Never again. I would rather eat at Taco Bell and I don't even like them. End Rant.

TzjFmzXlYWIyCQ0wwU4Zgg.text: A very large group of us stopped here for dinner last night. Food was wonderful, staff very friendly but service slow. Chris was wonderful but obviously understaffed. Not his fault. Would come back again in a heartbeat. Outside dining area was perfect. Nice patio heaters to keep us comfy. Food plentiful and tasty.

TIeZ40enkdx59pF46IBLWQ.text: Best Mexican Restaurant! Favorite for our family for years!  Great food, great prices, great service.  Love sitting outside to eat!

b6lUPWKwCJXcIf3Z_oIpnA.text: Now that's some great Mexican food! I went with a group to Aunt Chilada's this past weekend and everyone had a great time. Made reservations which is always key because the place was packed and we were seated right away. Our waitress was friendly and the margaritas started flowing! Food came and it was hot and the portions were large, I felt like I was at a Italian restaurant. Overall we had a great time and the staff was friendly and really went the extra mile ensuring a great evening.   PS. Make sure to order the "hot" salsa and Cheese crisp for an appetizer. Delicious!

z86WeF8HTrwgW5JEBip9Yg.text: Location: Right off Baseline Road. Across from Fry's Electronic Store  Atmosphere: Not bad..has a nice little front room and seemed clean  Food: Absolutely horrible. The food was smothered in sauce which worries me because I feel they do this to cover up something and it did...flavor.  We ordered the "Special" which I feel would have been the best to try...it was very salty and had little overall flavor. The cheese crisp appetizer was pretty much a tortilla smothered in tons of oily cheese. was completely upset and will never go back again.  Recommend: Absolutely not. I felt Taco Bell has more authenticity than this place. I hate to say that but it was a complete waste of money.

9B98WxDFelirp72fb0gdMw.text: We were in Arizona for a short vacation and my one requirement was some good Mexican food (and some sun ). Lol  While laying by the pool we started asking other guests for recommendations. Aunt Chiladas was mentioned.  They mentioned the outdoor patio and the margaritas. I immediately went to Yelp to look at the rating and reviews. Hmmm... 2 1/2 stars,  not something I will generally give a try but it was close and we were hungry.   Upon arrival,  the water feature out front was lovely. We asked for patio seating and it was also lovely. It was a little cool out but no worries because they have plenty of heaters to take the chill away until the margaritas kick in. Lol.  The service is very good. They brought us menus and water and chips and salsa right away and our server took our drink orders giving us time to look the menu over. The El Diablo is the Margarita to order. They have a tequila menu with lots of different tasty brands also. We started with the table side guacamole. Very fresh and worth the extra money to have it made to order.  I always order street tacos any chance I get. There was a choice of meats and I went with the Carne asada, Caritas and chicken tinga. It came with Pico, avocado crema and pickled onions. You can also choose between flour or corn tortillas. They were spectacular. My husband had the Pollo fundido and he said it was very good. They give you a lot of food and I think it was a good value.  We tried 2 other restaurants Macayo's Mexican Depot Cantina and Los Reyes de la Torta  and didn't care for them as much.  In fact we ended up coming back to Aunt Chiladas again our last night in Arizona. I again ordered the street tacos (why try to improve on perfection). My husband ordered a burro and enjoyed it.  I'm not sure why this restaurant only has 2 1/2 stars. It is a nice comfortable restaurant with good service,  great drink selections and awesome food priced appropriately. Give them a chance,  you won't regret it.

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chilada's - Tempe, AZ, United States. Chips, 2 salsas and table side guacamole
Photo of Aunt Chilada's - Tempe, AZ, United States. Street tacos

UzD0aOOBE8K9EHZq8xKSKA.text: In town for Spring Training, found this on our last day.  Wish we found it sooner!  Large portions, very fresh.  Five stars in my book, looks like a great happy hour place!

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chilada's - Tempe, AZ, United States

KHLriCSPr3YlFi9JcnRo2A.text: Had a business meeting here, locals brought me.  Now I go every time I'm in town, and if my niece who lives here is available she joins me. I recommend the beef enchiladas, with charro style  beans and rice. Chili relleno is as good, I order both!

vNW7ithDKk6xbffJKaZ6Vg.text: We live in the valley. Mexican food is everywhere.  This place is way over priced for Mexican food.  In the past I would have given 3 stars over priced Mexican food that was ok, nothing special, but okay.  After eating here on Tuesday I will never return.  The beef chimi made me very sick, a very unpleasant experience.

DWafEpGfqRIYkAdWbykO8Q.text: It's been awhile since I've eaten here for lunch, let alone eating here for dinner.  Therefore, since we were in the Tempe area attending a symposium, and had to stop by Fry's Electronics; we decided to give this place a try since it was just across Baseline Road, and it was already past 9PM.  The entrance, the bridge over the mini pond, the patio, and the overall exterior appearance was just very inviting. We were encouraged that this may turn out to be a good spontaneous choice for this evening late dinner.  When we entered, the hostess greeted us and notified us that there would be a 15-20 minute wait. Although there were plenty of available tables as it was later in the evening, and the place wasn't really that busy; we chalked it up to just standard operating procedure in preparation prior to guests being seated.  It didn't really take that long for them to buzz us, and guide us to our seats. The hostess provided us with two menus, and then the adventure began.  When we started perusing the two page menu, it appears that whomever used these last had poured remnants of salsa and minute pieces of chips onto this menu, as it was all over the backside of both mine and my wife's. We had to quickly grab and use the napkins we had to clean ourselves up from the annoying mess. We flagged down our server, Marcia, and she graciously apologized, and quickly gathered up cleaner menus.  Upon returning, she informed us that she would get us chips and salsa (we could've eaten the ones that were on the menus, but that would be gross and there wasn't enough of it anyway =) ).  However, she got busy, and in passing, she informed us that one of the other servers would do so. That did not happen, and when she realized that we still hadn't gotten what she promised us, she went ahead and took care of it and took our order.  Now, here's the quandary with this place at night. I am a firm believer in romantic candle lit dinner places, as long as there is enough ambient light from "somewhere" (including a well lit candle) so as to be able to read the menu. Such was not the case here. It was dimly lit in certain areas that I had to use my cell phone's flashlight app to provide enough lighting so that we could read our menus and know what to order.   Now, if you think that this was an anomaly, and we were just being particular about this. The 3 separate groups of new arrivals on the other side of the room did the same exact thing as we did. The gentlemen who sat alone across from us had to walk across the room to get enough lighting to read his bill. And Marcia, our server, had pull out her phone to light up ours and other guests' bills to verify the total. Not sure what is going on here, but a little bit more spot lighting in certain places would go a long way to solving this minor annoyance. In any case, this is the reason why I have no pictures as I ran down my phone's battery to light up the menu.  I had the shredded beef burro (enchilada style), and a shredded beef taco. My wife had the Chimichanga.   The flavor wasn't bad, but we've had better. However, after a long day of sparse sustenance, we were famished enough that we were able to consume our meails.  I had the flan for dessert. It was too sweet for my taste, and it didn't have enough caramel on top. It tasted like it was pre-packaged.  All in all, it was a mediocre experience that didn't start out well, but ended on a slightly higher note which is why this review is 3 stars, and not 2 - especially with the miscue on the salsa filled menus. Someone should really be checking these before handing them out to guests. I thought that is what the hostesses were supposed to do. Perhaps, I am mistaken.  Marcia, our server, was just very efficient and she managed to recover what could've been a disastrous experience for us.  In any case, it was a beautiful night, and had beautiful company; so I never did mind too much the missteps of this place.

s-9ZH1tQoBuc-ETCH1SaWg.text: Wonderful restaurant great location. Good atmosphere with candlelit table. Wonderful waitress. The food and the Margaritas are to die for. Certainly rated this as our favorite. Thank you

KPeW_8KqcGkfpyeqORSWmQ.text: I made my reservation for the wrong date (yikes) and showed up with a party of six a day early. The restaurant had a wedding and homecoming and they still managed to squeeze us in for a delicious Mexican-American dinner. Our server Anthony could have been a bit more attentive (forgot drink orders twice) but the food was delicious, the price was fair, and the outdoor seating area was clean and lovely. Props to the hostesses (wish I had their names) for getting us in on a busy night. Ole'!

ZXt7jUzxUF_T_YspBUfqrA.text: We were there on 12/13 right at 11:00am for a team Christmas lunch.  OMG! The hostess in the front had a major attitude when we told her we had a reservation. Without even looking at her book, she said "I don't have any reservations under that name" in a VERY rude tone. Then, on our way out we stopped to ask her about the tamales and if they sell them to go. Without even looking up at us, she said "there is a sign right there" and pointed to the wall behind her.  This is horrible customer service! She acted like it put her out to have to answer our question. As the hostess, she is the face of the restaurant since she is the first person we see. This is NOT the first thing you want your customers to deal with. Management needs to have a talk to her or give her some more training. Otherwise, she should be in the back of the house where she doesn't have to talk to customers. Food was really good though, we would have given 4-5 stars if it wasn't for the hostess.

I5-Nb4RIFO_PNtyGTNbYcg.text: Disaster. We stayed at the Arizona Grand during the summer so it was in off season. It took forever to be seated and waited upon. Food for four never arrived after 45 mins. I would stay at the Az Grand but would stay away from this Resturant.  We ended up leaving after a total of 3 hours.

jo54TJV3WQV_6ZcFj8jIsw.text: This would be good mexican food if we were in Quebec someplace... maybe I shouldn't say that, maybe they have quite good Mexican food in Canada...  But we have excellent Mexican food here in the Valley of the Sun.  Many five star locations.  More than any other location outside Mexico (and probably more than many a location inside Mexico)...  This spot is not one of them.   As the other reviewer stated, a pretty good happy hour, which is why it gets two stars, cause let's face it, a good happy hour can really set up your whole evening.  The food is not good.

mxqfi9mP22yx5QlZAeMi7Q.text: We had a meeting in the area and the seven of us decided to hit Aunt Chilada's for a late lunch. It was convenient but that's about all.  The service was friendly and quick enough, but the selections were completely overpriced. I ended up requesting just an appetizer just to keep within my lunch budget.  The lemonade was bad. As in made with turned lemons and not sweet at all. And if they didn't make it, they need to clean the fountain machine or something.  I got a shredded beef quesadilla and it was so greasy I had to tip my plate to keep the remainder from swimming while I tried to eat. It tasted good once I squeezed out the drippings from each piece. I wasn't impressed.  But what annoyed me the most was although they automatically added a 20% tip onto every ticket, when the server brought back my change from a $20, she kept the extra 83 cents. Rounding up quite a bit there, eh? $2.73 tip for a crappy $9.50 appetizer is asking too much.  Next time someone suggests this place, I'll pass.

yzR61j8LJVTBh7MsTD2xIg.text: Just stopped by for a bite to eat at this place. Stood at hostess stand for 10 minutes.  Chef walked by. A waitress walked by.  Neither helped us. Decided to take our money somewhere it would be appreciated.

rH6sxfKrJtNTcLGBf6LKew.text: Although we've eaten here several times over the past five years, we hadn't visited for awhile. I was a bit afraid to return after reading recent Yelp reviews. However, my husband and I were pleasantly pleased with the friendly and very efficient service. The restaurant was very busy with several special events, but we still received our food in about 15 minutes. Our waitress was genuinely friendly. The food was hot and fresh. I like non-fussy (OK, maybe bordering on Gringo?) Mexican food. I don't like too much cheese or too many onions or really hot sauces, so Aunt Chilada's was definitely my style. Portions were quite generous for the higher prices, so we came away full and satisfied with the experience.

43Z_cR0GZfdasXLjJg7DKg.text: My family and I were going to see a movie at the Mill and didn't want "mall food". We decided to try this place as we all LOVE mexican food and heard good things about this place. The wait was over an hour @ 7pm, so we dined in the lounge area. NEVER AGAIN !!!! The salsa was AWFUL, no flavor at all, chips were cold and it took 10 minutes to get drinks and the bean dip ( that was cold in the center). Our order came our fairly prompt, but WRONG DISHES. My chimi had no vegetables in it and my son's chimi was cool in the center. The server did correct my order after several minutes, but my family was almost done eating by the time it got there. If you want to go during the day to sit on the patio to have a beer/drink, its OK. Just don't eat anything !!

cVZwPa78GXON44yn_EhrLg.text: Pretty high prices for below average Mexican food. Just to give you an idea: Chipotle is be better tasting! Lol! Perfect place to grab a drink and an appetizer and sit at the patio- chips and salsa were good. Then have your main curse somewhere else. We went there for lack of restaurants at a walking distance from the Arizona Grand Resort. The patio and ambiance were nice and the weather was perfect to sit outside. Service was good. We ordered a small guacamole. The avocados were ripe, but the guacamole had no flavor and it had awkwardly a bit of shredded cheese on top. We kept adding salsa, limes and salt to add flavor to the guacamole. My friend ordered fish tacos. Parts of the fish were burnt. My other friend and I ordered a combo of enchilada with a chile relleno. Half of the plate was covered with melted yellow and white cheese. After finding the chile relleno and enchilada under the melted cheese they were ok. Asked for tortillas and charged us extra each without letting us know for chewy tortillas. The amounts of food are large, that's for sure. The side of Fideo was not very good. I don't mind paying 30-40 dollars for good food, but this felt as money not well spent.

gcOu0i1IKP0W6B2eNw0c-Q.text: YUM! Good food, ok atmosphere, good staff.

qHmvvCpxiX6LsaYu4vlxsg.text: Aunt Chilada's s simply put, just OK.  They have a pretty big menu, but I don't know that I would say they have a speciality.  The nice thing about AC's is that they have a big patio area and they are great for larger groups.  So if you are looking to sneak away for a long lunch in the sun on a spring day or if you have your office lunch (we take our new hires here) and need the space, then come here.    Now, if you are looking for some great full flavored Mexican, then keep on looking.  The chips and salsa are good here and after that, everything kind of blends in as the typical mexican.

rka9WT_hhkpmM3-HlrNV0A.text: This place is mediocre at best. I love Mexican but I won't be coming back here again. My refried beans were a dull grey color and were not spiced or even salted. I ordered a number two which is a bean burrito enchilada style with a beef tamale. The tamale was so dry I couldn't even finish it. Simply put, I don't recommend it. There are so many better Mexican restaurants in Phoenix. Never again.

DsLUjUtE-W_8s9eCcv8o3g.text: The server was great and the drinks were good. I had a mojito and house margarita. Being a pescatarian it's always a challenge eating out especially for mexican food. I called ahead and they do use lard in their refried beans and chicken stock in their rice for any vegans, vegetarians or pescatarians out there. I ordered the fish tacos and they were some of the worst fish tacos I've ever had!! They were way too fishy and had no other flavor. I had to add salsa and lemon to make them edible. My friend had the swordfish tacos and those looked and tasted way better except they had a bit too much pepper. If I go back I will order those. The black beans were pretty good.

iIiy_UHy6KNenwAeo2IO_w.text: Had been wanting to try this place for years and fiinally got the chance last Sunday evening. We was very happy with the service and the food was GREAT! Salsa and chips awesome and so was our waitress. Food was served HOT and fast!  Loved sitting on the patio. Planning to go back again this next Friday to help a friend celebrate his birthday. Hope it's as good as it was last week! Not sure why there are so many negative reviews. We were very pleased!

N_fsyb4TogZFCtnbX-u3cA.text: It's not great... but it's not awful. A little overpriced for mediocre food. Love the spinach enchiladas. If you're in the area and there's nowhere else close by you want to travel for Mexican, it will do.

uq93eezZlSUvTbw37Tp0Hw.text: Went to this place while on vacation in Tempe. Place looked chill from the outside and we were starving so my friends and I decided to check it out. The salsa tasted like someone put a jar of oregano in it. It was awful! I ordered a Carnitas burrito. I had to ask them to add beans and rice to a 10 dollar burrito. I was like what the hell?? Asked them to put green sauce on it as well. It was sooo bland and boring. Green sauce had no spice or flavor. Would not recommend this place. Crappy and overpriced. My friends dish was also very bland. Should of went to Del Taco. The good side was that the Staff was friendly..

jbcxQMAUtW7ff5_mVppbng.text: Tourists....  Would love this place. I supposed that is why it is within walking distance of the Arizona Grand Resort. As for me, a longtime local, I could easily pass on this place.  We asked to be seated on the patio in the shade. Turns out only half the table was covered and it was getting hot. We saw a bunch of umbrellas in the corner not be used and asked our server if we could have another umbrella to cover the two that were roasting in the sun. She got upset. She actually said no! My cousin decided to take matters into his own hands and get one. The server came flying over and told him that was against the rules. She is not allowed to take an umbrella from another servers section. Weird as there were not any patrons in the area. Her attitude sucked. She was very lucky that I was not deciding how much to tip.  The chips were OK and the salsa was actually good.  I had the chicken enchiladas, meh. The sauce had no flavor.  The best part was hand feeding the ducks on the patio.   The prices are outrageous for the caliber of food you receive.   Skip it. Go somewhere that serves real Mexican food and provides friendly service.   Next...

y_jfHe5fDkSASIZFXfIdng.text: My dad ordered a chile relleno.... and it came out with what looked like chicken inside?? what the??? I flagged down our sweet server Norma who said although she would never dare make her own chile relleno that way, Aunt chilada's does.  It seriously looked like canned chicken and I was shocked they would ruin a simple dish like that by adding chicken stuffed inside.  My dish was just simple taquitos and the chicken was so dry it was near jerky.  Salsa was average... nothing about this place was "mexican" and the ducks all over the place kinda grossed me out.  NEVER again will I spend my $ or allow anyone to spend theirs while in company.  Aunt Chilada's... you FAIL!

jJ9f0n16034A6R6hScWR-A.text: Oh Dear Aunt Chilada, where did you go?  When I was young we would go out to eat on very special occasions.  I remember the excitement of going to Aunt Chilada's for birthday dinners and having a great time.    I'm not sure if it's the childhood memories not holding up, or the change in management, but Aunt Chilada's truly disappointed me.  We went with a part of four, and I was the only person who had been there before.  The interior and decor was EXACTLY as I remembered it, meaning that in 15 years, I don't think they've even touched up the paint.  Once seated, we found that the room was very noisy, with only 3 parties in the room.  It was also extremely crowded, with tables much closer than they needed to be.  The service was adequate, other than sitting dry waiting for more drinks.  They did bring chips and salsa quickly, and the staff was polite.  Now, to the part that was so heartbreaking for me.  The food.  Meh about sums up what I thought.  I tried a little off of everyone's plate, and across the board it was so-so.  Nothing inspired me, nothing stood out.  While it's still better than Taco Bell, it really seemed like they were phoning it in.  There was no symphony of flavors, nothing unexpected.   All in all, this is a good place to take your East Coast relatives who can't handle spice, for a stereotypical Mexican meal.  It's kind of like the Disney version of Mexico.  For natives like myself, especially those who either cook their own food, or love a little spice and excitement, don't waste your time.

12mwhQq3tpmFuqs2or8bIQ.text: I loved the chips and salsa, the tacos were great but I honestly can't remember anything else about this place.  went here last week and it was fine, not over priced but cool casual spot.  I did like the noodle thing they have as a side dish, I know others don't have the same thoughts but I added a little salsa and beans and it was quite tasty :) I think it's worth going at least once, but I personally am not planning on being a regular.

ncnAwxX9adud-G9EC7I72w.text: We attended a group event here a few months ago, the set-up was nice, the food was ok, bland but typical for a large group meeting.

qc_Nyois9OH_0COn_XqGKQ.text: Bland and tasteless except the Talapia which tasted like olives and was sent back. The service was slow and inattentive. The only redeeming quality was the chips. While they were fresh and hot, the salsa was not. Even with extra heat requested, the salsa was bland. This is definitely not a Mexican restaurant any Mexican would be caught dead patronizing. It is definitely a place for gringos with no taste or high expectations.

A7JOyHe2EDc2EsqjTzAw7w.text: Not good at all.  Average at best.  Table we were sat at was sticky and needed wiping down, had to ask the server twice to do it.  Food was ok but not good.

xmpxSS46eWdOIQdLfSoLLA.text: It was my husband's birthday and we were a group of 12 friends. I called in at 5:30pm to book a table for dinner since we were a big group and I wanted to make sure there was no wait time but the lady who picked the call told me that they weren't taking any reservations and that I could just walk in. We arrived there at 7:00pm and when asked for a table, the hostess asked us to wait for 40 - 50min. We kept waiting and their staff didn't even bother to let us know that it was taking so much time. Their only answer was that there were open tables but were short staffed. I understand but wouldn't it be courteous to at least let us know when such a big group is waiting to be seated.    We were ready to order 5min after we got the table because everybody were hungry by then, our server didn't bother to come get the order or to even check on us. We had to let 2 different waiters know that we were ready to order. After the long wait, one would hope that at least the food would be good but unfortunately that wasn't True too. The fajitas were cold and looked like the veggies on it weren't fresh either.   I ordered Enchiladas de Harina and hold the server in specific that I wanted vegetarian option since I am a strict vegetarian and guess what, he brought in Chicken enchiladas at the 11th hour when the restaurant was closing. I was so furious and let him know that I wasn't happy at all with the food and the service and all I got back as an answer was "can I take this plate away" really???? don't you even care what the customer is saying?   Deeply regret making this restaurant choice, I had 11 other friends who went home still hungry. You just ruined my husband's birthday dinner.

qSu7hP3BtjvoVyucGgmruw.text: Met up with other family members for dinner. It was a total of four of us. Food was very good. Service was a bit slow, but it was only because of the very big heavy crowd because of the Christmas holiday.  Staff was friendly and helpful.  We will be returning

bLI3mENqv_WRz4hZ2MKvIg.text: I went here while on lunch this past Friday with a co-worker. I have to admit, I was pleasantly surprised with their items on their menu. I ordered the 2 shredded chicken enchiladas with black beans and rice & it was delicious! The portions were really big! My coworker also ordered 2 enchiladas, one cheese one shredded chicken & she also said they were really good. Her sides she chose were rice & fidello. I was surprised to notice that they offered fidello, she said it was really good.  I was most excited that I only paid about $16.00 with a drink & $4.00 for a tip, so total of $20 for really good food, great service & VERY LARGE portions. I would recommend this place to others. They have a nice patio area where you can sit outside & there is a man made pond, which was very nice. They also offer happy hour daily so thats a plus!

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chilada's - Tempe, AZ, United States

Ql-HYQbb-MhzGbUAahQHUg.text: *DISCLAIMER* I've been here three times and each time was for happy hour (chips/salsa and margaritas) . The salsa is really great and as are the chips. The margaritas have nice taste to them and the perfect amount of alcohol. So don't get carried away cause it's easy to loose count lol.   I'm yet to try the food personally but my girlfriend did and she love the chicken tacos. The staff is really nice and friendly and it has atmosphere to it very authentic. I would advise getting there on the earlier end of happy hour as the location is right on baseline and next to the i10 so lots of traffic getting in and out so save yourself the headache by arriving late. Side note happy hour ends at 6pm!

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chilada's - Tempe, AZ, United States

Uby4EP-oTqgePYjUgX_Abg.text: I was staying at the Arizona Grand Resort for a conference and chose to dine at Aunt Chilada's for dinner one night. I sat outside which had a cool vibe.  Not the best Mexican food I've ever had, but definitely good. I enjoyed my enchiladas and margarita.  Salsa and chips were good too! Overall, a relaxing dining experience.

gZaJEB5L443Sx2bNEi8MzA.text: We had heard that Aunt Chilada's was a great place for Mexican food and decided to give it a try.  It was close to 1PM.  The small dining area next to the hostess was empty and I asked if we could sit there.  Hostess said no but would seat us in the main dining room.  That place was packed.  It was not only packed it was extremely noisy.  There were three groups and individual tables were placed between them.  Oh my!  What an awful environment.  We waited for a while and no server arrived.  So, we checked out the lunch menu.   Nothing about this menu was inexpensive.  It was pretty pricey for lunch.  The single taco plate was $10.99.  We sat there debating whether to stay or leave.  Our server hadn't arrived yet and too many negatives were already coming up about this place --- loud, expensive and slow service is what we were seeing.  No thanks.  We went down the road and had a great lunch.

BxpvOTZaEXSysPiTsXf_YQ.text: Came to eat after hiking (around 11a)- was not busy. Seated quickly. Service was quick and friendly. Sat outside (it's March, so weather is perfect!) And enjoyed the patio.  Ordered steak and chicken fajitas- were perfect!  Still sizzling on the skillet, lots of meat & veggies!  Taste was great!  Beans & fideo were good too!    Love the chips & salsa too!

J-plwJHnsfD9nbiGTYMnUw.text: I was staying at the Arizona Grand Resort and Spa and this is right off the property and we could request transportation.  There are two buildings, seating is done at one.  The numerous times I went I was helped right away, seated right away and the food came very quickly and tasted wonderful.  They give you large container of chips and couple different salsas one hot one regular which is very chunky.  I ordered a chicken burrito which was very tasty, large chunks of delicious chicken the only thing that tasted a bit off for me was the burrito sauce at first tasted burnt but it was not I believe it was the chili in the sauce that I did become more accustomed to.  I then ordered the next day a chicken enchilada again very tasty and flavorful chicken, the rice was delicious as well as the beans.  I was not looking to spending over $20 a meal for myself but that is what it averaged with a tip, maybe I am more frugal than this place would allow.  The third day I ordered the smaller portion of just one enchilada with beans and rice this seems to be more appropriate for me and it was just over $10.  Overall I would return again if in the area.

Photo of Aunt Chilada's - Tempe, AZ, United States. Way to restaurant from resort

xMc3q_4VFTONyTY_qEdmZQ.text: SUPER GOOD FOOD! Had the chicken enchiladas! BOMB!  Also the service was fantastic! Would go back for sure!

JmkXI04ZKopAD_rbSUzUIA.text: I had a steak plate and appetizer sampler. Both were very good. I'd come back here. Steak was so tender, juicy and flavorful. Creamy jalapeno dip(?) in the appetizer sampler was really good too. I liked their spicy salsa. Our waitress was nice but I can imagine service could be slow during busy hours.

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chilada's - Tempe, AZ, United States. Steak. So tender &amp; flavorful.

8bOiIpZLBSijQg6n89G8UA.text: Not kids friendly. They didn't was confused how they going to seat us. Was to much to handle. Was 114 outside and inside was 90 degrees.

GrCbhTFGSJYpAnc6zHGCmA.text: Born and raised in Arizona and I can't believe this was my first time here! We just finished a race and wanted something close and different so gave it a shot! The weather was beautiful so patio it was. It really is a great patio. Quirky decoration that adds to the charm in my opinion. Service was ok, we did mention it was our first time in and asked what they recommend and he looked like we were asking for the moon. He suggested a burrito but didn't really sell it. So we got some cold dos xx and tried two dishes. I really liked their salsa, it absolutely tasted fresh and was on point. The green chili burrito was really good and the steak dish was very very salty. The guacamole was already browning which brought this review down. Don't serve it when you can see it is a day old!  Overall we would go back for the burrito but not out of our way. The prices were very steep for lunch. Two meals and two small drafts were over $50. That seemed ridiculous for lunch. There didn't seem to be any specials or any lunch items and $13+ for a burrito and it was good but not that good. Would have been nice if the salsa had a slight kick, it did not but it was fresh unlike the guacamole.

VA5xWDw4UgmG2R74vMIgDg.text: It's been several years since we ate here. It will be several more before we come back. Over priced and absolutely no flavor in anything except the hotter salsa. Tortilla was so soggy it couldn't be cut with a fork when I ordered a chicken burrito and asked for a bit of green enchilada sauce on top.  Hostess was confused about where to seat us and the room she chose was so noisy it was difficult to visit.  Long and short of it. We have probably paid our last visit.

mXE3JwTz2wlyu83UHoAzbQ.text: Great experience at Aunt Chilada's on Baseline Road on Sunday, June 30th. Katie is the best wait person I've ever run into at a restaurant!

YAWGwh2WcegoCpFSo8xhrg.text: Ate outside on the brightly covered patio. Pleasant experience having tableside guacamole. Food was good overall, just not great. Molcajete bowl was good to split for 2 people

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chilada's - Tempe, AZ, United States

Q1rK_gneLi8wDw992JRexA.text: Great food, great environment, great staff, great scenery!! Absolutely love it!! Aunt Chilada's is absolutely beyond amazing! I especially love their fried ice cream it is to die for!

qQ957fe4Dswjjfw5JOl5jQ.text: How the heck does this place have a 2 star rating?!  Has anyone even TRIED that queso dip?  Um...HELLO. It's kind of amazing...y'all need more margaritas in your life.  Granted, I came here for a work catered private party so everything was set up super nicely for us and was wonderful. We had an open bar serving bomb af margaritas all night so it's really hard to complain about this place; everything tastes better when it's free and you're drunk off free booze (let's be honest).  Oh, and that flourless chocolate cake? Definitely wanted to eat like 100 slices of that. Creamy af.

Photo of Aunt Chilada's - Tempe, AZ, United States

VIllPQZdjhNgwXOCOfm6kw.text: Great place with speedy service loved the taco plate I had carnitas with black beans so amazing! Oh and the blended pomegranate margarita hell ya!! My dining mates weren't super excited about the regular refried beans but all else amazing including decor.
