fVi8nXslVl7fmGzKyUjbBg.text: So, we stopped here because the munchkin went out of town and we thought happy hour to start off the weekend would be fun. It definitely was. $4 margaritas- Yes, please!!! Our waitress Katie B. was marvelous. Super nice and I loved how when we got our food she commented, "Oh, I'm so happy for you both." Like she already knew it was going to be the best food. Haha. Something invigorating about a person who just enjoys their job. I got the carne asada quesadilla, which went great with my margarita and my few sips of water, haha. Husband won the choice of the night though with his shredded beef chimilingas which he ordered a side of jalapeno cream cheese sauce. Juicy. Tasty. And if I hadn't had a family event to get to later on that night (hence the happy hour), I probably would've ordered another serving. One thing to keep in mind though, can be a bit pricey but from the plates I saw coming out to other guests, very generous portions. Overall, good way to start our long weekend. Wouldn't mind coming back again soon.

wSMFCJnMlkMOuf_PtlvVLA.text: Great Mexican place with a cool vibe to it. They have chips and salsa that is super hard to beat, and their drinks are delicious. We got a pina colada and a margarita and they were both exceptional! I got the enchiladas and they were the best I've had in a while. Their beans can't really be beat either! Will definitely be back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chilada's - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Aunt Chilada's - Tempe, AZ, United States

npyFCmmPI3D5SHDCLFXsCg.text: The kids decided this was "Meh-xican" food. I have to agree that it was just OK. Our waitress was nice and attentive, but the food was pretty bland; even the jalapenos lacked bite.  I'd read other reviews to beware that the salsa here was spicier than at most places -- I've got to say that was definitely NOT my experience. I don't know if they've gotten complaints and default to a mild version for the tourists, but ours was little more than tomato sauce with a few onions in it.  On the plus side, the kids absolutely LOVED their cheese crisps.

7noG71LXrqt2B1VKz3J8BQ.text: My wife and I went here for our anniversary the other night. the service was great and the food was really good. I got the fish tacos and they are some of the best I've ever had. And I'm picky. The queso dip is phenomenal. Unfortunately the wife and I got sick that night. Don't know if it's related but it easy pretty bad. Good place overall but I don't know if I'll be back.

-LOeGWk3BJGLTH9qgnW_jg.text: Our service was amazing. John took excellent care of our party of 3. The food was hot and delicious. Highly recommended.

fLP7Bu0YDE1WVjYb5JxEzQ.text: I do not know why this  place got so many low ratings. Decent mexican food and nice service. The margaritas are wonderful. The decor is cheeky cute!

XGqhZmS5bFJe5B_DAEYRmA.text: I love this place.  One of my favorites in the valley... the service is great and the food is sooooo good.  Not sure if they changed the salsa recipe, but if they did....would prefer the original one to the one they are serving now....  If you sit on the patio, ask for Jen as your server...she is friendly, and great, we try to get her section every time we go there......awesome place to dine outside during the fall,,,,,  Please go back to the original salsa!!!!!!

eJu_7HpaDSTxZD5-5SxwdA.text: This place is what I call a "tourist" mexican restaurant, although the chips are good, there is not much else I would recommend.  I came with a group otherwise I would not normally come here.  Service was great considering we were like 20 people.

wXMuft6nFUJkgBHoVroAwA.text: Got there during happy hour.  Great $3 Negro Modelo on draft, only superceded by the fabulous four dollar happy hour menu.  Two full enchiladas (pick your type), generous chips and refills and lots of different salsas if you know to ask.  Pretty decent.

LqzRy9k6-jBXRxyAEXRWIg.text: Met my parents here for an early dinner on a Saturday.  Cute place, quick service. We enjoyed the 2 types of salsa.  The first is a very chunky mild tomato salsa and the other is smoother by spicier.   We all enjoyed to charro beans but mixed opinions on the fide.  The burros and chimis were well portioned meat to tortilla ratio.  My only complaint is how the street tacos were served- covered in cabbage to the extent that I could not identify which taco was which.  Very difficult to eat and enjoy.   Will be back to try some margaritas!

D1gMajbbRjIAIOZOpYnJTA.text: This place is average. The place is really nice inside, but the food is just alright. Pricing is fair for what they serve. The desert it's pretty good with limited options tho. Our server was fine, but she never came back to check in on us. lol

mXDpCpUS0Jp4RxSJwts6cw.text: Waited at a table for over 20 minutes and a server did not come to say hello or take drink orders.  It appeared short staffed with minimal servers.  We left the restaurant without an apology or even a willingness to make it right.  This is not the reataurant if you want service of any kind!

H5N4sWCQHBkxcywV9YSdyg.text: First impressions are everything when trying a new restaurant, so it's unfortunate the hostess was very rude to me. If I wasn't starving and my lunch options were limited (staying on property with no transportation), I would have walked right out. The hostess ignored me at the hostess stand (however happily asked the woman BEHIND me for her name) then never mentioned I could sit in the "high top" area (was eating alone) which was empty. Rather she had me wait 20 min to put me at a table for four in a room with a party of 10. Aside from the bad initial reaction, the food was just OK. I got the fish tacos which were Fine, nothing special (surprised to find a layer of cheese at the bottom). The chips were bland but the margarita made up for this un-memorable visit.

9LWJ4xii--wJ2tboVGIZpw.text: We use to live in OC California and our main mex food was Micasa in New Port Beach.  Micasa has changed hands in the last few years but had the best salsa and food.  So since moving to Phoenix 3mo. ago we've been looking for a Sonora style mex restaurant that was similar to Micasa.  The salsa comes in two bowls which we mix and love.  The food I'll say just one thing.  With all the mex restaurants Aunt Chilada's gives you large portions and the enchiladas actually are stuffed with meat.  So if your missing your Micasa fix this is really close.

LKWXTcUnFYv6gt1-T6BhzQ.text: Food was ok maybe would have been better if I could actually eat it instead of swating all the flies away

knZpQD7SGZuJG_Egydl1UQ.text: Passable.  Good for big groups.  The queso is better than the chips and salsa.  The various menu items *sound* incredible, and what I've had wasn't bad by any means, but not particularly memorable either.  Extremely convenient if you're staying at the hotel next door though, definitely worth it in that case.

WMOus1nJUIEGSNHV0cygEg.text: The food is just Meh, and I really don't have much to say about it, other than it's an expensive kind of Meh, but they recently removed all of the Pokemon GO stops from the area, as well as near other local businesses. It makes for a boring evening if you're a GO player, or have kids.

mBz1yr0KDr2a3Md0b-hQTQ.text: Food was good and so were the drinks. The problem was getting them. Bar tenders were really bad, and the bar is only bout 8 foot long. If it is busy expect to be ignored for at least 15 minutes. Order drinks and food together, it will take a while to see her again. Happened all 3 times I went. Like another review said typical resort restaurant.

ynbiShk2kK-qsuQy-QCBEQ.text: I do not feel like this place is worth a stop for dinner if you like good food.  It is over-priced for food that is so ordinary and un-Mexican tasting to me.  The salsa was ok and I Iiked the the rice and beans.  The chicken in my burrito wasn't good and didn't like the texture or the way it was cooked. It was pretty much flavorless. The food is very ordinary.    For 4 adults and 2 little kids at dinner it was $77 with tip and we only had tea and water. I would have enjoyed the flavors of the food at Qdoba or Chipotle better and it would've cost less.  It's a neat building and I enjoyed sitting outside in the evening. I guess we pay a premium for that. The service we had was good, and I can tell the wait staff works hard to serve. I seem to remember that 10-15 years ago the food was much better.   I would not recommend Aunt Chilada's to someone that wants good Mexican food. I don't need to go back.

QEbBnCyuUUJXapIj6c2peQ.text: I went into this restaurant excited to try another Mexican restaurant. I ordered a beef chimichanga, I had the beans, rice and fideos as well. And it was delicious. I Would put more effort in the salsa for the chips, I was not sure if it was canned or not. I ordered it to go, so I do not know how a complete experience in the restaurant would rate. But I heard some employees worried that some patrons would not be able to hear each other because their tv was too loud and they were trying to fix the problem. The gentleman helping me was very polite.

rPUGDZP6K_T9D4PKtK6PJg.text: I'm a sucker for a nice patio.  Went here for a work happy hour - it's been a LOT of years since I was at this location. It's similar to the one at Squaw Peak - but not quite as much charm. (Likely due to lack of age of the building.)  Service was solid, food was acceptable gringo-Mex, and the people with mixed drinks seemed to like them. (As long as the Negro Modelo is cold and the glass around the lip of the bottle isn't chipped, it's on par with every other one I've ever had, so I really can't judge the drinks.)  I would never choose this place based on food alone - but when you have a group and the weather is patio-rific, if's not a bad choice at all!

l_R0ZUKBkZSJFg6Phtz8wA.text: I've been going to this restaurant off/on for 20 years. My recent experience with this location is a below average experience. Our server was average. The #3 chicken taco and chicken enchilada was so-so. The restaurant hasn't been updated any time recently. I asked for the flour tortilla chips and they weren't that tasty and seemed very flat this time. The salsa, historically pretty good, was also below average. With all the solid Mexican restaurants in town, this location isn't bad, but it isn't great either.

eSPQaZM9L5Sqxlud-Kh-Dw.text: Yum and yet a bit of a yawn.  Yes it was a bit of yesterday as I appreciated the decor and the speed of the service.  Nothing stood out much.  The place was clean and made me think of driving a few hours further south for the real deal...and that cannot be bad...right?  To be reminded of the real thing so much that you want to leave where you are and go get the real thing?  Your call...not yuck, though.

7ryCXJ-8hfu2oko6xSO3jw.text: 2 words: not good. The mexican food here is as far from authentic as you can get, plus it is overpriced. I got the chicken tortilla soup to start off with and it was soooo bland and flavorless and loaded with tons of cheesy goop. Then I got a taco and tostada and both were of lower standards than taco bell (I would have preferred a taco bell taco). When I go to a Mexican restaurant in Arizona I expect a freshly fried taco shell, not your store bought Ortega brand taco shell and I expect shredded beef, but at Aunt Chilada's you get the store bought shells and ground beef! I won't return.

8Ru3cNaYWItp4NgyriMQ3Q.text: Maybe it was because I was starving... I liked the food.  We were at the Pointe for a trade show and this is where we ended up for lunch.  We had no wait and the food was really good, I got a shredded beef cheese crisp and my coworker got the chimi plate.  The chips and salsa were good.  Only issue I had was my empty ice tea glass, I finally had to ask for more when our bill was delivered.

6BiqQ1DqfQRY4nkkozqv_A.text: Always a fun time! No real happy hour specials, but they do have a small free buffet. The food is pretty good. Weekend Nights usually have a live band. A decent selection of beer.

ntj-Ahm__rKIf5OjFgunSQ.text: Good food, good prices, and a nice patio. I would go back in the future. This location is good for guests of the Arizona Grand Resort. You can walk or have a short drive to Aunt Chilada's. The salsa was really good!

iYAnsszrxxlP19Fgxe7gMg.text: On a hot summer day in early August upon deciding to eat Mexican food, we arrived at Aunt Chiladas and were immediately greeted by a young dapper server named Connor. Upon being seated in a cozy corner facing a pond with two lively ducks, we were brought an excess of warm chips and refreshing salsa. Our server Connor, who I might add was speedy, charming, and friendly, recommended us margaritas and in the blink of an eye they were bestowed upon us like mana from the heavens. During our meal, Connor also brought us different salsas to try out. After our tongues were seared with the intangible and unrelenting pain of ghost peppers, Connor brought us milk without even being asked to. Throughout our meal he was extremely attentive and even gave an excellent demonstration of how to prepare authentic guacamole. Thank you for the great service, we will definitely  be going again soon and sitting in Connor's section.

rVlXFI4VGrPcKEMt2GRJgQ.text: The food wasn't bad, but I have definitely had better.  The outside atmosphere was very nice, the staff was also very friendly.  I'd go back but it isn't what i'm accustomed too.

YjUl4XcD5ir9cyN3e1Fg1g.text: There were some pro's about this place: Service was decent and some of the food was really good. However, other food was just meh. The items that were good: Salsa had lots of onions in it which made me happy (I am a big onion lover!) and had a really good fresh flavor, the chips were nice and crisp, the jalapeno cream sauce that came with my numero ocho (8) combo was delicious with just the right amount of spice, and the fideo that the hubby ordered was different but I really enjoyed it (hubby said it was too plain for him). Now onto the other food: Hubby said his pork chimichanga wasn't bad and that the pork was cooked well but needed more seasoning, my chili relleno was ok but the batter had a weird texture to it, and my spinach enchilada was not very good at all. I like to have other components inside the enchilada rather then just plain spinach and unfortunately, these just had lumps of unflavored spinach with nothing else. So all in all, I would say this place was ok. There were some items that are good enough for me to come back but I would just try something else on the next visit.

qNmfPx-LvRbaelgRiYmhaw.text: This place is on my regular lunch rotation when meeting friends.  I usually get the Aunt Chilada's Special which is a green chili chimichanga, or the tacos pescado (fish tacos).  It is the only place I have ever had fedeo which is a Mexican spaghetti.    I like the food, and more importantly, my Chicana wife likes the food and she is picky about Mexican food.  This is not the cheapest place for good Mexican food, but it is a fun place to meet with friends.

Go9zj0-PHU8-TqFjfzZbuQ.text: I love the food here, and great great service.  I love to sit on the patio in the spring, it is a very nice atmosphere.  Plenty of good food to choose from on the menu and the portions and sides are generous for the prices.  Never had a margarita so can't judge that but the beer tastes good.

ANFgDAvY4vK0ZcvHcxofRA.text: I used to love to go here. The food used to be excellent every time you went. Now you never know what to expect and the prices are too high for the so-so food. I will go back again someday but not real soon. For a family of 4 dinner after my son's graduation cost $65. Way to expensive for mediocre food.

Unxn55_ZQmqFEoGLDoQzWA.text: the restaurant we really wanted to try was closed on a Monday so we went to Aunt Chilada's.  It was 2nd time I'd been there in 3 years;  I forgot I was there a few years ago.  Food is FAIR to average (at best) for mexican.  Nice outdoor area.  Will not likely return, there are plenty of places that are MUCH better for Mexican food.

vlP3g_weEdhLEjnMTHW0Tw.text: I grew up around here... before there was the Pointe at South Mountain and any of the office suites that line baseline road there was orange groves and nestled within were cool old houses along with a Mexican restaurant called Juan Tanamera's.  In fact my dad's friend built his house there and I have pictures from the 70's of my dad helping to build this house.  My dad would bring my sister and I here for dinner often... the food was great and we always had a great time.  Once the Pointe was built they bought the Mexican restaurant and named it Aunt Chilada's.  Everything changed... the menu was different, the staff was different.  The only thing that remained the same was the structure of the building and the cool ponds that surrounded it which no longer have coy but sometimes an occasional duck.  I agree with the other reviewers of this place that the service is lack luster and the food is OK.  There is one thing I like here and that is the albondigas soup... small bite sized meatballs with veggies and a savory broth; they also put fideo noodles in it which makes it even better.  I do crave this soup and since it is very close to my work i often call in an order of it.  Every time I walk in to pick it up it always brings up fond memories from the past.

puLesW8__meuU3X3MGBURA.text: Solid Mexican food, good drinks, nice location

Uk-yMftrcA-gw_zJxixSXg.text: I've been here many times. Mostly with business associates.  The food is good but average for an Americanized Mexican Food place. I've never had anything bad here. Every, but it's not worth the drive from my home.  If your close by, it is better than other places nearby. You do get plenty of food for the money and it is satisfying.

x_ViJpfQ8E30T7Lx4dA_AA.text: The food is edible, but not good. I have been there a few times and have always sat outside which is a nice patio area.  However, a nice patio does not overcome the bland food and mediocre service. You are in Arizona, there is much better Mexican food to be eaten.

sEELthnRF8mIkAK0owgeMA.text: Oh my goodness, this is such an Arizona institution. I came here recently while on vacation in Phoenix. It had been at least 10 years since I had good Mexican food. And let's be honest. While this is not totally authentic Mexican it's good old AZ-style Sonoran-American combo plate comfort food. And it's really not that easy to find on the east coast. I grew up on this stuff so the nostalgia factor is huge. Such a pleasure having a chile relleno with frijoles refritos, rice and giant frozen margarita. Ahhhh, watch out for that brain freeze. The chips and salsa could have been a little better, but I ate too many of them as is.

dBqmMUZU0IUjAZsryIn4Dg.text: My family (party of 17) ate at Aunt Chilada's and celebrated an early Christmas meal while we were all together before some had to travel back to Colorado.  I cannot say enough about the service, Sommer, was amazing, attentive and not at all flustered by the 17 of us (4 of whom were rowdy kids) asking for different requests during the dinner.  The food was fantastic, great flavors and the table side guacamole experience was so yummy, highly recommend it!  The restaurant was a great place to take my family to and celebrate the holiday season, the beautiful decorations and Christmas trees made the evening that much more special.  Thank you Aunt Chilada's staff for a great dining experience and helping a family make some great memories.

3B7jjDkhzSVXS_T9egw_sA.text: The food was okay not the best, my mom got chicken in her salad which was raw on the inside. They luckily fixed it but did not remove anything from our bill. My food was okay (I got the burro) I would not recommend this place. My refried beans did not taste very good either, I think beans out of a can would taste better than these.

MHnfbmUfzb2lfXyYaezcoQ.text: I'm so disappointed. I went to he website and saw the Pollo Fundido and immediately started to head east to the Tempe location. Host and waitress were friend and pleasant. My disappointment came from the "chicken" not actually being chicken. Instead they were "chicken bi-products" chicken strips that weren't  even seasoned or grilled. You know the frozen "grilled" ones? They were microwaved and covered in the fundido sauce. The Fideo was seasone by obviously very old.   My pinacolada was nothing to brag about. Mediocre at best. Though the menu did specify chicken strips, I expected "real" quality chicken seasoned and grilled. Especially consider the price of the entree. I can only imagine what the beef is like. Perhaps it comes in a can? Becky the waitress was empathetic and offered to remove the entree from my bill. Customer service was good. Good was bad. Music...... was entertaining.

SMWcLbGq1YM0ctkbHrLpvA.text: We were visiting from out of state and had lunch here. I had chicken enchiladas. The combo of the chicken and the enchilada sauce tasted like it had been sprinkled with unicorn dust. What made these enchiladas so good? Please tell me. We were leaving town the next day so we had to have dinner there again that night before we had to kiss the best restaurant enchiladas I ever tasted goodbye. Salsa was very fresh and taste bud friendly. Don't base your decision to patronize on people's reviews that admit to having good experiences here but only write a review after one "bad" visit.

-nQoWim8JleUAXEPTYBCjQ.text: I was here on business for a week and decided to stop in for lunch with some other guys. I am from an area with a rather large hispanic population and as such I frequent Mexican and other hispanic places frequently and one thing that I noticed is that their prices are steep...but that could just be a cost of living difference. I had the buffet which included several chimichanga's rice, beans, and salad. Everything tasted great. They brought out typical nachos and salsa which did not push the envelope by any means. The mild salsa was pretty much diced tomatoes. The hot was not very hot at all. The staff was friendly and attentive. We were in and out pretty fast despite a lunch rush. Its a good find.

w-7-wtZr9llgBVUT15KIsg.text: I had such a lovely experience at this restaurant with my friend. We enjoyed the food so much! The Chicken Tortilla Soup was delicious. The traditional chicken burrito was huge and so delicious! I am not sure what the sauce was that I had on it but it was wonderful! I don't normally drink but the drinks we had were quite delicious too. The waiter was lovely. The atmosphere was terrific. I hope to visit Arizona again and eat there again!

j_eAmsKDrjUvw_ZdVavhCw.text: Let me just say that if I could give this place a 0 star I would..  Aunt Chilada's, I have been wanting to try this restaurant for a very very long time & when I decided to take my family here for a birthday gathering it all went way down south & I can thank the staff here for it. Tonight I had my family 11 people including 4 children come here for dinner 9-13-14 around 5 o'clock..  My family had decorated the table with birthday items and we were in a secluded corner it looked like they had set up for large parties, from what I believe we were the only people in this side of the section of the restaurant. After about 10 mins of the kids laughing and the adults talking and the birthday squeakers going this place was ready to kick us out..  After we had ordered our server told us to stop being loud & for us to stop using the birthday favors. We said okay and had taken them from the kids.. Then adults were still talking amongst each other and a "non-friendly" "extremely rude" charge/supervisor/manager named Lindsay comes over with some other people and asked to talk to my mom who made the arrangements in the corner, I for one felt very offended by this. She is extremely rude to my mom and basically tells us if we don't shut up and stop bothering other people that we were going to be kicked out..  Mom: Are you asking us that we should leave?" Lindsay: Yes, yes I'm wanting you to get out of our establishment."   I'm not quite sure if those are her exact words but yes she said "GET OUT" Who in the customer service business says " GET OUT" to a customer. YOU DON'T SAY THAT... HORRIBLE.  Who in the hell do you think you are to talk to my mother like that you pathetic piece of a "customer service" supervisor?!  She leaves with her little "helpers" and we sit down, my mom is beyond stressed out by this utmost disrespect. We are gathering our things to leave..  THEN we get it a third time right after Lindsey leaves!!  This idiot guy with some "professional" business clothes comes over to our table with security from the damn resort next door!  He starts telling us that we are being loud and blah blah blah.. I tell him " Sir, you and your charges/supervisors have come over multiple times to tell us the same thing, we have stopped being loud & using the party favors quite a while ago & you keep coming over and interrogating us constantly we get it we have stopped"   Manager: "Okay, okay.. um thanks..   Now you have really pissed me off, I now feel offended because you are attacking me in front of my children. One of my children has a "developmental delay" he does not understand why you are being this way to us..   My husband stands up and says "why don't we just leave, they are probably going to just spit in our food anyways" yeah why dont we just go..  We stand up and start packing our things, what a horrible birthday dinner this has turned out to be. I have had bad service but to be attacking your customers because they are being "loud" is no excuse, they could have asked us kindly to be quiet but no, they would rather lose out on 200+ dollars of our money.   The only thing good that came out of this is that they excused our couple fountain drinks and iced teas that we did order.   Oh, and another thing the salsa tastes like crap, it was cold and tasted like something I would buy off the counter in the store for example: pace..  What a bad restaurant, don't go here, there are plenty of other good Mexican food restaurants around that are more enjoyable than this place..

Eqb7tBJDTDnKVojS6fiX2Q.text: This is the third visit to Aunt Chiladas Restaurant in Tempe. We love the ambiance,  the colors,  the music. Tasha is especially helpful and friendly this evening as we arrived early for dinner with friends fron West Virginia.  Pics of the will follow on FB. Right now we're cozied into the corner table in the bar with dtinks chips and salsa. A perfect beginning to a great evening here with friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chilada's - Tempe, AZ, United States. Waiting for friends

pKk10gTH8EZZcL-_sZXBYg.text: Perhaps management has been paying attention to Yelpers. Our service tonight was awesome!  My wife, daughter, and I spent a lovely evening enjoying decent Mexican food and each other's company. Our waitress was great ! Never did we have to ask for refills on anything...chips or drinks.   Contrary to recent Yelps, our food arrived SUPER fast...on a Friday night...when the waitress had to traverse multiple dining rooms to serve us.  Now, being at a resort, the food WAS a bit pricey...though, the price was easier to bear after 32 ounces of a margarita they call "El Diablo"...which is a top shelf margarita with Grand Marnier (as per my tip).  Either way, not a bad restaurant...plus, it's within walking distance of the resort, which comes in handy after about half of that El Diablo.

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chilada's - Tempe, AZ, United States. $40.00 margarita! Good thing we walked!

s8R2P3jMU28w-lU8YBjiYg.text: See my tip;) family friendly, good service, American Mexican food. Large portions. Enjoyed the tacos and sangria Rita. No problems.

JWVG28hsB1z0CroCZwu4ew.text: We were seated promptly, but found service to be slow, all around, receiving drinks, ordering dinner, and eventually receiving our meals. Time from arrival to food was 45 minutes. Chips were good, and chunky salsa had an enjoyable flavor. I ordered steak fajitas, and found that they were tender, but had a very off taste, similar to a dirty grill possibly. Off taste was more noticeable as meal went on resulting in eating less than one third of the entree before deciding I was better off avoiding it. Bill was dropped on table shortly after, no discussion of food quality, offer of drink refills, or other standard practices. This location is not related to another restaurant bearing the same name in Phoenix. Slow service and off tasting food resulted in the low rating.

EHVLuQwubOiArR9MmMAHAg.text: The one thing I can say is that the service was fast! I ordered takeout but the location is the worst I can think of. It's right on the southwest side of baseline and the I-10 but it's facing north so if you're traveling west when you leave this place you'll be waiting a good 5-10 minutes before you can turn left!

cxMdJ5fYgBgKuXC82NxkuA.text: Probably the worst Mexican food of all time.  They do have good Cadillac margaritas but that the only reason I would give them a star.  The food was absolutely horrible.  I do not even want to go into detail about why it was so bad.

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chilada's - Tempe, AZ, United States. Fish tacos

B6bk54FL-MTKYm1pEnrIeA.text: Much better than expected based on the reviews.  I would  go back to the restaurant and I recommend it based on our experience. We were a group of 10 and everyone liked the food.....the street tacos I had were really delicious and the portions were generous. Guacamole, chips and salsa were fine.  We are from California so know Mexican food pretty well and this food was very good ..... not the best ever but still very good.  We ordered the guacamole in addition to the free chips and salsa.   The patio at night was so pleasant and the service we had was excellent. I would give it 3.5 stars if I could rather than just 3.   I do not give 4 or 5 stars very easily!

HeNGjOlG4geAHvibNjFG6Q.text: It was an average at best.  Very over priced for lunch, margaritas are $11.50.  Lunch for 3 with tip was over $100.  The food was ok, the beef was kinda strange not worth $100. Restaurant is cute and comfy however Macayos would have been half the price and the food is the same quality.  My opinion this is a one time stop restaurant.  The waiter was friendly and nice but me messed up our order twice.

z72LN_DOaCHtf248WjNmyA.text: Queso dip and chips awesome, salsas very good, service was very good. Entrees were good (chile verde burrito and pollo fundido) but not great. Beers were plenty cold. Would go back without hesitation. Nice casual atmosphere.

E8vlYnedIn_DKjjha7fJMw.text: I do not understand the very low reviews that have been posted. Pleasantly spiced food, very good service and a nice atmosphere. It did have a definite resort feel to it, and there is a resort next door. This is probably the reason some of the prices are up where they are.  Okay, the bathrooms were small for this size of a restaurant. Tiny, in fact. The men's room had a tight stall and a small urinal. The ladies' room was of a similar size, I'm told.  Tables - no booths.  So far, some of the better Mexican food we've found in Phoenix.  No lunch menu or specials offered, or we'd give it another star.

JmO4LzXgKSfcvoY6CgEBOQ.text: Good food good service. Good atmosphere. Will definitely come back :) I'm curious to try their drink menu

jlhfRXUhClZnvwKrM6JMow.text: Our group of four was in Tempe for a conference, and as we were driving down Baseline I saw the name "Aunt Chilada's" and started laughing. So, obviously, we had to check it out the next night for dinner. Two members of the group are avid yelpers so we checked the ratings before going and almost skipped it -- SO glad that we didn't skip it. Recent reviews are more positive so perhaps ownership or management has changed, because this place was pretty nice.   We came for happy hour and were seated at a table. We cleared up that in order to get "happy hour" food you have to sit at the bar--not sure why this is the policy. It seems like every other place I've gone for happy hour isn't concerned where you sit to sample the fare, but this place had some sort of policy according to the server. Luckily, they will let you order the happy hour margaritas at a table. (I really think they need to re-evaluate this policy, as they missed out on us ordering appetizers off the happy hour menu--once we learned we couldn't get happy hour food at the table, we all skipped the appetizers altogether and they lost out on some money there, since we were starving.)   Chips and salsa at the table was good. I thought the salsa was okay, perhaps average, but others at the table seemed to really like it. I did order some guacamole to go with the chips and the guac was pretty good. Glad that I ordered it.   For dinner the table tried different places. One plate was a combination plate that had tacos. She said that the beans were "ok" but really enjoyed the rest. Another member of the group tried out a different plate and liked it. Overall, everyone else seemed to like their plates.   I got a street tacos plate and tried out three different kinds of meat: chicken tinga, mahi mahi, and pork. First and foremost, the presentation of the tacos was very nice. I liked the cabbage and other toppings on the tacos. I did, however, feel like the mahi mahi didn't have its own flavor. The fish itself was somewhat bland. The pork taco had pork that was decent, although the seasoning was not my favorite. I really liked the chicken though and thought if I were to order this again, I'd just get all chicken tinga tacos. It came with a side of charro beans that were a little more watery than I'm used to (could be that the charro beans in Tucson are different). But overall it was a decent meal, decent price, big portions, and we all left happy.   Not the greatest Mexican food I've ever had, no, but in Tucson there are a lot of great Mexican food restaurants, food trucks, etc. I will say, however, that this place was better than Taco Bell (a lot of prior negative reviews said Taco Bell is better...no, not True, this place is better). I thought for the price, quality, and portion--this was a 4 star place.

ECLES2UR-UGsbV-pmc5Fuw.text: It is a very beautiful place. It was lit up with many beautiful lights and decorated with flowers. Food and service were good. I like the huge hot fudge sundae.

Vtv5eKfj1QlzU1MZKVQj7w.text: We had another awesome experience today (New Year's Day).  Our waiter was Kyle and he was awesome, especially considering how many tables he was taking care of.  I tried the #4 combination -  relleno and cheese enchilada with Charro beans and Mexican rice - simply incredible.  Also, the salsas today were fantastic!  I highly recommend this location!

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chilada's - Tempe, AZ, United States. Number 4

iXXSSTrRUwksAXipZdN63Q.text: Let's begin with the not so good parts. If you are coming for authentic Mexican food, this ain't it. The only Mexican thing about this place is the music and the design. We were first given frozen canned salsa and crushed up tortilla chips. Next the "fideo" was literally spaghetti with carrots. The molcajete was smaller than expected, no cheese or cactus, the chicken was dry, and the tortillas were cold. Our waitress was nice but didn't have much people skills.  The only good part about this restaurant was the deep fried ice cream, which was delicious and was a good portion. And the sangria and the beer.

LKSTwUyr62J-ojD1SnPj8A.text: I first tried this place for my best friend's 21st birthday party and I have been hooked ever since. What truly sold it for me was the overall ambiance. I have been to the original location as well as the Tempe one and the Tempe location takes the cake for me as far as the outdoor patio. Something about the bistro lighting overhead makes for such a great setting and compliments the meal perfectly.   Every meal I have gotten I have enjoyed from this place as well! I normally get a combo item which includes tacos, enchiladas, flautas, etc. which fills me up. The meal also comes with refried beans and rice as well. The only reason I did not give this place 5 stars is the price. Being that I am in college I find the pricing to be a tad high for the meals and drinks they provide, and judging by other reviews I am not the only one that feels this way. I am all for paying the price if I feel that the quality and quantity reflects it.   The service has always been amazing at this location as well which I certainly appreciate! I will definitely be back to this place and feel it is a great place to spend special occasions at!

NDr32gxwxmaRF-bB_WHiAg.text: HIGHLY RECOMMEND. REQUEST CHRIS' TABLE.   My family and I had a wonderful experience and delicious, hot, fresh and quickly made dinner.   HIGHLY RECOMMEND requesting Chris as your waiter. He's patient, kind and respectful and had a WONDERFUL first time dining at Aunt Chilada's. Will return as long as Chris is our waiter!

nj_9D-sYeBPiLwfzmKMsoQ.text: Chris E was an amazing server! He got us seated quickly. The food was great! Chris E made sure our entire party was happy with the entire visit. He is definitely one of their best assets!

K1pF86NZno-bs6MnUn2BIA.text: Mediocre at best, was hoping this was authentic southwest Mexican food. Green and red sauce was lackluster, and the burro was mostly stale tortilla. The upside was the service was great.

D0IzkhoRH-Q5FjktdYcO9A.text: If I could give this place no stars I would. Save your money!! Our waitress Marilyn messed up and when we nicely told her she sighed and gave attitude... they messed up every plate that was ordered and the service was horrible!!! For the price you can go somewhere way better with way nicer service.

Rskg47kBTMZrob2H8OawOQ.text: Awful service, food was average. On top of it after messing up every order our waitress had the audacity to include a 20% gratuity in our bill. Tips are earned not just given!

wGVE_hOI1h2iNP0eKqHJ0g.text: First time coming here. This place is crazy busy so expect a wait to be seated and for food to arrive. I had the shredded beef enchiladas and it was worth the wait. Food was delicious. Definitely would come back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chilada's - Tempe, AZ, United States. #7 (2) enchiladas with shredded beef

Y88GUbBBGZrb_gaVAvGnjg.text: If you are staying at the Arizona Grand or around the Arizona Mills, you might pop in here for some Mexican food or a margarita.  They have no waiting area inside and it is way too hot to stand outside, they give you water while you wait, but during the summer - they need to have a waiting room indoors or seat people faster.  The decor is meh, the food was so/so, the server was okay too..  I don't think i would ever come back here, but it wasnt' horrible either.

kAN73u6lpNn98_o-DYFLGQ.text: In town for work, staying at the Arizona Grand and decided to try this spot for a quick lunch. I am a HUGE fan of Mexican food (in another life I'm convinced I am of Mexican decent) Being a lover of Mexican food, I am always on the lookout for restaurants. This one is pretty darn good! The food, the service, the atmosphere... everything was great!   Considering some of the other reviews that were not as complementary, I was pleasantly surprised!

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chilada's - Tempe, AZ, United States. Salsa is fantastic! Mild with big chunks of onion, tomatoes, and cilantro!

jS6YsO30yzn_iAIEVVmiwA.text: Very cool patio and the bar is OK. Service and food? No so much.  The margaritas are just ok, a bit watered down. And the food is just abundant.  I would go back for a happy hour outside in the fall, but wouldn't eat there again.

8fs1NGXNLcTroMR-aZe0tQ.text: We went on a Tuesday night in June so there was no wait. The chips and salsa are addictive. I had the fish tacos. My husband has the chili relleno. One son had the shrimp and enchilada plater and the other had the seis.  We all went home satisfied and reaving about the taste of the food. But seriously...the chips and salsa was the star of the night.

_0WQ_00Wj3mNKM8rFDEwoA.text: The fideos; oh the fideos! I drive miles for it. Unique to the Chilada. Mexican tomato pasta; make sure to get it as a side!

jYOouxmcHoW6jBMJPxW2DA.text: The worst mexican food i've ever had if i could give it zero stars i would it was pure ass.

GfH0yNFAy-9mCr7fk3SH6Q.text: The menu is simple but has a variety of items to choose from. At $16.95 We had the 3 street tacos plate that includes your choice of black, refried or mexican rice. Flour or corn tortillas. Corn tortillas come doubled up. All meats marinated to perfection. We could only eat two tacos each. I give the prices a $$ out of $$$$. Great food and service, best refried beans in the valley. Highly recommend you try.

mxXko2VJD5eYAyAa80k2kA.text: Aunt Chilada's does it again!!! Experience after experience of incredible food, and amazing service! Katie our server, was one of the most attentive and welcoming servers we've ever had. This has officially become our go to for our neighborhood Authentic Mexican food! So amazing!!!

oCJMhVA53C4QGc-cXy6Bqw.text: A must go location for visitors.  Squaw Peak location is very memorable.  The food is good.  When I worked nearby, I ate there frequently!  Recently took my Father for his birthday and the memorabilia is neat (Squaw Peak).  The Tempe location is easy to get to and has the same great food.  Fundido is fun ;)

CmY1n5LAZCOQ9keDtrzhRA.text: This experience was terrible. Every single employee was rude from the moment we walked in. We waited forever for a table to get ready in an empty restaurant with plenty of tables already ready. We waited forever at our table before a server finally came over. We gave her all of our orders with drinks and we waited 25 minutes before we got our drinks. Chips salsa and apps came out before our drinks. The only reason this was 3 stars was because of the food. And then we realized why the service sucked when we got out bill, they apply auto gratuity at 20%! Won't be back and won't recommend. Not to be treated like that

_-V3mp2Y6omhgjA1MjQZGQ.text: I had the green chile burrito and I kid you not, it looked like dog food. Came close to tasting like it as well. Not authentic Mexican food at all, if you want Americanized Mexican food then maybe but I would not recommend.

CuKLh_8mCXvdsS_bAgbkhQ.text: What a mess!  Showed up here on a Thursday night starving to see a line practically out the door. As we were waiting to get a table people a few ahead of us were told that they were closing. We looked at our watches and it was about 10 until 9 and they said they closed at 9. You might want to close when you say and not earlier because it almost caused a riot.   We decided to sit at the bar instead of waiting for the bottom to fall out of the mess at the front. Sat down and the bartender was pretty quick and really personable. He was the best part about this whole place.   First let me say that this place is terrible. I went to their website and it was voted 'Best of' for several things that were totally NOT best of anything. Worst of, yes. Best of, stop using that phrase with this restaurant. Does not go.  First up was chips and salsa. The salsa really was actually right on. It was fresh and had a nice kick to it, but the chips? They must of run out of their 'best of' chips because these tasted like stale Tostitos. Oh man, stale Tostitos would have been an improvement, actually.   We then ordered the spicy queso bean dip and instantly regretted it. It was so bland and so un-queso-y that we pushed it away and waited for our entrees.   I ordered vegetable fajitas which you THINK you couldn't mess up. Oh, guess what? Yeah. My friend ordered some shrimp dish that I refused to try so I'm not sure if it was good or not.   I wouldn't eat here again unless the world was wiped out by an atomic bomb and only because the food here would survive.

gfKrancUVbgsgMUQOsrB6g.text: Service is a little on the slow end, but the servers are great! So if your in a rush, this is not the place for you. Otherwise, seriously the food and atmosphere is amazing!

8HFJ8tBAutLhfcxZ_GYzoQ.text: It's been a long time since I've eaten at Aunt Chilada's. I get out to the east side very infrequently, but we were in the area and decided to stop in for lunch. I liked the pond with the ducks out front. When we first walked in, I was hit with the smell of toilet water, like the floors had been mopped with dirty water. Not very appetizing. Fortunately the hostess walked us out across the patio to a different building. It smelled more like food over there so that was a good sign. After we were seated, we waited for quite some time before anyone came to greet us, take our drink order, or bring chips & salsa. We were actually contemplating leaving right before our server walked by and said she'd be right with us. When she came to get our drink order, we also ordered our food since we'd had plenty of time to decide. I went with the chicken enchilada, black beans, and rice. The bowl of chips and bowl of salsa were huge. That was different. The first couple of chips I had were underwhelming because they were cold, but then I got to some warm chips that tasted much fresher. It's a very noticeable difference. The food came out rather quickly, which was surprising considering how long it took to be acknowledged in the beginning. I enjoyed the rice & black beans. The chicken in my enchilada reminded me of canned chicken. It really didn't have a lot of flavor. The enchilada relied on the red sauce for taste and I wasn't very impressed. Also our last water refills tasted odd, like it shared a spout with some variety of lemonade that got mixed in with the water. Not good. But I'm glad I had a chance to remind myself what Aunt Chilada's food is like. I see no need to drive out to the east valley to eat here again.

sUzMgJk7VKbmdzQ-iG_Qhg.text: EVERY visit here has been phenomenal. The food is always fresh and tastes great. Adult beverages are worth ordering two. A couple of the servers could benefit from some additional training, but other than that I highly recommend this place. Btw EVERYONE I've recommended this place to Love's it just as much as I do. And having eaten at various Mexican restaurants across the US this one is in my top 5.

mbhjhH0HDla0UnRamjRpgQ.text: Ordered the chicken fajitas to go and the staff was amazing. The chicken pieces were big and very tender, juicy and well seasoned along with the onions and peppers. Meal came with a huge bag of chips and a hearty serving of salsa. Definitely a must go to. Authentic Mexican food, amazing atmosphere and a very welcoming staff.

wsXnQltQOHQF1MhZiAzRWw.text: This place is amazing. Coming from Texas & eating tons of Mexican food.. this place beats all of it!

qudLeKchybsvEOVVgSOaDA.text: Yuck. Other than the great patio, everything else is awful. Food was awful, management was even more terrible. No thanks.

hjbS1Fhr9RWFetIPKzGRDw.text: I ate here as part of a work function.  They have amazing chips and salsa.  That was probably the best part of my meal.  I love Mexican food and could eat it literally every day - but I found this to be a very very Americanized version of Mexican food.  It was "Eh" - not bad, not great...just "Eh". The best part of the meal were the chips, they were delicious and the salsa was amazing.  I like spicy food and the salsa delivered - but everything else was so mild and just forgetable. There were a lot of us in the group and our food kept coming out in waves.  The first batch of people served started eating and were more than half way done their meal by the time the third wave was served.  I believe our large group plus the large number of diners that were already there very likely overwhelmed the kitchen staff.  We had a reservation, perhaps they could have scheduled a few more people.  The server herself was good, she was on the spot with drinks, refills and more chips.  I don't know how much the bill was because the check was picked up by my boss, but if I were paying for dinner, I don't know that I would come back here if other options were available.

SkMv4fVFWKIT_-TlD_mMxQ.text: Delicious lunch shared here with my mom who is visiting  from. Canada. She said it was the best!

eZ9XvKbM88OUgSvXV8zHHA.text: What a disaster of a restaurant this place is. With sho so many great examples of good American American-style Mexican food in the surrounding environment of Phoenix Arizona, there's just no excuse. I had actually hoped that it might be authentic Mexican, but it couldn't be farther from that. I think the sole reason that this place exists is because of the nearby hotel. It would definitely fail in an environment where It did not have a captive audience. I guess the big bar seem to be an attraction also because there were a whole lot of drunk idiots wandering around. The chips were disgusting. The salsa was boring and flavorless. The enchiladas were loaded with so much poor quality cheese that I may as well have been eating a candle. What a regrettable experience overall. Go anywhere else if you have the chance.

O4dKFBVo-n-HwsE93NN2gw.text: Over priced, awful margaritas and hands down the worst chips & salsa in Phoenix. I have to wonder about the people who rated this 3 stars and up. Where are you from and what garbage do you eat at home to think this is passable as Mexican food.

V_cNtjEmshXOggWEE7iTPg.text: As a local Chef that has been in the industry for 14 years, I despise "elite" critics, but this butt-town experience will be an exception. Food was mediocre at best, but my beef is not with the kitchen. FOH! Listen up, if you screw up on a tab and have to void anything, be HONEST and advise the guest they may see this transaction on their account and YOU apologize for simple mistake and everyone goes on with their life. What you don't do, is mess up and have 2 incorrect amounts ran on the guest's card and they have 2 call you the next day to figure out why they've been egregiously overcharged. Furthermore, you do not only disclose the mistake once the guest gets upset than tell her you assume it will fall off the next day. It did not. Day 2, I get the pleasure of talking to a twit named Lindsey who offers the credit department's number so I can figure it out. I disagreed. In the end, I'm still waiting for the right amount to be debited and reimbursed for THEIR mistake. Don't eat here. Hospitality is not in their vocabulary. If you experienced 1/8th of this shenanigan at my restaurant.... oh wait, you wouldn't. So dumb.

xDNauiJmj64nMoxtUPwbWg.text: Finally made it in to try it. Now i know what all the rave is about.Fresh ingredients and wonderful atmosphere. Customers are treated like old friends.

Hy4j2eARi38qbAk0pwdTkg.text: First tried Aunt Chilada's years ago . . . I've been to both locations and think this one is the lesser of the two.  Both locations have great atmosphere and are inviting although this one, less so as well.  I called ahead for reservations just in case and was told they don't take them.  Luckily, it was not very crowded when I showed up so reservations were not needed.  The restaurant however filled up within a half an hour so I'm glad I didn't have to wait for a table.  My dinner guest and I chose to sit in the outside patio area which is very colorful and spacious.  Service was pretty good.  We were greeted relatively quickly although there was a delay in taking our order.  I ordered what I typically order at a Mexican joint in order to compare it to similar dishes elsewhere . . . chille relleno and a tamale.  Sorry to say AC's relleno is average at best . . . it didn't jump my taste buds seeming rather bland and lifeless despite a mildly spicy green sauce.  The tamale was dry and had an unusual taste that was not particularly pleasant or familiar.  The upside was the service.  My dinner guest was an intellectually disabled woman I mentor for Special Olympics . . . she is somewhat child like and believed that her relleno which she also ordered, was "too spicy."  Our waiter graciously replaced it with a milder selection and did NOT charge us for the first dish.  With all the fabulous Mexican eateries in Arizona, I wouldn't waste my time or money with AC.  There is nothing special about it although the other location may have some historical significance.

b2ZWBRqBW3LqkCFkP1TSIQ.text: 5 star service for our server, Summer. The food was amazing albeit a little expensive for what you actually get. Disappointing, yet understandable because they are part of a resort. But everything went well and she was very patient with me. I was #BeyondObsessed with both the house guacamole and the regular guacamole, as I said the food was AMAZE! so I left her a $5 tip (I was dining alone) I can't wait to bring a friend with me the next time I'm near Arizona Grand Resort

1xN8RkdTjmHap1vKwJiPAg.text: This restaurant was busy and I am so glad we decided to wait for a table! The food was amazing. The wait staff was attentive, friendly, and funny. The drinks were good. We even had ducks out on the patio with us! Will definitely return when I visit Phoenix again!

Vz9G-7OXxJWJgzXldUKsLw.text: Great Food and our server was outstanding! Brittany M. was awsome handled our party of 16 with ease. Not one of us was ever empty handed. We will be back!  Mike G.

ixniFWOziglIXDEy7mmcbg.text: I've eaten at both locations a handful of times. I feel like the last few times at the Baseline location haven't been what it used to be.  I had the street tacos and they were no bueno. I have never had carne asada like this. It was like greasy ground beef. The corn tortillas were drenched in grease, I just picked out the middle. The carnitas were dry and just a ginormous chunk of it in the taco. The beans were good and the salsa was great.

ytjjcOQVt-yyHXN8deih7w.text: First and last time here.  I love Mexican food but this place is a no go for me. Came here with my gf as she mentioned this was one of her fav Mexican places to eat, we sit down and right away I knew this place is not going to be a good experience. We almost walked out but since she's been here before I said I want to try it before I judge a place. Wish we would or just left.   This place doesn't have a welcoming feeling, staff was ok but something seemed odd.  Let's rate the food..  Their chips and salsa I would rate a 1 Chips were cold and hard seemed like they were sitting there all day and gave us left overs. After reading other reviews I saw that this is a continuous issue with this place.  We ordered their fajita .. For what you pay it's def not all that, I mean you can never go wrong with a shrimp fajitas however this wasn't anything special and we will not be coming back here.  Everything was over priced and food was disappointing wish they would make some changes as this place has good potential and the decorations are pretty neat.

rF2tsy9tmxgTmKfIDIrxAA.text: Walking Dead Hostess and Waitresses. No Personality. Lot's of color seats were comfy BUT you can't scoot your seat. Chips where good but Salsa NO Flavor should of called it Chips and canned tomatoes.  Food came out real fast, which means in my mind is it's not fresh it's microwaved.  I was right... Food was steamy but they over warmed up the rice it was all hard.. Beans canned!  I don't mind canned beans. When I'm at home.. My Dish looked lovely but it so wasn't.. I only took a few bites. A good waitress would of took notice of that..   It's good for groups though

G--bhlvtyzLCarpMGlDgTQ.text: I went there to celebrate my dad's birthday. It was a last minute selection, which didn't work to our benefit because we had to wait an hour to get a table. Next time, I recommend calling in advance to reserve a table. Once we were seated, we were uncomfortable by how cold our area was. Apparently, the fan above us was linked to the main wiring so that shutting down the fan meant shutting down the area in the back? Whatever the case, they couldn't turn off the fan. We froze while we eat...very uncomfortable.  The positive was the fish tacos were delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chilada's - Tempe, AZ, United States. Fish Tacos

ZO6LjXvgtc-4H1NW6BRMuA.text: Arrived at Aunt Chilada's hangry with a couple of hangry colleagues/friends. Sadly, there was a long-ish wait but there were many tables open inside and outside. Based on our observations, there just weren't that many servers...causing a longer wait.  But the wait was worth it. We ate our faces off.   Starting with a pile high of chips (that kept getting refilled), salsas and guacamole, we almost filled up on that. But...we kept going. (The spicier, darker salsa is outstanding).  I spied street corn and buzz sawed through that so happily that I was humming and dancing in my seat.  We ordered a mix of different fajitas and other items...and we thoroughly enjoyed it all. I realized that after I ordered the fajitas that they had street tacos....so I would go back to just try those out. Authentic flavors, textures and fresh ingredients.  Our server was awesome.

vzBZZSFU5amQH6pffZmNGQ.text: I came in with a group of 8 people and ordered the chicken chimichanga. Everyone else got their meals, then I waited, and waited without explanation. Finally I called over the server and she said they'd made a carne asada one instead but that it would be right out. I said I would rather have that one with my friends' meals than wait for them to correct it. She insisted that it was already done and would only be a minute. It was at least another 5, which in terms of sitting at a table waiting while everyone else eating is forever.  They wisely added the gratuity to the bill because I wouldn't have given them a dime otherwise. It was just ok once I got it.

rFW7i4pFpJ9xDZhs1UAiDA.text: BEST MEXICAN FOOD IVE EVER HAD.  The chips were served fresh and warm, not too salty. We ordered the bowl of guacamole to start, it was super flavorful! Every time I go to a Mexican restaurant I order a chicken quesadilla and let me just say this was by far my favorite. There was so much flavor and juiciness. My parents and I came back the next day and all ordered the quesadilla again SO GOOD. Can't wait to come back!!

ADSeFbwACPdJFHRRUgOZSg.text: A friend of mine brought me to Aunt Chilada's for the first time and it was good. They're mild salsa and chips are probably one of the best I've ever had and they just keep bringing out to you. The food itself was ok but it was not authentic Mexican food which is okay too. The staff was really great and friendly and the establishment was clean and fun. Would definitely return if I didn't live in another state.

qZar_7lEZHl5KcYoTIQWvQ.text: My family ate here 2 days in a row while we were staying at the nearby Arizona Grand Resort. We loved that the resort would drive us there on the golf cart, and we could walk back after we had eaten way too much delicious food. They also let you charge to your room which is nice, because one day we went for lunch after being at the water park all day and did not have credit cards on us.  The salsa is awesome. The frozen margaritas are AWESOME. The cheese crisp is super tasty. The nachos are HUGE- do not underestimate them! The guacamole is great too.  I would definitely recommend giving this place a try.

Y7vLiX-jOwwLI5bDqtIqGw.text: This place was pretty good! I got the pollo fundido and had hoped it would be in a burrito type of presentation, but they give you tortillas and the insides separately. That was disappointing. I'm used to the pollo fundido at Valle Luna, where I have to put in less effort and just have to shovel food into my mouth. When you're hungry that's all you should be doing anyway! Regardless, the food was good and I wasn't disappointed in the end.  The interior is decently decorated and the customer service was not memorable, but not terrible.

p1hLkwG9DBab4WsAs7lUiQ.text: Good food. The mild salsa is CHUNKY heaven. The chips are nothing special...just a crispy delivery system for great mild salsa!  My Husband usually orders Huevos Rancheros but they don't serve egg dishes here, so he ordered the Sonoran House Salad ($10). It looks like a large enough salad to fill me up but he says he's still hungry!  He did NOT add chicken to it. Perhaps with added protein it would be more filling. It comes  with a sweet/tart dressing that is EXCELLENT.   I ordered a Chile Rellano  a la carte ($5) with extra shredded lettuce. This was a delicious Rellano. Traditionally roasted pepper stuffed with cheese, dipped in a light batter and fried. It is served with a delicious green sauce.   I noticed all the neighboring tables were full of combination plates that all looked delicious. All the food here looks good. The combo plates are ranging around $14. So this is not a budget restaurant but it's reasonably priced.   We couldn't resist the fried ice cream ($8) so that bumped our very reasonably priced lunch up a bit! However it's a very large scoop of ice cream. And after it's rolled in corn flakes she swears it's really dipped in the fryer!  It looked it...but not long! It is smothered in whipped cream topped with both chocolate and caramel sauces. It EASILY FEEDS 2 DESSERT LOVERS. She said 4 can share. I suppose so. It's very satisfying with the thin crunchY shell it is served on!  It's much larger than the picture ONLINE. Im officially stuffed and my husband is now FULL!   The atmosphere is lovely. The prices actually seem VERY reasonable for this level of charming ambiance!  It's January and people are enjoying the outdoor dining patio!  The service wasn't overly attentive however we didn't need anything special and we weren't in any hurry, so it was fine. We did arrive at prime lunchtime. If you're in a big hurry I recommend you tell the hostess seating you and also your server when you first arrive!    If you find this review useful, please vote!

g3IbUxG4K-FqoL3wgTgXzA.text: My hubby was in Arizona for a few days for work and he happened to eat here and said it was pretty good food. He ordered the enchiladas with some brown sauce. He loved the outdoor space.

zmrjGW6qqdoA-mmIlju1Kw.text: Amazing I had the jalapeno cream chicken it was delicious! One of the best I have had! My family is half Mexican and this is very authentic Mexican food! Which is so nice it's not your Tex mex food!! I would highly recommend this place! The mecheldas are very authentic and delicious just like the ones in the heart of Mexico City! The rice was delicious wow was fantastic it's hard to find good home rice and the refried beans were perfect! If this establishment was in Los Angeles or Hollywood it would do so well!!  Can't wait to visit Arizona again to eat this delicious food! Highly recommend the jalapeno cream chicken! It will rock your world!

9LYHSRxF9OdAQqpeOw5eJg.text: The service is amazing and the food is awesome too! Especially our waiter Chris!  He got us seated and seriously gave us amazing service! We will definitely be visiting again.

8zqTyTOxld7y8skK9wsQ_g.text: This was our 1st & last time coming to this location. All of our food came out warm,  including my salad which didn't seem like it was chilled at all. The only soup served was a tortilla soup which was also just warm. None of the food seem to have any flavor or seasonings...Taco Bell seasons their good more! One of the dishes we sent back was still on our tab along with one that were never received. The dining area was a little  pod away from the main entrance with no restrooms. The floors were covered in tortilla chips... nobody was cleaning up between diners. The waiting area for seating offered chips & salsa, but there were no tongs for the chips & people were using their bare hands to serve themselves chips... Needless to say,  this was a very disappointing & unpleasant dining experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chilada's - Tempe, AZ, United States. Chips not being cleaned off floor between diners

D_jXD93KZoNPnzqLfxVlHg.text: Wow, wow, wow... so disappointing.  You look at the Yelp pictures and see citrus trees, fountains, and a bright colorful patio, fun awaits right?!  Then once you walk over the bridge you are greeted by a hostess with no words.  I guess that means you were not greeted.  But don't worry her handbag and cell were placed back into her shelf under the host stand and a few rolls of silverware were thrown together in the meantime.  Normally I would have walked at this point but their molchajete looked promising.  That friendly gal seated us at a table next to the kitchen door.  Makes sense right, only five to seven tables taken in a three room restaurant.  The table was so wobbly I thought my drink my take off to some other table.  But wait, ten minutes in and we never received waters.  Under my breath I say to my family 3-2-1 and they know what that means.  I am not tolerating another minute of this.  Oh and two cheese enchiladas was the special for $12.50, burritos are $15 and kids meals are $7.95.  The molchajete was $29.99. House margaritas $10.

18QIaLMQBAmDPtQkr1SRTw.text: The service was good and the food was alright. Didn't really wow me as I'm an avid Mexican food eater.

Photo of Aunt Chilada's - Tempe, AZ, United States. Cheese enchiladas

68Z5pRjKSZytNl70GU8rOg.text: Sadly this PHX icon of Mexican fare, established in '86, has slowly gone down hill across the last 10 years. Darcie and I used consider an Aunt Chilada's outing a special treat.  The short story: If you are staying at the fabulous AZ Grand Resort and Spa... WITHOUT A RENTAL CAR, walk over and have lunch or dinner. Based on the reviews, cost vs quality will be a roll of the dice. If you're not staying at the Grand Resort or you DO have a rental, there are far too many superior options within 15 minutes. Go find one.  The longer story:  Aunt Chilada's now ranks among the sad cavalcade of Mexican joints that seem top notch by appearance, but phone it in on the execution. By that, I mean, the decor gives the impression of authenticity, the service is fine, but then your food arrives; and proud Aunt Chilada's history aside... food quality here has slipped into the unacceptable zone.   It started with the bland chips and salsa (queue the Jaws music). Both the standard and the "hot" varieties were muted in taste. Then came my Numero Uno combination plate. I had ordered a shredded beef taco, and Bean Tostada, and for an extra 2 bucks or so, I ditched the standard Cheese Enchilada and upgraded to a Red Chile Beef Tamale. The taco was watery (huh?). The tamale was bone dry, desiccated... As I dumped salsa on it to make it more appealing, I marveled at the spectacle of its moisture absorption capacity. They should make smaller versions for pharmaceutical applications and larger versions to blow across the screen in post-apocalyptic Westerns... yup that was a Tumble Tamale joke... apologies. The tostada was the stand out. Let me repeat that, among a shredded beef taco, a red chile beef tamale, and a bean tostada... the tostada was the best.  Reviews of former favs in decline make me a bit sad. Just to totally frame things up, this review is not a capricious curmudgeonly slashing. In fact I was predisposed to having a great time at Aunt Chilada's. I was listening to my daughter talking about a post-grad athletic scholarship offer she recently received. An opportunity cut a big chunk out of the master's tuition?... dad was aglow, otherwise this review may have been a 1 Star.   Aunt Chilada's I'll try again in a year or so. I hope 2019 sees you right the course and return to your former consistent greatness.

tvlxt5Xn7nu65lwknTnuNw.text: Service was good! She wasn't super engaging, but I don't need engaging...just take care of me, and that she did!!! I was thinking three stars as I left but that was until I ate my left overs!!! I think I filled up on chips and salsa/hot sauce (and I burnt my taste buds by mixing too much hot sauce with the salsa) and I didn't fully appreciate the taste and quality of my food!!!!  I ordered a shredded beef taco and enchilada combo. I was offered my choice of TWO interesting sides. I picked the "charro" beans (I think...they are the pinto beans with, in this case, LOTS of extras and AMAZING FLAVOR!!!). I highly recommend these bad boys!!! I picked the Spanish rice as my other side and I did NOT regret that choice. The taco was better or similar to my favorite other spots. NO complaints about the deep fried shredded beef taco!   By the time I got around to eating my enchilada, my taste buds were burnt from my request for HOT sauce to mix with the tasty salsa, and I didn't taste the AMAZING flavor of their red enchilada sauce at the time!! WOW, when I heated my leftovers up, the flavors POPPED!   The charro beans.....WOW!!! There is depth to the flavors that I cannot fully explain, but I can say there is a smoky flavor and a bacon flavor that makes my tongue SUPER happy!! These are the BEST charro beans I have tasted!!!  What I DON'T LIKE:  They do not have ANY booths. My dining experience is WAY better when I sit at a comfy booth!! They do have some awkward seating, such as the room to the left when you first enter the building. Too open to dozens or hundreds of people who are checking in to dine. I think they should close the area off a bit. Fortunately we were not seated in that room. HOWEVER, the area that we were seated had tables a bit too close for MY comfort. A family of four sat nearby and they were SO LOUD that it was uncomfortable!!! Fortunately, I have a SUPER effective "stink eye" that let them know that they were out of line and they decided to use their inside voices. GEEZ PEOPLE, be CONSIDERATE of other diners nearby, especially if you are sitting super close to others trying to enjoy THEIR company and THEIR food!!! YOU are not so special that others sitting nearby want to hear YOU. WTH is wrong with people these days????   Bottom line is, I look FORWARD to going back!!

HuXDROpmr0Q7-nlSWS1z7w.text: I ordered a one item combo, chicken burro, with rice and fideo. Chicken in the burro is canned for sure..I couldn't eat it, so asked for a cheese enchilada instead. The corn tortilla was hard af, the enchilada sauce was disgusting! If you know how to make Mexican food... This place is not for you.

iPqkmij5zacbOld8JcBO6Q.text: I had been here years ago I double checked online to see if the menu had changed and it seemed the same... well once I got there there was at least six items that were no longer... that's fine.. I will get something else...chips were 2 day old at least so so stale... the food was just as bad. Will never come back it was really really bad.

FJIjdsiOkdONwc6mZpt2GQ.text: The spicy salsa that you get when you sit down is great.  The queso dip - not spot much, it was cold and firm.  The table side guacamole was also good, the enchilada with jalepeno sauce on top - not that good.  The margarita was pretty good.  The service was spot on and we gave a good tip.  I am sure this place could be better but it did serve the purpose of not having to leave the resort property to have that "dining out" experience.
