Tcu9sWIzz4rw0LZSU48erw.text: Loved this place!  We stumbled upon it after arriving from out of town.  The waiter we had was wonderful, the food was awesome and the atmosphere was also pleasant.  Too bad they're associated with the Arizona Grand.

wjaWgL3Gbbg79SrffDKucw.text: My wife and I returned to Aunt Chilada's during our 1-year anniversary stay at Arizona Grand Resort.  We held our rehearsal dinner and 150 person meet and greet at Aunt Chilada's in 2015.  We came in and were greeted by Sam (manager) who was instrumental in executing our big wedding event.  We had a great chat with Sam, and she showed us some excellent hospitality.  We enjoyed fajitas and margaritas at the bar.  Jeff (bartender) took excellent care of us.    We have only had positive experiences at Aunt Chilada's.  To top it off, Sam has done an excellent job expanding the tequila list.  Try the Casa Noble and Espolon Anejo Bourbon Cask!

MJ8SKDdYktl9GLxL43atvw.text: Can't beat their happy hour! $4 enchiladas, burritos, tacos. $3 wine, beer, well drinks. Very good service very nice environment.

2ZV_2siPs4uFl3wL6Zbw1Q.text: Food was good!  We did an early dinner while at the Arizona Grand to avoid crowds and get back to more swimming.  Hostess was super nice and food was very filling.  Would definitely eat here again

zRznWcSrGknornQjLxT0JA.text: Horrible, horrible, horrible!  Not related (for a very long time, apparently, to the other one with the same name in north Phoenix). Oops. Wish I'd found that out before agreeing to be seated.  Friendly, enough, staff.   Strange layout. We were seated in what looked to have formerly been an outdoor area. It's a separate building. Once seated, we were forgotten for close to 20 minutes.  Finally chips, salsa and waters arrived. Decent salsa.  The beef was not referred to as "steak" for any of their selections. Might have been a subtle tip that the meat quality is off. And, that's polite. Was it even beef? Not sure. Where was it cut from? The serving staff didn't know when asked and didn't seem inclined to go find out.  It was so bad that more than 3/4ths of the meals were left uneaten. No "to go" boxes. No thank you. Eew. Take it away! And, no interest in going for a dessert. Every good meal deserves a dessert to cap it off, right?  North Phoenix, here I come.

awfxP87p5nblPRh96DDOKA.text: I came in with my fiance last week for lunch. He is not a fan of Mexican food but the ambiance was great. Our server Jenny went above and beyond and suggested the Pollo Fundido. He loved it! She was very attentive. We will definitely be back.

e7fGQ-c9sr2TeXpcQ9WM1g.text: Why so many bad reviews? This place was yummy! My guy and I just had lunch there (Him- steak & shrimp fajitas Me-Burro Verde) everything was good, both food & service. Glad we ignored some bad reviews & tried it :)

eGTBPPRJVZZHKd53xNev3g.text: had a triple b-day dinner today and couldn't have been more pleased with both the service and the food. Nice patio. We've been coming here since they opened and still are. Good job

n10dn0_dyrGBmxGXi4sG6g.text: Great food and great service.  I enjoyed the enchiladas and the fideo. This place is awesome !!

xFalbaRR2zpruZHmh-NPXg.text: Service= 5 stars (Lupe, thank you)!  Patio seating= 5 stars (AZ weather, thank you)! Food = 3 stars, it was good but not great.  Table side guacamole was fresh but lacked "flavor" a bit more lime juice and a lot more cilantro would have made it lovely (who doesn't just love fresh avocado)?!  I had the beef taco and enchilada, my boyfriend ate most of it since he ordered the street tacos and was underwhelmed.  I do not like rice and beans so I cannot comment.  El Diablo margarita and Modelo Especial enjoyed :)

0lqWoSQqvuFCvCR499razg.text: 5 stars for Jeff the bartender!  Best margarita in town!!  He felt with our crowd like a pro!

VBcMWv9RJdMR0guM0y482w.text: Food is fantastic delicious fresh and authentic Marcia is a great server she help us choose our dishes. I had the aunt chilada what a dish flavor are right on target just enough spice beef melting in your mouth and the tacos super delicious with fresh crispy cabbage and sweet and tangy  this was a perfect combination and I do not even talk about the fried burrito if you stay in Phoenix you have to try!!!!! We will be back

wEcY1EGk5Xf8K95uG6MV0w.text: I adore this Mexican food place.  The food is enjoyable, and always consistent.  The Pollo Fondito is my favorite. Just the right amount of spice and LOTS AND LOTS of cheese.  The wait staff is kind, and friendly.   The drinks are amazing. I love all of their margaritas. (those that I have tried anyways LOL)   But my favorite part about this location is the building. Everything is so colorful and campy, and just beautiful. My husband thinks it's tacky, but I just adore it.   I had a friend who was married here years ago, and it's just a beautiful location.

zRnWkgFdn2qBAZ-JGFEpEQ.text: The food was delicious and the price was right, but a bit on the higher end. Went for a work luncheon and was quite satisfied with my burrito. During the spring time the outdoor seating is wonderful (but only under the treasurer because it's cooler).

08ZHRlP6LwT2IPP3vA1djw.text: I love Mexican food but this is one of my favorite places to eat period!! A few weeks back my husband bought me home  carry out order... And I was so pleased to see the portions were bigger with my carry out!!

Nd851lNUbQlOIAjE2Hgo0Q.text: The best Mexican food!! The shredded beef enchilada was fantastic!!  If only there was one in Texas.

f6__Wy1GYX1TbpAt3JT3rQ.text: Ordered the tortilla soup and it was very good.  Hubby went with caso appetizer and added chorizo. Very good also. Ordered chimichangas and enjoyed those too. Overall a good value for the experience

19lBJA2WzWFq0srXmZLUMA.text: I live in the neighborhood, so Aunt Chilada's is always a convenient option for Mexican. The hardest part is getting past the name, which sounds about as authentic as Taco Bell.  My wife and I stopped in on a Monday night, and the place was packed with people from far-off places like Buffalo, New York. I can't imagine these gringos know much about the great Mexican food here in Phoenix, so Aunt Chilada's is a passable ambassador, especially for the spice-averse.  We opted for immediate seating at the bar and dove into the chips and salsa, which really can hold their own alongside the best in Phoenix. Couldn't order guacamole without tomatoes (my wife is allergic), but the fresh Dos Equis Lager drafts made up for it.  I got the pollo fundido, grilled chicken smothered in cheese and cream sauce. Other restaurants add some spice to their fundido, but I had to make do with a single smoked jalapeno served on top. While the sides of noodles and black beans were piping hot, the entree was approaching lukewarm, and the accompanying tortillas barely held together. Still, I was craving something along the lines of Macayo's Baja Burro, so I enjoyed the fundido in spite of the temperature issues.  The bartenders were friendly enough, but the place lacks the upbeat vibe of a place like Macayo's. Chalk it up to the average age of the patrons or the awkward parking situation.  I live close enough to this Aunt Chilada's that I'm sure I'll be back. Next time, I hope it's just for drinks and chips. If I have to eat dinner, though, it's definitely not the worst.

O6bTyCGn3M3sGt8_sVfZuA.text: I read all the bad reviews but still decided to give them the benefit of the doubt and go eat there. Bad idea. The food was terrible. Please do yourself a favor and listen to the bad reviews. They are all True.

S7mvSyYJ9mzzHxjMYbP4JQ.text: The soup was bland, the chips were soaked in oil, the salsa tasted sour. I will not go back. The waitress spoke little english and talked too fast to understand her.

DVdnZUCk8amxBP-5jO_Oyw.text: Yuck. Just yuck. Bland. Left most of it there as did every table around us. The Don Julio margarita was watery and tasteless so my husband exchanged it for a bloody mary (also bland).  Not only did the charge us for both drinks they charged us double!

tPQPYD9OAIUyOR_8MIHIew.text: We tried this restaurant because we love the Scottsdale location. Unfortunately this location pales in comparison. Our service was slow and the food was only ok. We won't be going back

yCrjX5IVwtjrUZlLCOI0Eg.text: I decided to try this place while in Tempe, based mostly on reviews on Yelp and another media.  I was greeted by a surly young man who may have awakened on the wrong side of the universe.  I asked for a well-lit area, and he seated me near a window.  Daylight was fast fading, as I was quickly served homemade chips and salsa.  The salsa was uninspired and bland.  The server, Samuel, was prompt and made a couple of recommendations.  I tried the pork fajitas.  By now the sun was down, and when the food arrived, it was so dark at the table, I could barely distinguish the pork from the veggies.  It was good, but I like to be able to see my food.  The candles at the table were sorely inadequate.  I asked Samuel about the lighting, and he said only the manager can change it and he/she had gone home already.  I was the sole diner in that dining room, BTW.  There were others in another part of the restaurant that I could hear, but couldn't see.  I left over half of my meal there, just because I couldn't see any longer what it looked like.  Very disappointing.  I wouldn't return to this restaurant.

9AigG1zLt4EG9otRRtVRuw.text: The food is okay, though pricey. They know they are one of few choices for a resort, and the service reflects it. They wait staff could really care less.

UHPz1druuiB-WZUyIWl9JA.text: Showed up with a party of 5 at 7pm on a Tuesday night.  Was seated promptly and got chips and salsa quickly.  After 20 minutes no server showed up.  Went to hostess that seated us and told her.  No apology just turned to the back and left me standing there.  After another 10 minutes of eating chips and salsa we decided to leave.  Passing the hostess I told her that we were going somewhere else to eat.  She smiled sweetly and told me to have a nice evening.  I asked to speak to a manager.  Manager made no apology but did explain that the server in my area was new but wouldn't be around for long.  I asked what good that would do me now.  She said no good.  Worst experience ever!  Have been going here with visitors for years and have never been treated so poorly.  No one apologized but I guess someone would have to care  before apologizing.

KSg501vab-mdEUKsz0wjxw.text: My friend suggested we celebrate my friend's birthday here.  What a mistake.  The table was akward for 8 people to see each other but hey, we didn't make a reservation. The sad part is that two of us ordered the fajitas (including the birthday gal).  The food arrived and sat next tto our table for well over 5-minutes.  By the time the waitress came to serve our food, it was cold (although we commented on how when the fajitas had first arrived they were not making a sizzling sound).   The waitress appeared upset that we were wanting our food at least worm vs. cold.  She took it to the kitchen and brough back fajitas that had been stuck in the over.  Food was HOT but now way overcooked.  I wont' be returning  to this place anytime soon -- with some many other great choices, i'm sorry my friedn chose this restaurant.

bDs3WIQLxSNobkq1_WzFIw.text: Pretty good.  Pretty good.  I got a lunch combination with the standard stuff (taco, enchilada, and tamale).  I wasn't a fan of the tamale.  It was too dried out.  The taco and enchilada were really good.  It says that everything is made in house.  It's a shame that  I won't be able to return too soon since I'm rarely in the Phoenix area, which may be a good thing in itself.

MGOSXvBMcPQzlM4mN2gdOA.text: The staff was friendly.  The food was okay.  Salsa was acceptable.  We sat in the dining room across the courtyard, which is what really ruined the meal.   It was difficult to enjoy anything in a room with such an over powering smell of mildew.

bXQVCyuha1TVZIKxS9oLYg.text: This sorry shithole really could only survive in Touristville adjacent to the resort. Good God! I actually felt like my wallet got gang-raped for the experience: one dinner + one quesadilla appetizer + three margaritas = $60. What in the hell is that!? It would be one thing if the food was amazing.... but the so-called green chilis in my quesadilla were cut up raw mild boring jalapenos that added absolutely zero to the food (but cost an extra $2). The poor downtrodden quesadilla soon sweated an enormous pool of grease, which soaked its entire underside, rendering it inedible. One of my friends passed around a guac appetizer, and the raw onions in there would either put hair on your chest or singe it clean off, not sure which. Blech!  I will add a 1/2 star because the margaritas were tasty. Either they used high end tequila, or there was no booze at all in there. For the price, I would hope it was nice tequila. Clearly, since I can't really tell either way, there wasn't much in there. I could also go so far as to add a half star for the ambiance. Total old-school Arizona touristy kitsch, and the patio was very nice for our group gathering. However, with the preponderance of wonderful places with outdoor seating, I doubt the patio alone would ever lure me back. See ya at Los Dos!

U8BTnvuO4-gaXcU23ZWr4g.text: To start off our evening the chips and salsa weren't very good; salsa had no spice at all.  I ordered the Ocho (#8), which was a chile relleno and a spinach enchilada with a jalapeno cream cheese sauce. The chile relleno was pretty good while the spinach enchilada was a little crispy and the spinach almost seemed partially frozen. The rice and beans were alright at best with the beans lacking much flavor. The Staff was friendly and service was pretty quick. We were surprised to have to wait 30 min to be seated at 8pm on a Wednesday night.

8Z0s88gGphbO4VTpXu24NQ.text: This place is aggravating.  I think it's because when you hear of Mexican food in the Phoenix Metro area... this is place ALWAYS gets mentioned... and WHY?? ugh, aggravating!  And then you go... and are like "Okay... I can see it, the duck pond is purty." and then u enter and are stared at by every half drunk person in the bar and are then shown to your table. It's a little busy and people seem to be enjoying themselves.... alright, another good sign of goodness to come. The chips and salsa are even decent....   and then the server comes. And she can BARELY speak a word of English... you try and try and still can't understand her and then u just give up and point to the menu like you're some drunken college student stopping off at Denny's before heading back to the dorm after a CRAZY night at the frat house!   She writes some stuff down and then after what feels like an eternity, she plops down a HUGE plate of whatever you ordered and all it's rubbery good-less. *shudders*  yup, aggravating.   You try and try and become convinced that something isn't right. You think, what IS that flavor?? Nana never made anything that tasted like THAT!! But alas, your efforts are in vain... that's the horrifying facts of this would be chain. It's 90% processed foods. It's not that good. And it's what I call "safe" Mexican food. and it's very tourist friendly, it IS right next to a resort! And for some strange reason, it makes the list of places to dine when hankering for "authentic" Mexican food.  Yup... aggravating.

qpBzYGKAVEgI8ytHdWq01w.text: Nice patio seating but didn't like having to see straight into the dirty kitchen every time the door opened. We waited a long time for someone to take our order, and even longer for the food to arrive and it was cold when it finally did. Not good! Waitress was apologetic although the problems were not entirely her fault. Overpriced for this kind of menu.

y7es8_2bhsmc4tKEWJ4HBg.text: Food is maybe slightly above average in my opinion.  I have always had great service, however.  Reliable place to go if you're in the area.  It makes my husband's trips to Fry's Electronics across the street more tolerable for me.  Last time we went, we were seated in a separate building on the other side of the patio.  Was very nice and relatively quiet.  I'm not overly fond of the patio since Baseline is so busy.  I do prefer the Aunt Chilada's on Dreamy Draw-both the food and the atmosphere.  But I'm sure I'll be back to this location again.  Damn computer geeks.

qDCI2jylPOA2elsoKaA-FQ.text: The food is decent, but a word of advice.  Never sit outside if you see ducks out there.  Case and point - I met my ex there for lunch.  The ducks were very active about leaving their droppings on the porch area where we were sitting.  When someone startled one of the ducks, it flew, dropping a bomb on the table next to us.  If you eat inside, it's not so bad.  They really need to do something about the ducks though.

ffFtOKclW6v4H3dS1FhIHA.text: Was looking forward to authentic Mexican food... The Guacamole was fresh out of a package topped with pre-shredded generic cheese and black olives fresh from a can. Fresh avocados are not hard to come by right now. Veggies on the side were right out of the freezer. Also the bar had a line and only one bartender for the entire restaurant. They might soon be on an episode of Restaurant Impossible if it weren't for the ever changing customer base that comes from the Arizona Grand and other surrounding resorts.

77ctJsQojfMKNBEFkdwfaw.text: I recently visited for happy hour and I will be back whenever I'm in the area! The happy hour prices can't be beat! $4 house margaritas were just right and big! The food prices vary depending on the hour. We just made it before 4pm so our food was only $3! At 4pm it goes up to $4 and at 5pm it goes up to $5 which is still an awesome deal! The enchiladas were great! It comes with 2 normal size enchiladas and a little salad garnish. We mixed a chicken and cheese and the sauce was super yummy! I grew up in Southern California so I know my Mexican food. The chips and salsa were some of the best I've had. I may have gotten one semi-stale chip out of the huge bowl I ate. We also had a cheese crisp (which they don't have in CA) and although those are always a little plain for me normally, that excellent salsa slathered on there made it AWESOME! The bartender was cool and chatted with us as did a woman at the bar eating alone and one of the regulars was also very friendly. The bar is small, however, so I almost hate to let the word get out on this hidden gem because you better make room for me when I come back. The outdoor patio looked super fun & colorful to hang out on when the weather cools down. I enjoyed the ambiance of the whole place! I had intended on trying a chili relleno but I was too full on the happy hour bargains. I asked the bartender if there was chicken in it like one reviewer said and he said no. Everything we had was so good that I have no doubts the rest of the food is good. I can't wait to come back!

AXAzNIuYPDL0VsXO6Bqxkg.text: Aunt Chilada's at the Pointe is more about atmosphere than food.  It has a good happy hour, but the food is pretty pedestrian.  I was forced to edit and downgrade my rating because of my most recent visit.  Though the service was quite good, the food was horrific.   Was there again recently with some folks from work. It was chosen since it was close to the hotel our corporate visitors were staying. I decided to forgo the usual safe burro and try the chile relleno and the spinach enchilada. O...M...G...what a mistake.  The spinach enchilada consisted of a limp tortilla filled with frozen spinach and covered in a sauce that if it wasn't from a can was seasoned with tin...ha...ha. The relleno was stuffed with queso, breaded, deepfried, covered with the same tin flavored sauce, which in turn was then covered again with rubbery white cheese. Oh boy!  What a treat!  After this meal I have made a vow to never to stray from a burro here again.   So, if you plan on getting together with a big group for Happy Hour, Aunt Chilada's is an OK choice.  If you are looking for truly top flight Mexican food, there are other places that may be more appropriate.

K7830rvp7vxgFXIV1UblWg.text: I'm being grumpy because I have had far worse food. I drank water that tasted like my swimming pool. Chips obviously not fresh. Salsa tasted like canned tomatoes.  my Chili renno was not bad. Rice and beans not bad. Overall I enjoyed the meal. But for Arizona this place is lame. Also server had the personality of a cartel thug

M1HZB3rj_o4MJdi5GMMPiQ.text: This was the first time we had eaten at this restaurant, and have to say - we are SO glad we did.  There were 3 of us, and I got my usual dish I get at most mexican restaurants, enchiladas.  I had 1 shredded beef, and 1 shredded chicken - and they had probably the best flavor I have had since being in Puerto Vallarta.  The service was great, and the atmosphere is amazing.

FcaiTc1R5Hyn1RJM6CNmAA.text: Not even worth my time to write a full review. Chicken is very dry, prices are high, service is terrible, and they got rid of the flower tortilla chips. Stay away.

ZfoFQ2SrJrEx3wjE46DfXw.text: Our server was wonderful and described multiple dishes to us.  Her recommendations were wonderful.  The food was plentiful and great.

DJtl1NOqe_pXOo89sJVB5g.text: The best thing about this restaurant is the waitress Marcia. if it wasn't for her then we would never go back. she is so kind and pleasant and thoughtful and attentive and the list goes on and on. we only go when she's there and we only sit in her section she takes care of all of our needs and more. we love her and we love the food and when she's not there we walk right back out she is their biggest asset and she deserves a raise and a bonus and a plaque on the wall I love Marcia I love this restaurant

7CpEl5YBgVXomroY8qkZrQ.text: Went with a small group for a weekday lunch.  Server was very friendly and prompt with drinks and chips but didn't come back to take our orders for a very long time.  I had a chicken chimi, it was all white meat and plenty of it and it was HUGE.  Decent place for lunch.

uhKGca6j86B_tCFDYoRHYw.text: Was like eating Mexican food in Sun City. Bland without creative texture or flavor. Drinks very week 99% mix.

rie3ZnWZw1aYif2umGEIEQ.text: Service was pretty good, however they have Pepsi, boohoo! Salsa was tasty but the chips were stale. They ambiance was bright, colorful, nice patio...food was a 3 out of 5, however it's a Lil pricey for what you get. One beef taco with rice and beans is $11. Steak fajitas are $17. Would I try this place again? Eh probably not.

lJ4DdrL-65O03b8UnBbVgw.text: My husband and I had our first date here together. For our 1 year anniversary we came back and we couldn't help but brag a little to our waiter. She thought it was so cool that she brought out a little chocolate cake for us, free of charge. It was a huge serving and very tender and smooth.   This would be good for a wedding reception as their banquet room next to the restaurant is huge. They skimped big time on the bar. It's a sad little nook to the side, hardly elbow room at the puny stool table.   And oh yeah - the food is kinda bland here. Just your average Mexican restaurant that seems to thrive only on account of it being off the I-10.

sXE-tx9nf42Dt2tYKA1jyw.text: I'd give this place 2.5 stars. The black beans and rice were very good, but my entree - the chile relleno - was lacking. It was smothered in delicious cheese and the fried breading was just ok. I'm not sure what the pepper was stuffed with, but it didn't really taste like anything.   I ordered the Patron margarita with liqueur and lime juice  because I dislike the house kind that comes from a mix, but this one still didn't taste 100% homemade (like they cut it with a little mix or something). The chips and salsa were just ok.   This place is nice for it's convenient location next to the Arizona Grand, but I was a little disappointed by my visit. Good I suppose if you want very Americanized Mexican fare.

rwS4aA1MFNWAC54KpVzkDg.text: Margaritas were weak.   Service was slow. Food was OK, but not worth the steep prices.

hUVcqlkJ-1UopL6bhyK0Jg.text: I dined here once on a date. Needless to say, the date that evening went south. Anyhow, I found the service here average and the time to receive our meal was unusually long -like 20 minutes. The food was fairly bland and not very flavorful and the chips and tortillas seemed to not be very fresh. However, the one redeeming factor is their quesadillas are huge and they don't skimp on the cheese.   This place is fairly average and you won't impress any dates here. But if you need some Mexican food near Arizona Mills, it's alright.

NGebPQ_F0OTr8DsZmuRKrQ.text: Disappointed to see the bad reviews, because this place is really good. Still one of my favorite Mexican places in Phoenix. I've been dining here for 6 years, since it's down the street from our office, and it's still a great place to go for a quick lunch or after work cocktails.   The service here is friendly, attentive and quick. I made a reservation for lunchtime for a party of 8 and we were in and out of there in under an hour! The food was served hot and delicious. And the best part was they treated our co-worker with a birthday cake, which we laughed at, because the lunch was set up because he was leaving our company. We had played along anyway and he enjoyed his delicious flan birthday treat.   I've tried many dishes here and they are all so good. The pollo fundido is delicious and the burritos will last you for days because they are huge portions. But my favorite part of the dish is the pinto beans and rice. So good! And the nachos are always served hot and the most flavorful salsa in town.   It's not in the most desirable locations, but well worth a visit if your in the South Mountain area.   The outdoor patio is not the best, I'll have to agree. The seats are pretty low and there seems to be birds feeding from the berries in the trees, because we would constantly get hit by a berry and at one point a bird pooped on our menu. So try to get a seat in the patio away from the entrance and the large tree sitting there. But on a beautiful spring day, it's the perfect place to be to watch the sunset and enjoy a margarita!

tZFVYqEu8ZbsD6KbAwcJLA.text: Haven't been here in almost 20 years, thought I'd give it a second try. Wish I hadn't. It took forever for the food to come out, and the salsa tasted like ketchup. Our server was nice. When the food finally came out, they forgot components of some of the dishes. Street tacos were boring - had better tacos at any of the 'bertos. My buddy had the fajitas and he said the chicken was so dry and tasteless he couldn't even eat it. To boot, it was way overpriced, probably because they are connected to the Arizona Grand resort. Half my party got sick later that night. Horrible experience, and not much has changed in 20 years.

ue-EOGSrNUCh9hN24AcO7w.text: Well I would recommend not eating there, drink are great. My enchiladas were cold, the cheese wasn't melted, the fish tacos weren't good.

uZaKvu3hSQ0o-qzPR_1AzQ.text: First of all, I must say, Connor is by far the most wonderful server I have ever had. Second, this is the most tasty and high-quality mexican food in the area.   When we first arrived at said restaurant, our wonderful server by the name of Connor greeted us warmly with a big smile (and very charming dimples). The young man took us to a nice table by the windows that overlooked the pond, where we captured the moments of young ducklings following their parent ducklings. Very serene moments to enhance our dining experience.  Connor took our drink orders: I asked him about each of the margaritas, and proceeded to choose the "Sangria-rita", a creative collaboration of sangria and a margarita. It was very tasty, Connor made a great recommendation. My two friends each got the house margaritas; one frozen, one on the rocks; and only one with salt. Surprisingly, despite how busy the restaurant was (it was about 15 after 5p.m.), Connor returned with our margaritas almost immediately. Go Connor! *High-five*  Next, Connor informed us about the table-side guacamole, which we decided to order. He came back with an entire set-up: about four avocados, diced onion, cilantro, tomato, lemon and lime, salt and pepper, and some cheese for the cheese lovers out there (I do not prefer cheese in my guacamole). He made the guacamole exactly to our preferences and held a wonderful conversation with us the entire time. Such a dapper young man!  We proceeded to order our entrees, which were also delicious. Connor recommended the chicken chimichangas and the beef enchiladas, which were both incredible and served sizzling hot.   Overall, we were very pleased with our experience. We especially loved our server, Connor; who not only made sure we enjoyed our dinner, but our experience as a whole. If you ever go dine there, ask for Connor. He has strawberry-blonde hair, dimples, eyes as blue as the water surrounding the restaurant, and a wonderful smile.  Next time we are on this side of town, we will undoubtably be visiting this location again (and requesting Connor as our server)! Loved our experience.

7TDObbMmwao0YZNv3X1qOw.text: What a great place! We went with a party of 9 tonight and had the best service. Chips and salsa were out quickly and the margaritas were on par. My favorite part of the meal were the fish tacos. They are amazing! The sauce on the tacos was delicious! Thanks for the great service and food! We will be back!

3pf3r2Xs6m5CodoDLXSNDw.text: I don't know where to begin! Way Over priced for the quality of food! We decided to give this place a shot since we are staying at the Resort and didn't want to go too far tonight since we had a long day! I wish we had! The food is Terrible!!!! I I ordered pollo fundido and it had no flavor ! Boiled chicken breast covered in a cream sauce with cheese. I picked steamed veggies and black beans! The provided refried black beans when I was hoping for whole and the veggies were over cooked and bland! Salsa is not good at all and tortillas were not fresh!   My husbands carne Asada was horrible as well!  Do not bother!!!

DSrvxmhekaeW2eO3K_cy-w.text: I've been eating here for literally decades and enjoying it and, in fact, when I was there in March, it was a really good experience.  My husband and I ate here last night however, and I will NEVER, EVER go back.  Where to start... Wow.  The server was obviously very agitated because she had too many tables and it was awful, terrible, horrible service.  The Mexican shrimp cocktail, which I loved 4 months ago, was so on-fire spicy that I couldn't eat it (I *love* spicy food, not a wimp at ALL).  Almost everything was heavily over-spiced, whether it was too hot, too salty, etc.  We literally left about 85% of our food uneaten and the server didn't ever even check with us to see if the food was OK or if we needed anything.  She picked up the full dishes without even asking if anything was wrong.    Ugh.  I could go on with a huge list of what was awful about this experience but I guess saying that the food was awful, the service was awful, and the ambiance was awful probably says it all.  I know that the Arizona Grand resort owns this location now (not sure how long that has been the case), and I don't know if that's what happened here but I will definitely never be back.

5jU4Ri8-tOrrxj2gw0BaKw.text: I went here for an event and I was not impressed by the food. The guacamole was tasteless, the beef flautas tasted like chicken and was extremely salty, the chicken chimichangas were another salt bomb, the refried beans didn't have much taste and the cheese enchiladas were probably the only thing that tasted somewhat decent (just tasted liked cheese). The service was nice and the place is colorful, but the food was terrible.

Rb32GlnAPEIJ_CKd90mGiA.text: Great service and really good food. I had the ceramic bowl.  Mollachatahy.  Can't spell it.  Was great. Folks at my table had enchiladas. Nice ambiance. Must visit when in Tempe.

Rr3sD6iKNkbT8XZxkPafPQ.text: We have been to this location a few time, this was the first time we were sat in the dinning room on the other side of the patio. It was very nice, quite and good air conditioning. Three of us in our party this trip. Our waiter was Ryan B., good service, not very chatty but attentive. We started with chip & salsa and a few San Tan Hopshock's. For dinner: Chili Relleno: Stuffed with Jack cheese W/rice & black beans Carne con Chile burrito deep fried W/ refried beans & rice Beef burrito deep fried W/ refried beans & rice  All the food was hot and tasted great.

vynjlLN0RkoTqdRpJu5x5g.text: Always like the atmosphere. The water going in, the patio is really a great place to take family members when they are down on vacation. Service is usually good, some servers are better then others the two veteran ladies are awesome if you get them. They are knowledgeable and give A service the new ones could learn from them. Food is good and they have a nice tequila selection.

yn1CQlshze3q23_5dUmXgA.text: My food was good, I had fish tacos. No complaints. My server, Lucas M. was really really good, just making sure to get us everything we needed, six of us in our party. I felt like he wanted my meal and visit to be very pleasant, and it was.

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chilada's - Tempe, AZ, United States. 2 Fish tacos, rice, and black beans.

NpMnO_0WYHk4dKI18dLFqQ.text: Great food. We had an awful server who tried to "cut off" our non-intoxicated friend from drinking because he went to the bar to get our drinks after waiting 15 min. But the manager Brandon was amazing!!! He did everything he could to try to make our visit right and enjoyable.  Thank god for Brandon for really caring about his customers! We will return and hope for a different server.

ikpN5G5zgFIaWvrJjU0Gdg.text: So in love with the queso dip. I could have jist eaten that all night long.  We were told Wait time was 40 min. But we got seated after only 15 min. Woot Woot! The shredded chicken tacos were legit

Wfm0uHEpPWHU6fgmDw97Vg.text: I don't understand the negative reviews about this place.  We stopped here at about 8:30 on a Monday night, as we were traveling through to Tucson.  The staff was very friendly and attentive, even though we unknowingly showed up close to closing time.  The restaurant was nearly empty, so there was no wait time.  The food was amazing!!  Everything we ate was delicious.  I am originally from Southwest New Mexico and am very picky about Mexican food.  This place was right up there with the best of the best, in my opinion.

O8viF4FKrwhWjc_yB6Eb3A.text: My review:  Please understand that I am a hard rater.  I rarely award more than 3 stars.  My definition of 3 stars is a good, solid meal with good service.   The food here was just okay and the prices are high.  The staff was friendly and attentive however my entree arrived 1 minute after my soup arrived.  Poor planning on my servers part.  Tonight I had the three enchilada plate and corn with chorizo soup.  I am not a fan!  I haven't been here in several years.  Now I remember why.

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chilada's - Tempe, AZ, United States

tqZSDLgfNpZuYew_4OUjdg.text: If you want slow service & decent food for an expensive price this is the place to go! Food was decent but there's better places for less money. Try popos fiesta Del sol.

f77LlaYBeE98rEb_TvTbpQ.text: I was pleasantly surprised by aunt chilada's. I usually steer clear of restaurants that my fellow yelpers rate so low. However, it was my friend's birthday and this is where she choose. I started out with a rum runner that was very much on the pricy side, $9. It was strong, I wasn't expecting to get half my money's worth but I definitely did.  The chips were brought out quickly and I was given a mild salsa and a spicy salsa. They were both really good. That's always my favorite part of Mexican restaurants.  I'm not always a fan of Mexican food unless it's authentic. Most places, are too Tex mex for my liking. I ordered the special, a 6 oz steak with a cheese enchilada, black beans, and rice. I ate it all. It could have been the rum runner, but this was by far one of the best Mexican places I've eaten at.  They also brought out a free birthday dessert with a candle that was delicious and big enough to share. The service was good, but it's a bit too pricy for what you get. I think because  it's so close to the Arizona grande resort they price gouge. We didn't have reservations, but it was only two of us. It looked big enough to accommodate big groups and had many tables. The patio tables look lovely when if starts to cool downs.

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chilada's - Tempe, AZ, United States. Birthday dessert
Photo of Aunt Chilada's - Tempe, AZ, United States. Steak, cheese enchilada special.

uIHs8TzZ0ujWIR2kKURFLg.text: First, what I liked: the atmosphere is very colorful and cheerful. The server was efficient and the manager who seated us tried his best to find a quiet table for us (didn't find one, but he tried). What I didn't like: the restaurant is loud. The coffee was instant coffee! Yuck. The food was bland. And the worst part, the cost is pricey. I will go to Barrio Queen from now on when I want Mexican food and great coffee. However, Barrio Queen is as noisy. Both restaurants require a megaphone to hold a conversation at your table.

TBzyr9erhm-EAyoOuMWA3A.text: Just went to Aunt Chilada's yesterday while staying at the Arizona Grand and it was a great experience. Although there were plenty of tables inside and outside that were available when we arrived, but we waited for nearly half an hour to be seated. But at least they had a waiting area with chips and salsa for us to eat while we waited. Once we finally were seated though the service was really good and we had a very nice waiter. The scenery outside was very cool and i loved all of the colored tables, chairs, etc. There also were a family of ducks that were just walking around outside that the employees told us were always there. Before we ordered food we were brought chips and salsa that you could tell was freshly made that I very much enjoyed. I ordered an shredded chicken enchilada and it can with a side of rice and refried beans. It was very good and very filling. They give you a very decent amount of food for what you pay. But overall I would recommend this restaurant and the overall experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chilada's - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Aunt Chilada's - Tempe, AZ, United States

dXVfcXHnMNSRRO_mSKS2Bw.text: One hour wait at 5pm on a Wednesday night. Surely you can't be serious?!? And don't call me Shirley!!!  Bait and switch on happy hour, what eves!!! We bailed and went to an amazing Thai Restaurant off the reservation

NIjMSl6LSAxharXlGfX0Tg.text: Well after having this place hyped up on our drive in I was very excited to go there my very first evening in town.  My wife, two friends, and I wandered over and were met with a 20 minute wait which I thought was a good sign.  My wife and one friend ordered specials while the other two of us ordered the three taco meal. The score ended up with the specials winning but the tacos did not. My tacos were LUKE warm and very dry like they had been sitting too long. The double stacked corn tortillas couldn't hold up and fell apart.  Extraordinarily disappointed.  Having been a westerner and now an easterner I was looking forward to really good Mexican. This didn't get me there.

U6aXcWxcH3KKzWApeqS3ww.text: Came here with my niece for lunch and the hostess decided to sit us in the next building right next to a huge party that was extremely loud. Asked her to move us to another area so that we could hear ourselves talk. She seemed a little upset on the ask. By again we are the customers that are choosing your establishment. Then we waited for about 10 mins before we were approached by our server who told us she would be back in a moment. Waited another 5 mins before she came back. Took our drink order and then was gone again. Waited another 5 mins for our drinks(she did not have that many tables and lost of them we're leaving). Dropped off drinks and then said would be back for our food order. Waited another 10 mins for her to come back and take that. Both the appetizer and our meal came out at the same time. After she asked us if we wanted the appetizer first?? The food was very bland and very clean overpriced. The salsa was not up to par or the chips. I have been to better Mexican restaurants than this and now I remember why I never came back the last time I tried this place out. Has potential but definitely not worth it when there is hella lot better restaurants than this place and not overpriced. The price and service and atmosphere alone shouldn't even get 2 stars.

orHLx8XbWGY7i7NLsj_3Yg.text: I was in such a good mood to write something positive, after all it was 80 degrees, sunny and we were sitting outside on the colorful patio pretending it was summer instead of the 10 degrees we left back home in Minneapolis.  On the positive side our server stopped by our table right away with a huge bowl of crispy chips and two large bowls of salsa. We ordered two patron margaritas that came pretty quickly and were good, although clearly not made with fresh juice.  As for the food, its a bit on the mass market side in terms of taste and flavor and certainly not the authentic Mexican I was hoping for.  Perhaps I've just gotten spoiled by the number of great new places serving fresh exciting Mexican food.  If you have kids and are looking for something mild, then this could be the place.

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chilada's - Tempe, AZ, United States. Hot or mild salsa with your chips?

_zDb54SkJncGSGU9eyamUQ.text: The food was good the beverages were goid but the service was terrible.  The waitress we has was snobby and stand offish.  When I asked about a dish or drink she said. "I don't know"  and that's it.  So the food and drinks get 5 starts but the service gets 1 star

eUQWRkmtI5FOWlrazBumWQ.text: Food is subpar- along w service. Ordered a 16$ marg for 2. He asked if I want it frozen or on the rocks when I ordered. Said on the rocks. Little did I know that it changed the price from 16 to 28. HA. Asked and instead of honoring the mistake and reducing the price he was unwilling to help.

giauQ2Zs5AY17dSeSaektg.text: Lovely outdoor patio and the best Mahi Mahi street tacos I've ever had! I mixed the hot salsa with the mild for a perfect blend (for a northerner) and ate more light salty chips than I should have. I'm here all week for work and will be back!!

5bs01sxDJLk9-FZd8NVPbQ.text: Surprised this only has 2.5 stars. Clean. Sweet ambience with a fountain feature and great patio. Our server was VERY sweet, attentive and prompt. Our whole family thought it was delicious. I had the street tacos-mahi, carnitas and carne asada-the marinade was amazing on all 3, tortillas hand made and ingredients were fresh. My husband and sister in law had the chimichanga and devoured it, mother in law loved the chicken tortilla soup. We ordered sopas for dessert, and they are made fresh and hot so they accommodated my request to leave off the cinnamon & sugar.  Overall food and service were fantastic. I left off one star only because the prices are higher than most Mexican places, but the portions were HUGE, and my street tacos had a ton of meat on each one.

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chilada's - Tempe, AZ, United States. Sweet little patio, fountain feature in front

6KRr0uy0jQZOfesV8ULXFA.text: A resultant should smell like food when you walk in, right? I am only giving this restaurant one star because it is one of the selections I have to make.  The back part of the chair fell off when my mom went to seat on it.  The service was good but the quality of the food was extremely basic. The food tested like something that was heated up and served.

eRzN9LLeBv_XKOsnI1o4SA.text: Recently discovered that the refried beans and green tomatillo sauce are not vegetarian! Refried beans are made with lard, and tomatillo sauce has a chicken stock base. Extremely disheartening but the food is still great!  Black beans are veggie friendly, and if you're looking for an additional side, they have roasted vegetables.

U4WQsdZTNXZv7T6V67XHuA.text: My wife and I ate dinner there a couple of nights ago.  The service was great.  The food was some of the best Mexican food I have eaten anywhere.  The beer is cold and the Margaritas are superb.  The sauces were great.  The prices are very reasonable.  I shall go here again and again.  The only reason I did not give it five stars, is that I reserve that rating for after I have been to a restaurant at least 3 times with the same results.  Do yourself a favor and try this place.

A7BrkVTtmsZkYeRDYE86yw.text: Terrible food and service. The resort refers us to go down and have dinner and tells us that will be a 45 minute wait, over an hour and 10 minutes later they seat us it takes another 20 minutes to get our drink order we order our food and hour later they forgot one persons item at the table the other food was so over cooked and terrible we had to send it back waited another 45 minutes for the replacement. Then received our check and ask them to split it and they charged all the wrong items on the wrong card took them two additional times to complete. 3 1/2 hours worth of dining that we will never get back.     Would not recommend this location!

FcqgF7Vy2eyUpy5i_0IEUA.text: We were staying at the Arizona Grand Resort and decided to give this a try!   Good margs and atmosphere.   Food was rather expensive for what it was but we are from Texas and have a bajillion Tex-mex places, this is not Chuys if you're looking for that.

XxdYNhTFbMG_rJt_q2o59A.text: Rude greeting. Manager a bit abrasive when informing us that it was a 30 min wait to be seated outside. Instead sat us at the "kiddie room" upfront. Filthy floors with crushed chips and food residue. Bus boy decided, in the middle of attempting to have a conversation, vacuumed the floor with a very loud 1972 big ole Hoover vacuum! Waited 10 mins just to order water and chips. Still no service! Nope had enough, I'm outta here! Terrible because it was my first time and I really wanted to try this place after driving 25 mins to go!

U9gLtK86OTbrcECqjSEMow.text: We lived in Phoenix in the 1980s-1990s, moved away, and now are back.   Aunt Chilada's was one of our favorites then and were eager to return.   I was not disappointed!   We were there after the lunch rush on a Friday afternoon and got top-notch service and happy hour specials.   The food was very delicious.   I ordered then tamale and it was so much larger than what I'm used to.   The rice was perfect and the received beans were smoky. The salsa and chips were fresh and tasty.   I recommend sitting outside if the weather permits.   It had great ambiance with all the plants and ponds.

Vvb_xiQ7TOuABQPMkNPxvQ.text: Food was mediocre. Steak was warm and under cooked. We had to send it back. The 40 minute wait ended up being and hour and 20 minutes. Maybe it had to due to the fact that they were catering an 80th birthday party, but still they should have a backup plan. On the upside, the fideo was delish!

OIglPaM70IlnXMl6nw4AFQ.text: Large Portions of Standard American Mexican Food This is a very regular Mexican restaurant, no flavors you can't find everywhere. The food was good, but considering the location, I expected something better. I ordered Aunt Chilada's Special with Charro Beans and Fideo. As described in the menu, it included a "Flour Tortilla Filled with Red Chile con Carne, Topped with Red and Green Sauce and Cheese, Served with Sour Cream and Guacamole." Mine came with refried beans and rice, not the charro beans and fideo. The waiter brought me a side of charro beans, but I didn't ask him for the fiedo after I tasted them. They reminded me of day-old spaghetti. The atmosphere is good, as were the drinks, and the service was mostly very good.

RVBHXB2PVEboKzdMa31iJw.text: Came here for Cinco de Mayo festivities. Great atmosphere, beautiful outdoor seating, delicious food & margaritas.

dTfpQXlBS4Mle-yzhEZB1g.text: Great atmosphere.  Outdoor seating is quaint with romantic lighting.  Tableside guacamole is amazing.  The Pollo Fundido did not disappoint and my taste buds highly recommend pairing your meal with the Fideo and Charro beans.  I've also had the opportunity to taste the Steak Tampiquena and I find it very typical for Mexican restaurants to prepare their skirt steak in a manner that does not break down the connective tissues.  The taste was as expected, marvelous.  Of course the staff was awesome and very attentive.

WlipeKS6BaJ6cV9bwRic-g.text: Service was slow and the food expensive. The portions were big but the quality wasn't worth the price.

Jmve__9nkO4bXJZGq_jcMA.text: Pass by this place daily and decided to give it a try one afternoon for lunch. Not sure why they don't have a higher rating. We were not seated promptly, and it wasn't super busy doing the week, so I don't know know what the delay was.  Fajitas, a chimichanga and two margaritas became our lunch. The dishes both came with well seasoned and rice and the chimi also came with black beans.  The chips and salsa brought before the entrees included both a spicy and chunky type. Both were awesome.   Wait staff was professional and had no issues. Food and drinks came out as ordered and was great.

R_K1yWuimD0CiKh-0-nNcg.text: While enjoying our stay-ca at Arizona Grand Resort, we ventured off to Aunt Chilada's for dinner after the water park. We were seated after an average waiting time of 25 minutes. Our appetizers arrive quickly, the street corn was bursting with flavor! Although our actual meal was delayed, the service and compensation for the delay made the experience a positive memory. The entire table partook in the "birthday" dessert. Worth 4+stars

fDEJUrhbNtHv3EFjosidlQ.text: I was surprised to see the three stars on yelp considering how busy this place is, but three stars is right on the mark.     When I saw the sizzling molcajete on the menu, no reviews from previous diners would have stopped me. But when we arrived at 8:00 pm on a holiday weekend Sunday, the restaurant was less than half full after their rush hour. We thought we would be seated immediately, but us and three other parties ahead of us waited 45 min.   It immediately became apparent that the restaurant is poorly managed and understaffed, at least it is at 8:00pm. Although the servers and hostess were friendly and did what they could, the place was a disaster.  It appeared as though they hadn't staffed the restaurant appropriately for the holiday, or they let servers go home after the dinner rush.   The waiting area had dirty chips and salsa bowls everywhere and looked like no one had cleaned or picked up plates all night.   We waited patiently for 45 min for a table for 2 after they told us the wait was 25 min. Service was ok from our server. But the sizzling molcajete, which is one of their specialties, was not only not sizzling, it was cold in parts. Big disappointment.   I'm sure there is something that is good to eat here considering the huge crowds. Be sure you get a reservation otherwise the wait will be over an hour for dinner.

t8s3jdsZ35DHkSl21R0TVw.text: The food was terrible and super expensive. Service is horrible and overall terrible experience.    Came here for dinner and it couldn't have been worse. Everything was horrible tasting and super expensive. The asada salad I ordered was worse than the salad you get at McDonald's, and it cost a whopping $15. The service was non existent, we never saw our waitress ever! drinks not refilled at all.     Avoid!!

EtD8oNpwcmOzner-LOi8ZQ.text: First off the menu is crap and very limited and for the price, you might as well get Taco Bell. The service was horrible the waitress did not come to check on us until She provided the bill. I just don't see the point in paying a decent amount of money on such shit food

qA-l4WSTGcjjLwpECHlQPg.text: They need to hire more staff and check more on tables.  They need more vegetarian selections.  The water in the glass (which I had to stand up and flag waiter for) was moldy tasting. Wash your dispensers!!!  Hire and train staff.  The food was pretty good, but salad cut in giant chunks.

2S6r6UoV73ntbzKodeIezg.text: The appetizer platter we received was really good. Me and my husband enjoyed that. We also got chicken fitijas and was definitely not impressed but it. There was no flavor at all in the plate. Other than that it was okay. Would we eat again. Maybe. We were celebrating our 1 year anniversary so we tried it out

YgD3RdnTc5052ntoIOZgZQ.text: We celebrated Mother's day early. 5 mom's out for dinner with a wonderful waitress named Katie! She was a beautiful spirit, knowledgeable and very attentive to our needs. This waitress is the reason this restaurant is successful. I've lived here in the valley 17 yrs, this was my first visit but not my last. Great food and superb service 5/6/2018 @5pm.

d2-uMnvAAppj4sEU2XxOoQ.text: I went here for lunch today and was not impressed, although the service was great. Our waitress was friendly and easily split our check for the 6 of us at the table paying separately. There is no lunch menu so the prices were $11-18 per meal. The chips and salsa were delicious but the meal left more to be desired. I got the chicken tostada with refried beans and rice. The chicken was pretty bland and the rice and beans were just okay. I probably would only be back if they offered lunch prices or happy hour.

BPRntmGamq1oZ_zRQpMq7A.text: Oh dear god where do I start?! Oh with the less then stellar waitress I had the displeasure of dealing with! What an epic fail she was, if you can't handle a large party (of 6) then maybe you should let your mgr know and bail before you get in way to deep....as you did Saturday night! Let's start with the drink order...if you can't remember something...write it down...maybe then it wouldnt take 2 people and 3 attempts at getting it right..sprite vodka and grenadine...how you managed to get root beer out of any of that I will never Marsha, I will never know! Then you disappear before we order food! Finally get to order the rest of the drinks for the table (had to send 2 back..tasted awful) and some apps...then you were hard to find once again Marsha! Finally we were able to find you (yes...we went looking)and ordered the food some how from you not writing things down our order got messed up...go figure right?! Not such a great first impression...I'll stick to taco bell for my Mexican food from now on!

K7w_pWqfsyX64XZf86oteA.text: We had a great experience and really great food at Aunt Chilada's ... we're visiting and it was recommended to us by a local.  The food was great quality (the queso dip especially) and everyone (6 of us) all had different entrees and we all enjoyed the flavors.  I can't eat very spicy foods and this was all perfect.  The service (shout out to our waitress Ashley) was excellent!  She truly appreciated our business and had a vested interest in our dining satisfaction.   The only reason I didn't rate 5 stars was because it took a really long time for food to get to our table and we were one of only 3 tables in the restaurant.  I would go back again however ...and ask for Ashley as our server!

_fMot9W9EkPOAh6CXeF-iQ.text: We went to Aunt Chilada's hoping to get a lite lunch. We weren't that hungry but the place looked inviting from the street. Once inside the hostess greeted us with a smile so we were off to a good start. But its all downhill from here. We told her "two for lunch please". We noticed the high-top tables in the front area were empty yet she led us out the back of the building and into another building at a VERY small table against the wall that barely seats two. We were next to a party of 12 having some kind of business/lunch meeting. Very awkward. Our server came and without greeting us handed us the menus and asked for a drink order. We hadn't even looked at the menu yet. We both said water because she appeared to be in hurry, yet the place was not busy. We scanned the menu looking for the "Lunch" section. Nothing. Ok, she must have given us the wrong menu. When she returned I asked for the "Lunch" menu and she said "You have it, its the same as dinner." Ok, give us a minute. We looked at the party of 12 and their plates were HUGE. We didn't want a huge $50.00 lunch just something lite. So we decided to split one of their burrito dinners.  Even that was going to be too much food for lunch. We could tell the server was a little irked when we told her we were going to split the burrito dinner. The food came in about 3 minutes! So much for freshly prepared. She didn't bring an extra plate so we placed it in the middle and dug at it from both sides. Very bland!. Plate had more beans than rice. The tortilla chips were plain and unsalted. She came back with the check and I noticed there was a $1.00 charge on it for enchilada style. What??? Maybe that was for the extra plate we didn't get. We paid the check and left a small tip. Never going back.

baIY5TrvECmFVVivWsgo-A.text: We had a wonderful lunch at Aunt Chiladas! Great food, exceptional service and Ashley's table side guacamole was amazing!!! Thanks Ashley!

Q-UU54U7d7zvdjQD9Qt92w.text: I am from Virginia and loved how fresh and authentic the food was here, thank you for the wonderful service Tia!

xbCwUqTKmyu1KYk-cdVvcw.text: Food was good. Service was horrible. Waited over an hr for out food on a Thursday. (It was not that busy) Ben the bartender did make some good drinks.

za0UTaFDx2r_hZO8fe8Cxg.text: Food was pretty okay.  Good rice and beans. Service was lacking.  Took her almost 10 minutes to get to us the first time and she wasn't very pleasant.  If you can't handle a 6 table section (1 of the tables had 1 person 4 of them had 2 people and pretty sure one had already paid, plus our 3 people and then a table of 4), you shouldn't get one.  Thought some of the prices were a tad high for MExican food but it is at a resort.  Not sure if would go back just because of the service.

9i4LTq4HdUlVmguAN_2A-Q.text: The only thing going for it was that it was wide open, they put us in the corner of the courtyard and it was good for the children to run around.   The food was terrible. Even the salsa was not good. The chips were decent, thin and crispy.  I got the cheese dip, just ok. My wife's combo of chicken flauta and taco was not good. Even the rice and beans were not that good.  What do I expect from a resort restaurant. Should've known better... but it is convenient if you're staying at the Arizona Grand resort and have a very large group.  Not only that... that charge 20% gratuity for large groups!

WoALp9L_nMs5hSBpVKU0BA.text: We arrived on a Friday night at 6:15 and went into the lounge bar because it was a 15 to 20 minute wait for a table. The hostess indicated we could order food here. We sat for 20 minutes while several waitresses walked by us, served other tables, gave menus and got drinks for other people. When we finally asked the hostess for menus she said well we're very busy. After another 10 minutes with no service or acknowledgement we left.

D8BoXfzRdHNc2fZhlO0Jag.text: This place is awesome! If you're looking for fresh, authentic Mexican food, you will find it here! Friendly and attentive as well. Homemade salsa and chips are served complimentary when you first arrive. We also ordered guacamole, which was delicious, and my husband and I shared the molcajete which is an entree made for two. Comes with carne asada, chicken, and shrimp cooked in an amazing sauce with outstanding flavors. Tortillas and two sides are also served the with meal. Prices are reasonable too. We will be back!!

LozL393_pkG_jFlb6GZqig.text: I loved the ambiance and wonderful colorful patio. I judge all Mexican restaurants by their chili rellenos, and this one was a winner. Very fresh and flavorful. The service was attentive and helpful. The most exciting discovery was on the dessert menu. They have sopapillas!!!!! Having grown up eating the Mexican/New Mexican food in Colorado and New Mexico sopapillas were a special part of every meal. I was shocked when I found that California and Arizona do not follow that fabulous tradition. Hence, my 20+ year quest to find good sopapillas without having to drive to Santa Fe. To say I am delighted to find them 5 miles from my home is an understatement. For those unfamiliar, a sopapilla is a flaky piece of fried bread, puffed up into a pillow just perfect for drizzling honey inside. The sopapillas here were perfect. This makes a return visit to Aunt Child's a necessity. Treat yourself to great food and finish with the sopapillas!!!

1mDS0yq3o-80NS8D_OVTMw.text: Other than the high prices, this place is awesome! The food was delicious! Everyone that I was with during our experience here said their food was amazing and we will definitely come back for more. Again, however, the prices are a bit steep which is a shame because I know I can order the same meal for $4 to $5 less at other mexican restaurants.

kYfW374xWojSGx4r92sRTw.text: Say Uncle!!
